B-LOC 1996-08-23 B-ORG 's B-MISC striker B-PER I-PER is to wear his team sponsor 's name on the inside of his shirt so it can be seen when he scores . Every time he finds the net , the grey-haired forward pulls his shirtfront over his head as he runs to salute the fans , and B-ORG 's sponsors want to cash in on the spectacle . " Having seen B-PER celebrate his goals ... we thought it would be fun to have ( the name ) on the inside of his shirt , " a spokesman for the sponsors said . " It will give the fans something else to look at besides his chest . " B-PER aggravated a foot injury in the 1-0 defeat at B-ORG on Wednesday and was given only an even chance of playing at B-LOC I-LOC on Saturday by his manager B-PER I-PER . TENNIS - B-MISC ADVANCE AT B-MISC I-MISC . B-LOC 1996-08-22 It was B-MISC I-MISC at the $ 2 million B-MISC I-MISC on Thursday as three B-MISC reached the quarter-finals with straight-set victories . Unseeded B-PER I-PER recorded the most noteworthy result as he upset sixth-seeded B-MISC B-PER I-PER 6-2 6-1 in just 50 minutes . B-PER I-PER , who defeated B-MISC B-PER I-PER 7-6 ( 7-2 ) 7-6 ( 7-4 ) , and B-PER I-PER , a 6-3 6-4 winner over B-PER I-PER of the B-LOC I-LOC , also advanced and will meet in Friday 's quarter-finals . Third-seeded B-PER I-PER of B-LOC I-LOC defeated B-PER I-PER of B-LOC 6-4 6-4 after a three-hour evening rain delay and fifth-seeded B-PER I-PER of B-LOC won his third-round match , eliminating B-PER I-PER of the B-LOC I-LOC 6-3 6-4 . B-PER and B-PER play in a Friday night quarter-final . Two B-MISC , seventh seed B-PER I-PER and unseeded B-PER I-PER , will meet on Friday after winning matches on Thursday . B-PER overcame B-PER I-PER of B-LOC 2-6 6-2 6-4 and B-PER beat B-PER I-PER of B-LOC 6-3 2-6 6-3 . " If you really look at the match , " said the 12th-ranked B-PER after losing to the 70th-ranked B-PER , " I never really got a chance to play because he was serving big and getting in close to the net . " He was also able to handle my serve pretty easily because my ( first ) service percentage was only in the 40s . Put those two things together and you get a loss . " B-PER missed 10 weeks after wrist surgery earlier this year and the time away from tennis has given him a new perspective . " Before when I was on tour , I always felt I had to be in bed by 9:30 or 10 o'clock and I had to be up at a certain time , " B-PER said . " Now I can go to bed at at midnight or wake up at seven in the morning . I just do n't have as many set routines and it 's made me a happier person . " B-PER was pleased with his victory over B-PER , his first in five meetings with the 11th-ranked B-MISC . " It 's always difficult to win a match when you lose the first set , especially against someone you have never beaten , " he said . " I got more aggressive in the second and third sets and the wind picked up and that also affected things because B-PER definitely went off a little bit . " The 26-year-old B-PER , who won the B-MISC I-MISC stop in B-LOC I-LOC last week , has now won 18 of his last 20 matches , dating back to qualifying rounds in B-LOC I-LOC in late July . He ranks 76th after being 285th four weeks ago . " I feel I 'm hitting the ball well even though I 'm having more mental letdowns than I did last week , " B-PER said . " But I 'm still competing well . " " I got a lot of first serves in , " said B-PER about his victory over B-PER . " I did n't miss that many shots and he was making the mistakes . " Still marvelling at an exciting 64-stroke rally he won in the last game of his second-round match against B-PER I-PER of B-LOC on Tuesday , B-PER joked , " Today against B-PER there were about 64 strokes in the whole match . B-PER I-PER B-LOC 1996-08-23 B-LOC 's double B-MISC champion B-PER I-PER smashed her second world record in just 10 days on Friday when she bettered the mark for the women 's 1,000 metres . After breaking the world record for the women 's mile in B-LOC last Wednesday , the B-MISC 800 and 1,500 metres champion clocked two minutes 28.98 seconds over 1,000 at the B-LOC grand prix meeting . The B-MISC ate up the ground in a swift last lap to shave 0.36 seconds off the previous best of 2:29.34 set by B-LOC 's B-PER I-PER in the same stadium in August last year . Former world 800 champion B-PER pushed B-PER all the way , finishing second in 2:29.66 . But it was the B-MISC who picked up the bonus of $ 25,000 for the historic run in front of a capacity 40,000 crowd . B-PER dominated the middle-distance races at the recent B-MISC I-MISC following her return to competition this season after a three-year maternity break . In her first mile race at the richest meeting in B-LOC last Wednesday , she slashed 3.05 seconds off the previous record . The record of four minutes , 12.56 seconds in B-LOC earned B-PER a bonus of $ 50,000 plus one kilo of gold . After Friday 's performance the B-MISC will have earned well over $ 100,000 in less than a fortnight , taking her appearance money into account . B-LOC organisers had laid a new track for the meeting comparable to the surface at the B-MISC I-MISC but put down on a softer surface . B-PER clearly enjoyed it . B-PER looked threatening in the final 200 metres but the B-MISC found an extra gear to power home several strides ahead , pointing at the time on the clock with delight as she crossed the line . B-ORG his customary bright green outfit , the B-LOC champion clocked 10.03 seconds despite damp conditions to take the scalp of B-LOC 's reigning B-MISC champion B-PER I-PER , 1992 champion B-PER I-PER of B-LOC and B-MISC 1984 and 1988 champion B-PER I-PER . B-PER also beat world and B-MISC champion B-PER at the most lucrative meeting in the sport in B-LOC last week . The B-MISC , who finished fourth at the B-MISC I-MISC , was fast out of his blocks and held off B-PER 's late burst in the final 20 metres before heading off for a lap of celebration . The B-MISC was second in 10.09 with B-PER third in 10.10 , ahead of B-LOC bronze medallist B-PER I-PER who clocked 10.12 in fourth . B-PER , competing in what is expected to be his last major international meeting , finished fifth in 10.14 . B-PER , making a rare appearance in B-LOC in a sprint race , left the track with a slight limp . B-MISC I-MISC high hurdles champion B-PER I-PER defied the wet conditions to produce a brilliant 12.92 seconds in the 110 metres race , just 0.01 outside the world record held by B-LOC 's B-PER I-PER . B-PER ran the same time at the B-LOC B-MISC trials in B-LOC in June to become the second equal fastest hurdler of all time with B-MISC B-PER I-PER . He seemed to relish the new track at the B-LOC meeting , dominating the race from start to finish with a slight wind at his back . B-PER , the only man to have run faster , could not live with his speed , taking second in 13.24 seconds . The rain was pelting down when the women 's high hurdlers stepped up for their 100 metres race . But B-LOC 's B-MISC high hurdles champion B-PER I-PER , who crashed out of last week 's meeting in B-LOC after hitting a hurdle , also kept her footing perfectly to win in a fast 12.60 seconds . B-MISC silver medallist B-PER I-PER of B-LOC could finish only fifth in the race in 12.95 . B-MISC B-ORG champion B-PER I-PER took second in 12.77 ahead of B-MISC B-PER I-PER . The B-LOC fall cost B-PER a shot at a jackpot of 20 one-kg gold bars which can be won by athletes who clinch their events at all of the B-MISC I-MISC series in B-LOC , B-LOC , B-LOC and B-LOC . Seven athletes went into Friday 's penultimate meeting of the series with a chance of winning the prize and B-MISC men 's 400 metres hurdles champion B-PER I-PER kept his hopes alive in the competition by winning his event in 47.93 . B-MISC I-MISC champion B-PER I-PER clocked a swift 10.84 seconds on her way to victory in the women 's 100 metres , the second fastest time of the season and 0.10 seconds faster than her winning time in B-LOC . B-MISC veteran B-PER I-PER , who beat B-PER in B-LOC after just missing out on the gold medal in B-LOC after a photo finish , had to settle for third place in 11.04 . B-MISC world champion B-PER I-PER , the bronze medallist in B-LOC , was second in 11.00 . It was a costly defeat for B-PER since it threw her out of the race for the B-MISC I-MISC jackpot . B-LOC 1996-08-23 B-LOC I-LOC and B-LOC agreed on Friday that relations between the two teams had healed since the B-MISC I-MISC ' acrimonious tour last year . The B-MISC I-MISC were first found guilty then cleared of ball tampering and off-spinner B-PER I-PER was called for throwing during a controversial three-test series in B-LOC . " Our concern is to get out there and play proper cricket , " B-LOC I-LOC captain B-PER I-PER told a news conference on the eve of a warmup match between the B-MISC I-MISC champions and a B-ORG I-ORG team scheduled for Saturday . " What happened is history . " B-MISC team manager B-PER I-PER said he agreed with B-PER . " I believe relations between the two teams will be excellent , " B-PER said . The B-MISC are making their first visit to the B-LOC I-LOC island since boycotting a B-MISC I-MISC fixture in February after a terrorist bomb in B-LOC . B-LOC have been promised the presence of commandos , sniffer dogs and plainclothes policemen to ensure a limited overs tournament is trouble-free . The tournament , starting on August 26 , also includes B-LOC and B-LOC . B-PER said he was satisfied with the security arrangements . B-MISC I-MISC officials said they expected heavy rain which washed out a warmup match on Friday should cease by Saturday . B-LOC , led by wicketkeeper B-PER I-PER , opened their short tour of B-LOC I-LOC with a five-run win over the country 's youth team on Thursday . PRESS DIGEST - B-LOC - AUG 23 . B-LOC , B-LOC reach aviation agreement . B-LOC 1996-08-23 The B-LOC and B-MISC governments reached an agreement that will allow B-ORG I-ORG 's B-ORG I-ORG to operate three round-trip flights between B-LOC I-LOC and B-LOC , the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG said Friday . Under the agreement , which followed talks in B-LOC this week , B-ORG also will be allowed to shift up to four of the weekly flights it now operates between B-LOC and B-LOC to its B-LOC I-LOC gateway . The B-LOC I-LOC also will be able to designate one new all-cargo carrier for service between the two nations after two years . B-LOC was permitted to add a single additional round-trip flight to its current B-LOC I-LOC service , although it will not be able to do so while under Category Two ( Conditional ) status under the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG 's B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC . B-LOC would be allowed to add new service when its safety assessment has been improved , the department said . With the exception of the new services just agreed to , the governments of the two nations have agreed to maintain their current level of routes and airlines for the next 2-1/2 years , the agreement said . The agreement resolved a dispute that arose in June when B-LOC turned down B-ORG 's request to operate flights between B-LOC I-LOC and B-LOC , a denial that prompted the B-LOC I-LOC to charge that the B-MISC were breaking a bilateral aviation agreement and to propose sanctions against one of two B-MISC airlines , B-ORG and B-ORG . B-LOC 1996-08-23 World number one golfer B-PER I-PER has sacked his coach B-PER I-PER after a disappointing season . " B-PER and I are finished , " B-PER told reporters on Thursday before the start of the B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC in B-LOC , B-LOC . B-PER , a two-time B-MISC I-MISC champion , parted ways with his long-time mentor after drawing a blank in this year 's four majors , winning two tournaments worldwide . The blonde B-MISC opened with a level par round of 70 in B-LOC , leaving him four shots adrift of the leaders , B-MISC B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER and B-LOC 's B-PER I-PER . On Wednesday B-PER described this year as his worst on the professional circuit since 1991 , when he failed to win a tournament . " My application this year has been strange , " B-PER said . " Maybe I have n't been as keyed up as I should have been . " " Sometimes you do n't have it in your head to play . Maybe this was one of those years where I was there , but I was n't 100 percent there , and you have to be 100 percent to perform , " he said . -- B-ORG I-ORG 61-2 9373-1800 Soccer - B-MISC team breaks new ground in B-LOC . B-PER I-PER B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-23 For the first time in B-MISC history , an B-MISC team will take the field when the B-MISC I-MISC soccer season starts on Saturday . B-ORG I-ORG fields four B-MISC players and two foreign imports -- a B-MISC and a B-MISC . The rest of the side is made up mainly of B-MISC I-MISC . The club , founded in 1961 , has a loyal following in B-LOC , an B-MISC town of 28,000 in the heart of B-LOC . But away from their home ground , they face unfriendly crowds who taunt the players with racist abuse . " The very first thing we thought about after we knew we would be promoted was the game against B-ORG I-ORG , " said B-ORG supporter B-PER I-PER I-PER . Two weeks ago B-ORG , coached by B-MISC B-PER I-PER , met B-ORG , a club closely associated with the right-wing B-ORG party , for the first time in a B-MISC match in B-LOC . Chants from the crowd of " Death to the B-MISC " , and bottle-throwing during the game marred the match which ended in a goalless draw . One B-ORG supporter required hospital treatment for cuts and bruises after a stone struck his head as he was driving from the stadium . " We 're used to hearing the taunts of " Death to the B-MISC ' , " said B-PER I-PER I-PER , a B-LOC resident who studies at B-LOC 's B-ORG I-ORG . " But we know that these are only words , nobody has died from hearing them and it only makes us support our team more vehemently . " The dusty town of B-LOC lacks the amenities of B-MISC communities and many B-MISC I-MISC have long complained of state discrimination . " There are no parks or empty areas of land around here , so when we want to play a friendly game of soccer we all load up in the car and travel to B-LOC I-LOC , " 60 km ( 36 miles ) away , B-PER I-PER I-PER said . The town 's ramshackle 2,500-seat ground is accessible only by two dirt tracks . " We plan to build a 10,000-seat stadium , but it may well be situated elsewhere , " said club chairman B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER . " We will discuss this with the mayor and hopefully a new or refurbished ground will be completed by the start of the new year . " In the meantime , B-ORG will play all their heavily policed home matches at the B-MISC coastal town of B-LOC . " We are B-MISC , there is no question about that , " said B-PER I-PER I-PER , a hotel waiter . " We do n't have any connection with the B-MISC , they live over there , " he said , pointing to the B-LOC I-LOC seven km ( four miles ) to the east . " We do n't feel our club represents B-MISC I-MISC , " said club chairman B-PER I-PER . " We are trying to do all we can to run a professional outfit , we are pleased at any support we get , but do not go out looking to represent the whole B-MISC world . " Soccer - B-PER and B-PER both out of B-MISC squad . B-LOC 1996-08-23 B-MISC champions B-ORG will face B-MISC league and cup double winners B-ORG I-ORG in this season 's B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC . The draw made on Friday pitted B-ORG , who beat B-MISC champions B-ORG I-ORG 4-2 on penalties in last year 's final , against B-PER I-PER 's B-MISC hopefuls in group C . The other two teams in the group are last season 's B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC runners-up B-ORG I-ORG and B-ORG of B-LOC . B-ORG meet B-ORG in B-LOC on September 11 , with the return match at B-LOC I-LOC on November 20 . B-ORG have dominated the premier league in the 1990s , winning three B-MISC championships in four years , but have consistently failed in B-LOC , crashing out of the B-MISC I-MISC to B-ORG of B-LOC and B-LOC 's B-ORG at their last two attempts . They have not lifted a B-MISC I-MISC since 1991 when they beat B-ORG in the B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC final , and their one and only B-MISC I-MISC triumph was way back in 1968 , when they beat B-ORG of B-LOC 4-1 at B-LOC . B-ORG have won the B-MISC I-MISC twice . Before conquering B-ORG last year they beat B-ORG 's big B-MISC rivals B-ORG in the ill-fated 1985 final in the B-LOC stadium in B-LOC . Orthodox church blown up in southern B-LOC . B-LOC 1996-08-23 Saboteurs blew up a B-MISC orthodox church in southern B-LOC on Friday with a blast which also damaged four nearby homes , the state news agency B-ORG reported . B-ORG said the church in the small village of B-LOC I-LOC , 30 km ( 19 miles ) north of B-LOC , was destroyed by the morning attack . It did not report any casualties . B-LOC police said in a statement they had launched an investigation and were doing their best to find the perpetrators . B-ORG said it was the first time an orthodox church had been blown up in the B-LOC hinterland , where a large number of B-MISC lived before the 1991 war over B-LOC 's independence from the B-MISC federation . The area was part of the self-styled state of B-LOC proclaimed by minority B-MISC in 1991 and recaptured by the B-MISC army last year . B-MISC , B-MISC say observing B-LOC ceasefire . B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-23 Rebel fighters and B-MISC soldiers said a ceasefire effective at noon ( 0800 B-MISC ) on Friday was being generally observed , although scattered gunfire echoed through the B-MISC capital B-LOC . The B-MISC army said earlier it was preparing to withdraw from the rebel-dominated southern mountains of the region as part of the peace deal reached with separatists on Thursday . " There has been some shooting from their side but it has been relatively quiet , " said fighter B-PER I-PER , a bearded man wearing a white t-shirt and camoflage trousers . Soon after he spoke another burst of gunfire rocked the courtyard where the rebels had set up their base and a captured B-MISC B-MISC tank roared out to investigate . The separatists , who swept into B-LOC on August 6 , still control large areas of the centre of town , and B-MISC soldiers are based at checkpoints on the approach roads . " The ceasefire is being observed , " said woman soldier B-PER I-PER , 35 , short dark hair poking out from under a peaked camouflage cap . A few helicopters flew overhead , firing off flares , but there was no shooting from the air . The truce , the latest of several , was agreed in talks on Thursday between B-MISC peacemaker B-PER I-PER and rebel chief-of-staff B-PER I-PER . The two also agreed to set up joint patrols in B-LOC , but B-PER said she was sceptical about whether this could work . " We have to try it , but I doubt if this is possible with the separatists , " she said . WEATHER - Conditions at B-LOC airports - August 23 . B-LOC 1996-08-23 B-LOC and B-LOC were poised on Friday to sign a landmark normalisation treaty ending five years of tensions and paving way for stabilisation in the B-LOC . B-MISC Foreign Minister B-PER I-PER landed at B-LOC airport aboard a B-MISC government jet on Friday morning for talks with his B-MISC counterparts and a signing ceremony expected around noon ( 1000 B-MISC ) . On Thursday the B-MISC government endorsed the text of the agreement on normalising relations between the two countries , the B-MISC news agency B-ORG said . " The government assessed the agreement as a crucial step to resolving the B-MISC crisis , ensuring the restoration of peace in former B-LOC , " it said . Last-minute talks this week on the legal fine print finally cleared the way for a treaty based on mutual recognition within internationally recognised borders and the establishment of diplomatic relations , diplomats said . The pact ends five years of hostility after B-LOC 's secession from federal B-LOC . B-MISC powers regard diplomatic normalisation between B-LOC and B-LOC , twin pillars of the old multinational federal B-LOC , as a crucial step towards a lasting peace in the B-LOC . B-LOC president to lunch with ethnic B-MISC . B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-23 B-LOC 's President B-PER I-PER has announced he will hold regular lunches in his presidential palace for members of the country 's different ethnic groups as of next week . " It was about time for the B-MISC , the blacks and the mixed-bloods to begin eating in the palace with their president because this is not a palace exclusively for the potentates and ambassadors and protocol , " B-PER said late on Thursday . " In these weekly lunches we are going to get to know the problems of the B-MISC , mixed-race , black and peasant sectors , " he said . He has invited 35 B-MISC leaders to lunch next Tuesday . B-PER , who was elected on a populist platform last month , also plans to create a ministry for ethnic cultures . The B-MISC nation 's population of 11.4 million is 47 percent indigenous . B-LOC to use hovercrafts for B-LOC travel . B-LOC 1996-08-22 Hovercrafts will soon be plying the waters of the B-LOC in a bid to reduce the difficulties of transportation on the vast B-MISC waterway , the government said on Thursday . Two B-MISC hovercrafts , capable of carrying up to 50 tons each , will begin ferrying passengers and cargo up and down the huge river from its mouth at B-LOC by the end of the year , B-LOC 's B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG said in a statement . The use of riverways in the region has been made a priority under a government plan for the B-LOC and the high-speed hovercraft will help reduce the time involved in travelling often massive distances , it said . B-LOC expels B-MISC diplomat after bread riots . B-PER I-PER B-LOC 1996-08-23 B-LOC , which has blamed B-LOC for bread riots last week , has asked an B-MISC diplomat to leave , official and diplomatic sources said on Friday . The main Friday prayers in southern B-LOC that were the starting point for the riots a week ago passed peacefully under tight security imposed by the army with only brief demonstrations reported . B-PER I-PER , the B-MISC embassy 's press attache , was asked to leave " because he was carrying out duties incompatible with diplomatic norms " , one source told B-ORG , implying he was accused of spying . B-PER told B-ORG by telephone from his embassy office in B-LOC that he " had not been notified " of any explusion order . The government declined official comment . B-PER 's assistant , B-PER I-PER , was expelled earlier this year for similar reasons amid rising tension in bilateral ties after King B-PER began calling for change in B-LOC following top B-MISC defections in August 1995 . B-LOC retaliated then by expelling a junior administrator working in the B-MISC embassy in B-LOC but has continued its policy of trying to avoid public conflicts with B-LOC -- its only secure route to the rest of the world . B-LOC has accused B-LOC and a local B-MISC party for the country 's worst unrest in seven years which erupted after it almost doubled the prices of bread last week under radical economic reforms agreed with the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . In B-LOC , where two days of riots flared last Friday , a few hundred young men lingered outside B-LOC mosque on leaving , shouting slogans for about 15 minutes . " Disperse , abstain from forming groups and help maintain order , " army officers , who has enforced a loose curfew since the riots , told the crowd through loudspeakers . The men shouted " B-PER Akbar " ( B-PER is Greatest ) as a former B-MISC deputy , B-PER I-PER , told soldiers the crowd would not cause trouble . He had earlier mounted the mosque 's pulpit to demand release of detainees , an end to raids on houses and the cancelling of the bread price rises . Armoured cars had patrolled streets in B-LOC , traditional bastion of communist ideology and B-MISC socialism that swept the region in the 1950s , and guarded entrances to the hill-top city famed for its Crusader castle before the prayers . There was also heavy security in the crowded centre of B-LOC , where smaller clashes had erupted last Saturday , but Friday prayers at the main mosque ended quietly as police in full riot gear looked on . The B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , which has one deputy in the 80-seat lower house of parliament , has denied involvement in unrest which it blamed on government policies and rising economic hardship . Government attempts to link the rioting to foreign influence has been treated with derision by those in the streets who blame the protests on severe economic hardships . B-LOC says killed 17 B-MISC rebels in clashes . B-LOC 1996-08-23 B-MISC troops have killed 17 B-MISC rebels in recent clashes in the southeast of the country , the state-run B-ORG news agency said on Friday . Detective B-PER I-PER of the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , said a neighbour , B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER , 19 , was arrested in the attack , but had not been charged by late morning on Friday . There were apparently no adults at the party as the father of the family who lived in the house was out of town and the mother died more than a year ago , B-PER said . The detective said details were sketchy , but two of the teenagers were reportedly downstairs watching television when B-PER allegedly entered the house and told the girls to take off their clothes . He said a male teenager sleeping upstairs reportedly heard the commotion and came downstairs and confronted B-PER , who allegedly stabbed him more than once . The other teenagers also confronted the assailant and three girls , all under 18 , were stabbed , one fatally . " At least two of them were sexually molested , " B-PER said . He said all of the wounded teenagers were taken to a hospital but none of the injuries were considered life-threatening . Police said the girl who died was identified as B-PER I-PER . It said the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG 's coordinator for counter terrorism , B-PER I-PER , had expressed B-LOC 's support for the government when he visited B-LOC this week . B-LOC 1996-08-23 Implied volatility of B-MISC bond and interest rate options should stabilise around current levels until early next week after falling before and after this week 's B-MISC cut in interest rates , traders said . " Volatility has come off a lot . We 're looking for it to stabilise now , " said one B-MISC options trader at a B-LOC bank . A trader at a B-MISC bank said B-MISC volatility now stood at 14.00 for September contract , 16.75 for December , 19.50 for March and 21.25 for June . This compared with midweek levels , before the welter of interest rate cuts , of 18.50 for September , 20.00 for December , 22.00 for March and 23.5 for June , he said . At 1347 B-MISC , December B-MISC futures were trading at 96.78 , two basis points down on the day . He said the sell-off in June vols might have been overdone , which could offer value at current levels . He said caps and floors would be well bid after the round of interest rate cuts due to the fact these rates should stay low at the short end . The size of the B-ORG 's repo rate cut , to 3.00 percent from 3.30 percent , took markets by surprise . " Volatility has a bid to it -- longer-dated volatility more than short-dated because the event people were buying for has passed and now perhaps people will sell some short dated vol and buy some long dated vol , " he said . " Long dated volatility has been low this year , so it is still at levels which are not historically high . " It is not a dangerous level to own vol. You are not going to lose a lot and you could make quite a bit . " He said volatility levels should be stable until markets reassess the situation after a long weekend in B-LOC . B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG options specialist B-PER I-PER said that if volatility continued lower for the rest of Friday in over-the-counter 10-year B-MISC , it should be higher next Tuesday . He said the absence on holiday of many market makers was a main factor behind falls this week in volatility in high-yielding markets such as B-LOC , B-LOC and B-LOC . B-PER said the market had more downside than upside potential , but a fall was not likely to be of significant size . " I recommend people sell strangles in a number of markets -- in B-LOC and B-LOC in particular . " With high-yielding markets B-LOC will be a lot more vulnerable in September on economic and political fronts , so I would use current the low level of vol to buy options . " So sell options on B-MISC and B-LOC to enhance yield and buy options on B-LOC , " B-PER said .. -- B-PER I-PER , B-ORG I-ORG +44 171 542 6320 B-ORG I-ORG sets warrants on B-ORG . B-LOC 1996-08-23 A B-MISC photographer branded a stalker by Princess B-PER has been forced to postpone a legal challenge to a ban on approaching her because he 's been jailed for criminal damage , his lawyer said on Friday . B-PER I-PER started a 12-week jail sentence on Thursday just as he was preparing to contest an injunction obtained by B-PER banning him from coming within 300 metres ( yards ) of her . " We were in the process of preparing a detailed affidavit responding to the Princess 's affadavit and expected to go to court in the next couple of weeks , " said B-PER 's lawyer , B-PER I-PER . " But everything has been put on ice now . " B-PER told B-ORG that the challenge to the injunction would be delayed until B-PER was released . B-PER threw a brick through the window of a van in February after an argument with a driver when he was working as a motorcycle dispatch rider . B-PER , who has previous convictions , is expected to appeal against the sentence . Magistrates also ordered him to pay compensation of 182 pounds ( $ 282 ) . In an affidavit , the princess said that in chasing her B-PER had got so close that he twice smashed into her car and pushed her when she tried to remove the film from his camera . B-PER I-PER B-LOC 1996-08-22 A consortium of telephone companies and B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . said Thursday it had signed a $ 1 billion contract with B-ORG to make digital televison set-top boxes for its home entertainment service . The announcement of the contract for 3 million set-top boxes gave new hope to B-ORG , which has struggled with years of losses . " This really indicates we 're back in the business , " B-PER I-PER , president of the B-LOC , B-MISC company 's B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , said in a telephone interview . " Anytime somebody gets the opportunity to enter the next era with such a big bang has got to be seen as a strong message to the industry . " Following the announcement , B-ORG 's stock soared $ 5.50 to $ 16.875 on the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . The consortium , called B-ORG , said the contract was part of its strategy to develop and market the next generation in home entertainment . In addition to B-ORG , B-ORG 's partners are phone companies B-ORG I-ORG , B-ORG I-ORG , B-ORG I-ORG and B-ORG I-ORG . B-ORG said B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG has signed a letter of intent to join the group , which plans to provide a home entertainment service similar to cable television . B-ORG also said it planned to build a new $ 100 million plant in B-LOC , B-LOC . , to make picture tubes for 32- and 35-inch screen TV sets . The company currently buys the tubes from competitors . The new plant , which is dependent on obtaining financing , will create about 280 new jobs , B-ORG said . The contract calls for production of the set-top boxes over five years . B-PER said manufacturing will begin and revenue will start to roll in during the first half of next year . The boxes will be made on a build-to-order basis . B-ORG will convert its B-LOC , B-LOC , analogue set-top box plant to manufacture the digital boxes . B-PER declined to say when the operation was expected to be profitable . B-ORG will provide the boxes to subscribers as part of the service . Its service is being introduced in selected markets across the B-LOC I-LOC . B-PER said digital technology in set-top boxes is only the beginning and said the technology will eventually show up in retail consumer electronics . " We 'll build a lot of these devices into television sets , for digital television , " he said . " Although that is not where this particular contract is headed , the fact that there is a strong B-ORG presence will pay us dividends in the future . " B-ORG has been plagued by generally soft conditions in the colour television industry , reporting full-year losses since 1989 . Last month , it reported a second-quarter loss of $ 33.2 million , or 51 cents a share , vs. a loss of $ 45.3 million , or 97 cents a share , a year earlier . Last November , B-MISC I-MISC B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG bought a majority stake in B-ORG . B-PER I-PER , an analyst for B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . , said the contract was " not unique , but it 's big . " " Digital is coming , it 's economic and the question is what will make the consumer happy and at what price . " B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG says it can meditate problems away . B-LOC 1996-08-22 From the people who brought you hundreds of " yogic fliers " who claimed to defy nature by levitating comes B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , a minor political party that nominated a presidential candidate on Thursday . At a hotel convention here , the party associated with the B-MISC I-MISC ( B-MISC ) movement named physicist B-PER I-PER as its presidential nominee for the Nov. 5 election . The party is running on a platform claiming it can ward off problems before they occur through techniques such as mass meditation that would reduce stress , crime , terrorism and even wars . " Social stress can be reduced and problems such as crime and violence will automatically decrease , " said a party paper . Many party members are practitioners of B-MISC , which involves meditating to a repeated word or phrase , called a mantra . Some advanced B-MISC followers contend they can actually mediate to such a point that they fly . But in a demonstration of " yogic flying " several years ago , critics said the people were merely bouncing off the ground from a sitting position . Huge B-MISC I-MISC sales fail to meet expectations . B-PER I-PER B-LOC 1996-08-22 A year after its massively publicized introduction , B-ORG I-ORG 's B-MISC I-MISC computer operating system has fallen short of the most optimistic expectations for the software giant and the industry . Even though more than 40 million copies of B-MISC I-MISC have been sold , making it the fastest-selling new software ever , it would have been impossible for any product to live up to the unprecedented hype of the Aug. 24 , 1995 launch , when stores around the world opened at midnight to greet long lines of customers . The B-PER , B-MISC company spent tens of millions of dollars promoting the product with stunts that included buying the entire print run of the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG and lighting B-LOC I-LOC 's B-LOC I-LOC building in a B-MISC color scheme . But the product , delivered eight months late , has fallen short of its sales potential in part because B-ORG delivered a mixed message to business customers , analysts said . " It did n't do as well as it could have , " said B-PER I-PER , an analyst with B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . Scores of software and hardware companies that had hoped for a big boost in sales were disappointed when only a brief spike materialized . " People who were expecting major coat-tails were somewhat disappointed , " said B-PER I-PER , an analyst with B-ORG I-ORG . " It 's not as though it has n't had an impact , " he said . " It just has n't had the huge earth-shattering impact some people were looking for . " B-ORG I-ORG , which had been among the most bullish of software companies at the time of the B-MISC I-MISC launch , ended up posting disappointing financial results when retail sales of the operating system fell short of its projections . B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG had to pay $ 1.3 million in cash and stock to settle a shareholders lawsuit brought after the company 's sales failed to meet expectations tied to the B-MISC I-MISC launch . Many software developers apparently saw their crucial holiday season sales suffer last year because store shelves were jammed with blue-and-white boxes of B-MISC I-MISC , resulting in a shortage of space for seasonal products , said B-PER I-PER , president of B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . To be sure , sales of B-MISC I-MISC and the accompanying B-MISC I-MISC upgrade drove B-ORG sales up 46 percent last year to a record $ 8.67 billion and cemented the company 's status as the industry 's dominant company . B-ORG executives say they are thrilled with the sales figures , and industry analysts estimate that by sometime next year , the installed base of B-MISC I-MISC will surpass that of the older version of B-MISC , now used on about 100 million computers worldwide . But B-PER said the figure could have been even higher if B-ORG had done a better job of handling the huge demand for technical support from customers who were frustrated trying to install the system . He and other analysts said corporate B-LOC adopted a go-slow approach because B-ORG already was promoting the new version of its high-end B-MISC I-MISC operating system , expected to be available in stores in the next several weeks . " B-ORG sent a lot of signals that B-MISC was going to be the answer , " B-PER said . " Many people began to believe that B-MISC I-MISC was being downplayed . " But now that B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC has been launched , B-PER and others believe only a relatively small proportion of corporate users will elect to pay the added software and hardware costs needed to use it instead of B-MISC I-MISC . " B-MISC I-MISC is going to do great , " he said . " The mistake people made was in thinking it was going to be a fast , sweeping change rather than a slow , building change . " B-LOC says still committed to B-LOC migration pacts . B-LOC 1996-08-22 The B-LOC I-LOC said on Thursday it remained committed to migration accords with B-LOC and would continue to repatriate intercepted B-MISC migrants who attempted to enter B-LOC territory illegally . A B-ORG I-ORG statement appeared in part a response to B-MISC complaints that B-LOC was jeopardising the accords by failing to return some of the B-MISC involved in recent illegal migration incidents . " The B-LOC I-LOC reiterates its full commitment to the implementation " of the accords signed by the two countries in 1994 and 1995 , said the statement by spokesman B-PER I-PER . " The B-LOC I-LOC will continue to return B-MISC migrants intercepted at sea who seek to enter the B-LOC I-LOC or the B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC illegally , " it said . B-LOC would also take " prompt and effective law enforcement action " against alien smuggling and hijackings from B-LOC , it added . B-PER told reporters the statement would be distributed in the B-MISC exile community in B-LOC " to remind everyone of the importance of abiding by the accords and avoiding dangerous attempts to cross the straits " from B-LOC to B-LOC . B-LOC 's complaints centred on an incident in which a boatload of emigrants capsized in the B-LOC I-LOC last week and two recent aircraft hijackings from B-LOC . Sixteen of those picked up from the boat were returned to B-LOC but eight were taken to the B-LOC I-LOC and three to B-LOC I-LOC , a B-LOC base on B-LOC , until they emigrated to another nation . The most recent hijacking , last Friday , involved three hijackers and the pilot of a small aircraft . B-PER said on Tuesday the pilot could soon return to B-LOC but B-LOC authorities planned to try the hijackers . In an incident on July 7 , a B-MISC B-ORG I-ORG official hijacked a commercial plane and sought aylum at B-LOC I-LOC . B-PER said he knew of no plans to return the man to B-LOC . B-LOC . says is first state to apply for new welfare . B-LOC 1996-08-22 In keeping with its pioneering image in the area of welfare , B-LOC was the first state to submit an administrative plan under the nation 's new welfare law , Gov . B-PER I-PER said Thursday . According to a new release from the governor , B-LOC submitted a plan to the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG for administration of the new block grant system for welfare just minutes after President B-PER I-PER signed the measure into law Thursday . " As the nation 's leader in welfare reform , B-LOC is far ahead of the curve and ready to go under this new system , " B-PER said . Still , the governor said the new law does not go as far as the state 's own welfare reform program , dubbed B-MISC . He said that despite the new law , B-LOC will still require federal waivers allowing the working poor to acquire health care coverage from the state , a 60-day residency requirement for participation in the welfare program , and child support collections to go directly to custodial parents . The nation 's new welfare reform law limits eligibility , gives states more power and ends direct federal aid for poor children . -- B-PER I-PER , 312-408-8647 Snoozing B-MISC man takes slow train to B-LOC . B-LOC 1996-08-22 B-LOC marine biologists have trained a pair of sea lions to tag and photograph elusive whales as they cruise through the B-LOC depths , B-ORG I-ORG magazine reported on Thursday . B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER of the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG in B-LOC say their sea lions , natural companions of many species of whale , can go where no man or woman has ever gone before . " Any diver knows that when a whale gets going you ca n't keep up , " B-PER told the magazine . " That is why we know only about five percent of what whales do . " The sea lions -- 17-year-old B-PER and nine-year-old B-PER -- have undergone six years of training for their mission . B-PER once worked for the B-ORG I-ORG and B-PER is an amusement park veteran . B-PER said they could accurately tag whales with a radio transmitter , and could also swim all the way around one of the giant mammals , filming it with a video camera . Their first assignment , later this year , will be documenting humpback whale migration off B-LOC , B-LOC . The article did not spell out exactly how the sea lions manage to tag the whales but said in training they were taught to stick a radio transmitter on to a plastic model of a whale using suction cups . The budget contained sharp spending cuts in areas such as the labour market to reduce the deficit to about B-MISC 5.6 billion . B-LOC copper stocks owned by state reserve - trade . B-PER I-PER B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-23 Up to 100,000 tonnes of copper held in B-LOC bonded warehouses , confounding the world market as to its source and ultimate fate , probably belongs to B-LOC 's strategic state reserve , industry sources said on Friday . Around 40,000 tonnes of the copper have already been moved to warehouses near the northern port of B-LOC , where some of the strategic stockpile was stored , they said . Just who owns the copper is a question that has kept traders and industry analysts guessing since the metal was channelled into B-LOC by the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) in June and July . It was unclear whether or not the 40,000 tonnes had cleared customs -- which would provide some concrete indication that the strategic reserve , administered directly by the central government 's B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , owned the copper . Traders have said the reserve could negotiate concessions on duties -- three percent import tax and 17 percent value-added tax -- that made the copper prohibitively expensive otherwise . But one source , the head of a B-LOC I-LOC trading house , said it made no difference if the copper was customs cleared or not . " If they spend all this money moving the copper to B-LOC , it will be sitting there for years , " he said . " Once it arrives in B-LOC , it is subject to monitoring by the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , which has to give permission for any more movement ; it is out of the hands of traders , " he said . Mystery has surrounded the B-LOC stockpile in recent months , with traders unsure not only of who owns it , but of its exact size and what its owner planned to do with it . Trading sources generally agreed it would be cost-effective to take the copper back into a depleted central reserve as it had already served its purpose in taking advantage of long-term backwardation on the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) . A backwardation occurs when the spot price of a metal is higher than the forward price . B-ORG lent around 85,000 tonnes of copper onto the B-ORG between April and June 1995 on behalf of the state reserve , running the state stockpile down to 115,000 tonnes from 200,000 tonnes previously . Traders in B-LOC said B-ORG could well have lent it to the market at around B-MISC 2,700 a tonne , and then paid somewhere between $ 2,200 and $ 2,400 a tonne when it started taking the metal back earlier this year . This would have cleared B-ORG a healthy profit , which could then have been used to finance storage and other costs . Word that B-ORG had offered the copper to B-MISC trading houses in a series of secret meetings unnerved an already jittery market . Industry analysts B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) said on Wednesday the motivation of the owners of the 85,000 tonnes , " whoever they are , is the most important short-term fundamental " in an already tight world market . B-ORG repeated in its latest review rumours of involvement by B-ORG I-ORG , with B-ORG said to be helping the B-MISC trader unload its copper positions after it revealed in June losses of $ 1.8 billion in a decade of unauthorised deals . B-ORG and B-ORG have made no comments on the talk and B-MISC traders said they know nothing of such an arrangement . Traders in B-LOC said on Thursday they were unaware of movements out of the B-LOC bonded warehouses . They reported more arrivals that were probably spot purchases . They also expressed concern that the tonnage in bonded warehouses would move onto the domestic market . But these concerns were irrelevant , a B-LOC trader said , despite a forecast that domestic B-MISC copper demand could hit one million tonnes this year . As with many commodities , " there is a desire ( by the B-MISC government ) to keep a stockpile of the metal , " he said . " You do n't keep it to help industry , you keep it in case of emergency . " -- B-LOC I-LOC newsroom ( 852 ) 2843-6470 B-ORG I-ORG posts 1st final result . B-ORG set to sell B-MISC assets - paper . B-LOC 1996-08-23 B-MISC retailer B-ORG is in advanced talks about selling its B-MISC assets and the retailer 's board might decide as soon as Tuesday to sell the assets to B-ORG I-ORG , B-ORG I-ORG newspaper said on Friday . It said investment bank B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG was an intermediary in the talks and added that unlisted B-MISC retailers B-ORG , B-ORG and B-ORG were also still in discussions . B-ORG has in B-LOC its Promo hypermarket unit with 36 Continent superstores , which is 1995 generated 4.7 percent of total B-ORG sales . The B-MISC group entered the B-MISC market in 1990 , buying In June , B-ORG signed an outline agreement to sell its B-ORG unit -- which runs 100 B-ORG stores in B-LOC -- to B-LOC 's B-ORG . B-ORG I-ORG JV posts 77 percent net drop in H1 96 . B-LOC 1996-08-24 A B-MISC truck maker in which B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG has a 20 percent stake said it posted a 77 percent drop in post-tax profits in the first half of 1996 . B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , in a statement in Saturday 's edition of the B-ORG I-ORG newspaper , said net profit in the period was 3.385 million yuan , down from 14.956 million in the same 1995 period . Turnover fell to 937.891 million yuan from 1.215 billion , while net assets per share were 1.88 yuan , unchanged , and earnings per share fell to 0.005 yuan from 0.02 yuan , the statement said . In the first half , the company said it produced 8,333 vehicles and sold 9,018 , but it did not explain the difference . It blamed the drop in profits on a weak vehicle market and said as its engine plant had only just started trial production , the company 's results would not improve in the short-term . B-ORG owns 138.643 million shares in the firm . The majority shareholder , with 51 percent , or 353.24 million shares , is B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . The company , in the southern province of B-LOC , had about eight percent of B-LOC 's light truck market in 1994 . ( $ 1 = 8.3 yuan ) TENNIS - RESULTS AT B-MISC I-MISC . RALLYING - B-PER IN COMMAND AS B-PER ROLLS OUT . B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-24 B-LOC 's B-PER I-PER produced an impressive performance in his B-ORG on Saturday to open up a 37 seconds lead after six stages of the B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC , sixth round of the world championship . On a weekend overshadowed by Friday 's fatal accident , four times world champion B-PER emerged from the first five of Saturday 's 10 stages with a commanding advantage over his country 's latest prospect , B-PER I-PER , also in a B-ORG . World championship leader B-PER I-PER in his B-ORG was third but current world champion B-PER I-PER ended a bad week by crashing out . After being fined $ 250,000 by the sports governing body on Tuesday , the B-MISC driver rolled his B-ORG 6.5 km into stage six . He and co-driver B-PER I-PER were unhurt but team boss B-PER I-PER was furious with them . " It 's not unfortunate , it 's incompetent , " he declared . B-PER has set an astonishing pace for a driver who has not rallied for three months . " If you do a lot of something , sometimes it 's good to have a break . It 's not bad for an old man ! " said the 37-year-old veteran . B-ORG had a poor morning with B-MISC B-PER I-PER losing 90 seconds through turbo trouble while B-MISC B-PER I-PER dropped four minutes when a transmission shaft snapped . B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-24 A B-MISC man died and 31 people were injured after an accident in Friday 's opening phase of the world championship B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC . The unnamed victim died during the night , a hospital spokesman said on Saturday . B-MISC driver B-PER I-PER had ploughed into the crowd during the two-kilometre first stage held in the host city of B-LOC . B-PER 's B-ORG skidded down an escape road and ploughed into a cordoned-off area for spectators . A second B-MISC was also seriously injured but the hospital spokesman said his life was not in danger . The stage was suspended but the four-day rally resumed on Saturday . A woman was killed before last year 's event when she walked in front of a car practising on the course . TENNIS - RESULTS AT B-MISC I-MISC . B-LOC 1996-08-24 B-ORG are set to step up their B-MISC county championship challenge with a fifth consecutive victory after new-ball pair B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER sent B-ORG reeling on Saturday . B-PER seized two wickets in two deliveries and left-armer B-PER also captured two as B-ORG , 252 behind on first innings , slumped to 27 for four at the close on the third day of the four-day game at B-LOC . B-ORG , who started the current round of matches in fifth place 20 points behind leaders B-ORG with a game in hand , could go top if they complete victory on Monday 's last day and other results favour them . B-PER thrust B-ORG on course for success by dispatching B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER in his second over , before B-PER removed B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER to reduce B-ORG to 17 for four at one stage . The visitors had started the day optimistically by sending back former B-LOC captain B-PER I-PER when he added just six to his overnight 105 , but B-ORG went on to make 532 for eight before declaring . Captain B-PER I-PER plundered 88 from 73 deliveries , hitting 15 fours and one six . Second-placed B-ORG were frustrated by rain which prevented any play at B-LOC , where they have reached 255 for three in their first innings against B-ORG , while third-placed B-ORG are facing an uphill task against B-ORG . B-ORG slipped to 88 for four in reply to B-ORG ' commanding first innings of 446 for nine declared at B-LOC I-LOC , before B-PER I-PER struck a 55-ball half-century . B-PER 's 56 not out , containing eight fours and three sixes , lifted B-ORG to 128 for four on a rain-curtailed day . Fourth-placed B-ORG had B-ORG on the ropes at B-LOC before rain intervened . Pace trio B-PER I-PER ( 2-24 ) , B-PER I-PER ( 3-20 ) and B-PER I-PER ( 2-19 ) had B-ORG reeling at 81 for seven in reply to the home county 's first innings of 353 . B-ORG rekindled their title hopes after three successive defeats by taking the upper hand against arch-rivals B-ORG at B-LOC I-LOC . Facing B-ORG 's 529 for eight declared , B-ORG were forced to follow on 206 behind after being bowled out for 323 , paceman B-PER I-PER polishing off the innings with a burst of three wickets for one run in 17 deliveries . B-ORG then reached 210 for five at the close -- just four ahead -- after B-PER I-PER hit 55 in 60 balls to add to his first innings of 86 . CRICKET - B-LOC V B-LOC FINAL TEST SCOREBOARD . B-LOC striker B-PER I-PER gave B-PER I-PER 's talent-laden side the lead from the penalty spot after 13 minutes after Wednesday 's B-MISC B-PER I-PER pulled down B-MISC forward B-PER I-PER . B-LOC , B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-24 B-LOC I-LOC made history on Saturday when they completed their first series victory in B-LOC I-LOC with a 33-26 victory in the second test . The win gave the B-ORG I-ORG an unbeatable 2-0 lead in the three-test series . Each side scored three tries and the B-ORG outscored the B-ORG I-ORG 15-12 in the second half but still suffered a fourth successive defeat against their old enemies . Two tries from wing B-PER I-PER in the first quarter gave B-LOC I-LOC a 24-11 lead before tries from flanker B-PER I-PER and scrum-half B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER in the space of two minutes narrowed the gap to a single point at 23-24 . The B-ORG would have gone ahead had not fly-half B-PER I-PER 's conversion hit an upright and B-LOC I-LOC only scrambled to safety through a fine penalty from replacement fly-half B-PER I-PER and a drop goal by number eight B-PER I-PER . B-LOC 1996-08-24 Result of a B-MISC first division soccer match on Saturday : B-ORG 2 B-ORG 4 SOCCER - DISAPPOINTING B-ORG SLUMP 2-0 AT B-LOC . B-LOC 1996-08-24 B-MISC champions B-ORG I-ORG faltered in their second league match of the season on Saturday losing 2-0 away at B-ORG . B-ORG , who had a dismal series of pre-season results before beating B-ORG of B-LOC in their opening game , had the best of an entertaining first half but failed to break the deadlock . Eight minutes after the interval , B-ORG 's B-PER I-PER broke through the B-LOC defence , left defender B-PER I-PER standing and curled the ball beyond goalkeeper B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER into the B-ORG net . B-ORG , without injured defenders B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER and strikers B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER , then stepped up the pace and looked certain to equalise . But they left gaps at the back and on 73 minutes B-MISC striker B-PER I-PER I-PER rushed out of his own half , beat the B-ORG defence and lobbed B-PER I-PER I-PER . The defeat means B-ORG 's main title contenders B-ORG I-ORG , who beat the champions 3-0 in the traditional league curtain-raiser , can go three points clear of their rivals if they beat B-ORG on Sunday . Scores : B-ORG I-ORG 102-0 ( B-PER I-PER 39 not out , B-PER I-PER 56 not out ) off 21.4 overs v B-LOC I-LOC . B-MISC hostage in B-LOC describes ordeal . B-LOC 1996-08-24 A B-MISC aid worker , held hostage in B-LOC for nearly four weeks , said on Saturday a cocked B-MISC had been thrust into his mouth at one point during his ordeal . B-PER I-PER , a 23-year-old worker with the group B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , described his ordeal to a news conference when he arrived back in B-LOC from B-LOC . " The worst period of physical manhandling was during that time when we were beaten with B-MISC and at one point I had a B-MISC held to the back of my throat -- cocked , " he said . " For the first period we were held in a small room with no bed or anything . We had very little food and sometimes went two or three days without eating . " Gunmen seized B-PER , who comes from B-LOC in southern B-LOC , B-MISC B-PER I-PER and six other hostages from their car in B-LOC , the capital of B-LOC , on July 27 . The assailants had demanded a ransom of 300,000 pounds ( $ 465,000 ) but no money was paid by the charity when they were released on Wednesday . The hostages were held in a house in or near B-LOC which was bombarded regularly . " During the last 15 days of being held , the fighting in B-LOC was very close . At first it was street fighting outside the house and then we came under very heavy shelling and bombardment from conventional weapons like tanks , artillery and grenade launchers , " he said . B-PER had been working for the charity which provides food to civilians for only a few weeks before he was captured . When asked if he would return to the mountainous region where rebels have been fighting B-MISC troops for full independence , B-PER said : " Not for the time being . I do n't think it 's safe for me . But maybe in the future , depending on the circumstances . " Princess B-PER send message to B-PER I-PER . B-LOC 1996-08-24 B-LOC 's Princess B-PER has sent a message to seriously ill B-PER I-PER , the nun to whom she has turned several times for spiritual guidance . B-PER 's office said on Saturday the princess had sent a message to the B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC missionary as news broke this week of her battle against heart problems and malaria . A spokeswoman declined to release details of the message . B-PER first met the B-MISC missionary in B-LOC in 1992 . She said afterwards that the meeting had fulfilled her " dearest wish " and the two women have met several times since . The princess , who has carved out a major role for herself as a helper of the sick and needy , is said to have turned to B-PER I-PER for guidance as her marriage crumbled to heir to the B-MISC throne B-PER I-PER . The 85-year-old nun said in the past that she was praying for the couple , whose divorce is expected to become final next week . Doctors caring for B-PER I-PER in a B-LOC hospital said on Saturday that her fever had fallen and her malaria was under control but she remained on a respirator in intensive care . Scorer : B-PER I-PER ( 45th minute ) . Attendance : 10,000 . Adventurers start B-MISC wilderness race . B-LOC , B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-24 About 350 adventurers from nine countries set out on Saturday to climb , raft , bike and run in a 323-mile ( 517-km ) endurance race through the B-MISC wilderness . The event , called the B-MISC , is part of a growing sport known as adventure racing in which competitors test their limits for days over a perilous wilderness course . " I 'm looking forward to this race . I think it will be more physically challenging and we 'll have to go up against more diverse situations due to the terrain , " said Dr. B-PER I-PER , a veteran B-MISC participant . The B-MISC has been staged twice before -- in B-LOC and B-LOC last year -- and is modelled on similar races overseas . The 70 teams in this year 's race will will trek glaciers , climb mountains , whitewater raft , horseback ride , canoe and mountain bike along the grueling course . This year 's race , the route of which was keep a secret until Friday evening , is being held near B-LOC , B-LOC I-LOC , about 100 miles ( 160 km ) northeast of B-LOC . The area is filled with treacherous mountain peaks , ice fields and frigid waters . Organisers expect about two-thirds of the participants to drop out or be disqualified before the finish . The hardy ones are expected to complete the course in about six days , with first-place finishers receiving $ 10,000 in prize money . In the B-MISC , competitors race in teams of five which must include both men and women . Team members must remain within 100 yards ( metres ) of each other at all times and finish together . With racers carrying about 40 pounds ( 18 kg ) of gear on their backs , broken bones , sunstroke , dehydration and exhaustion are common . Cholera kills 21 in southern B-LOC . B-LOC 1996-05-28 An outbreak of cholera has killed 21 people in a week at B-LOC in oil-rich southern B-LOC , the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG reported on Saturday . The chairman of the local council , B-PER I-PER , said drugs had been rushed to the area to quell the disease and the community needed a safer source of drinking water to prevent future outbreaks . Epidemics are common in rural areas of B-LOC where piped water is not usually available . B-LOC 's ex-president B-PER says he 's feeling well . B-LOC 1996-08-24 B-LOC 's frail former president , B-PER I-PER , said on Saturday in a rare public interview that he was feeling well despite his advanced years . " I feel all right and I eat everything that is put on the table . And that means I am all right , " he told reporters invited to his home . B-PER , a vegetarian teetotaller believed to be 97 , walked unaided but supporting himself on a walking stick . He clutched a fly whisk which for a long time symbolised his obsession with power . His health was the subject of much recent speculation . B-LOC 's undisputed ruler for three decades , he lost power in the first all-party elections in 1994 . He spent a year under house arrest and was tried but acquitted last year on charges of ordering the murder of four opponents in 1983 . B-LOC fires striking civil servants . B-PER I-PER B-LOC 1996-08-24 The B-MISC government fired thousands of workers on Saturday for defying an order to end a strike which has crippled essential services and disrupted international and domestic flights . The B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) said in a statement that the workers -- including nurses , junior doctors , mortuary attendants , customs officers and firefighters -- would be barred from entering their workplaces on Monday . " All civil servants who did not return to work at their normal working hours , and remained working for the full working day on 23 August 1996 , have been summarily dismissed ... with immediate effect , " it said in a statement . Union officials from the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) were unavailable for comment . B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG Minister B-LOC Chitauro told state radio her ministry had already begun recruiting other people to replace the strikers , sub-contracting some of the work to private firms . The government had been threatening to fire the workers since the strike began on Tuesday , saying it was illegal . But the strikers ignored the threat and vowed to stay on the streets until their demands for wage rises of 30 to 60 percent were met . The stoppage has left essential services stretched with many hospitals handling only emergency cases under senior doctors with the help of army medical personnel and the B-ORG I-ORG . It has also disrupted flights . Some internal services were cancelled , leaving tourists at the B-LOC I-LOC resort stranded , and flights abroad were delayed . The B-ORG said 80 percent of the country 's 180,000 civil servants took part in the strike which is a rare challenge to President B-PER I-PER , who has been in power since independence from B-LOC in 1980 . Opposition parties , civic organisations and private-sector unions have expressed support for the action and denounced the government 's pay rises of up to eight percent for its workers . Civil servants earn on average B-MISC 1,000 ( $ 100 ) a month . They say their pay has not kept up at all with inflation , currently running at 22 percent . B-LOC says B-LOC expels 28 B-MISC refugees . B-LOC 1996-08-24 B-LOC said on Saturday that B-LOC had expelled 28 B-MISC B-MISC refugees accused of being " trouble-makers " in camps in eastern B-LOC . Captain B-PER I-PER , spokesman for the B-MISC B-MISC army , told B-ORG in B-LOC that 17 of the 28 refugees handed over on Friday from the B-MISC town of B-LOC had been soldiers in the former B-MISC army which fled to B-LOC in 1994 after being defeated by B-MISC forces in B-LOC 's civil war . B-MISC Prime Minister B-PER I-PER I-PER said on Thursday in a visit to B-LOC that his country would expell all the refugees back to B-LOC but he gave no timeframe . B-LOC is home to 1.1 million B-MISC B-MISC refugees who fled three months of civil war in 1994 . Many had taken part in the genocide that year of one million people , mostly B-MISC , and refuse to go home for fear of reprisal at the hands of the new B-MISC government in B-LOC . B-PER said the refugees were handed over following a deal made at a meeting between the governor of B-LOC 's north B-LOC region and his counterpart in the B-MISC border town of B-LOC . " After a meeting between the governor of north B-LOC and the prefect of B-LOC , 28 prisoners ( refugees ) were handed over to B-MISC authorities on Friday , " B-PER said . " Out of these 17 were former soldiers . These people are now in B-LOC prison , " B-PER added . Revered skull of B-LOC I-LOC king is B-MISC woman 's . B-LOC 1996-08-24 A limelight-loving B-MISC I-MISC chief was in disgrace on Saturday after a prized skull he brought home from B-LOC was identified as belonging not to his sacred tribal ancestor , but to a middle-aged white woman . A forensic scientist who examined the supposed skull of 19th century King B-PER , a chief of President B-PER I-PER 's B-MISC tribe killed in battle by the B-MISC , said it was in fact the cranium of a B-MISC woman . Chief B-PER I-PER , dressed in animal skins and full tribal regalia , journeyed to a wintry B-LOC in February on a hugely publicised quest to find B-PER 's skull . The witchdoctor said ancestors had appeared to him in a dream and ordered him to return the head , said to have been carried off as a colonial trophy by the officer who shot and allegedly beheaded B-PER after a battle in 1835 . But B-PER ran into trouble as soon as he returned to B-LOC I-LOC with a skull he found in a cottage in a lonely B-LOC forest near B-LOC . He said the spirit of a hurricane had guided him there . Members of the B-MISC royal family , branding B-PER a charlatan , confiscated the head and sent it for tests to a forensic scientist , who examined the shape of the skull and the hole that he determined had not come , as supposed , from a bullet . " It can be stated beyond reasonable doubt that this skull is not that of the late king , " the scientist said in a statement . B-LOC arrests opposition sewing machine smugglers . B-LOC 1996-08-24 B-MISC police have arrested three people trying to smuggle sewing machines and army clothing to B-MISC opposition groups in B-LOC , an official newspaper reported on Saturday . The government-owned B-ORG I-ORG said the smugglers were caught in B-LOC in the eastern state of B-LOC , on the border with B-LOC , and had confessed they were on their way to " the so-called alliance forces which have been undertaking subversive operations on the eastern border " . Authorities in B-LOC said opposition forces based in B-LOC have been laying landmines and stealing vehicles and other goods to smuggle them across the border into B-LOC . B-LOC accuses the B-MISC authorities of providing support to B-MISC opposition elements based in B-LOC . B-LOC cut diplomatic ties with B-LOC in 1994 , accusing it of training rebels to make raids into B-LOC . The exiled B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , a B-MISC umbrella opposition group , has its headquarters in the B-MISC capital B-LOC . It uses the former B-MISC embassy . B-MISC Socialists start landmark reform congress . B-LOC 1996-08-24 B-LOC 's opposition B-ORG I-ORG began a two-day congress on Saturday to discuss major jettisoning its links with almost half a century of B-MISC dictatorship in the B-LOC country . " The congress will approve new concepts that will turn the party into a Social-Democratic and electoral party , not a class and ideological one , " the Socialist B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG daily said in an editorial . Jailed Socialist leader B-PER I-PER made the first call for change in July , a month after the party 's chief opponents , the conservative B-MISC of President B-PER I-PER , almost swept the board in a disputed general election . The Socialists , reformed heirs to the communists , pulled out of the poll saying it was a sham . Acting Socialist leader B-PER I-PER has said he too will urge the party to scrap the ideas of B-PER I-PER at the congress . The pro-reform stance of some of the party leadership initially caused a storm and triggered the resignation last month of the party 's Secretary-General B-PER I-PER . More recently political commentators have reported a growing consensus , however , and a rift at the meeting looks increasingly unlikely . B-MISC president to go to B-LOC for medical care . B-LOC hangs two men for drug trafficking . B-LOC 1996-08-24 B-LOC has hanged two drug traffickers in the southern city of B-LOC , the evening newspaper B-ORG reported on Saturday . The two B-MISC men were arrested in July with 419 kilograms ( 924 lbs ) of opium after they opened fire on police and killed a pedestrain and wounded four , the newspaper quoted a police commander as saying . B-ORG said the executions were ordered by the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . It did not say when they took place . One of the men , who killed the pedestrian , was hanged at the site of the crime and the other was executed in B-LOC prison in B-LOC , the newspaper said . Possession of 30 grammes ( just over an ounce ) of heroin or five kg ( 11 lb ) of opium is punishable by death in B-LOC . More than 1,000 people have been executed in drug-related cases since the law took effect in 1989 . B-LOC has an estimated one million drug addicts and is a key transit route for drugs , mostly opium , smuggled to B-LOC through B-LOC and B-LOC -- the so called " B-ORG I-ORG . The B-ORG was represented in court and admitted owing money for rent but did not give details . Vice-president B-PER I-PER last July was sentenced to five years in prison on a charge of disclosing secrets of judicial proceedings in B-PER 's affair . B-ORG - Blaming B-LOC for riots in B-LOC is a dirty game . B-PER campaign busy making " news " . B-PER I-PER B-LOC 1996-08-24 President B-PER I-PER has served notice he intends to be busy " making news " -- or at least doing things that look and sound like it in a campaign year . With B-MISC gathering in B-LOC to start a convention on Monday to nominate him for a second term as president , B-PER plans a steady parade of events designed to highlight his leadership and dim the glow of the just-concluded B-MISC conclave that gave a boost to rival B-PER I-PER . After a week of carefully orchestrated events signing into law bills passed by the B-MISC B-ORG , B-PER used his Saturday radio address to the nation to proudly " announce " a development in the war on crime . " Sixty days ago I directed the attorney general to draw up a plan for a national registry of sex offenders , " B-PER said . " That plan has now reached my desk . " " Today I am pleased to announce that we are following through on our commitment to keep track of these criminals , not just in a single state but wherever they go , " he said . Actually , creation of such a registry was underway without B-PER lifting a finger . Attorney General B-PER I-PER 's report -- all nine pages of it , including footnotes -- offers only the interim services of the B-ORG until a formal registry on sex offenders has been established . Two months ago , B-PER announced he wanted an interim effort established . Now , 60 days later , he had a chance to talk about it again . It is an example of B-PER 's strategic planning as he heads into the stretch drive for the Nov. 5 presidential election . Such things do not happen by chance in the B-PER B-LOC I-LOC , they are part of his political chess game . In the past week B-PER signed into law an increase in the minimium wage , a bill that makes it easier for someone with a pre-existing health problem to change jobs , and sweeping changes overhauling the nation 's welfare system . " B-LOC can look back on a week of remarkable achievement , " B-PER said , without even a passing reference to the B-MISC majority in the B-ORG and B-ORG . " B-LOC is on the right track offering more opportunity , demanding more responsibility , building a stronger community , the sense of shared values and stronger families , " he said in striking the theme of his coming week . According to a senior campaign official , B-PER " will be making a lot of news in the coming week -- something different each day . " B-PER departs on Sunday on a four-day train trip through B-LOC I-LOC , B-LOC , B-LOC , B-LOC and B-LOC while fellow B-MISC are gathered in B-LOC . " He 'll make news during the day ... and then at night the attention will go to the convention , " said the campaign official . " We think it 'll work really well . " Although officials decline to say just what each day 's " news " will be , the intent is to put a focus on B-PER himself and not just those attending the party 's convention . Each day of the trip will have a late start , so that network television correspondents will be able to do live reports for morning programmes . Campaign officials then hope the day 's " news " event will be showcased on evening television news shows as a lead-in for that night 's convention programme . " We 'll be concentrating ... on supporting the president as he is on the trip and making significant public policy statements related to some of his plans for the future , " said B-LOC I-LOC Press Secretary B-PER I-PER . B-PER said that when B-PER delivers his acceptance address on Thursday night to fellow B-MISC and a national television audience , he will " set out a road map " for the nation 's future -- one the president hopes guides him back to the B-LOC I-LOC for four more years . Hurricane expected to veer north of B-LOC . B-LOC 1996-08-24 Hurricane B-MISC grew stronger on Saturday as it swirled across the B-LOC I-LOC , but forecasters at the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG said the storm would likely swing north and miss the B-LOC . " B-MISC is getting stronger and stronger , and it already has winds of 105 mph ( 185 kph ) , " said hurricane forecaster B-PER I-PER . " But the good news is that all our computer models indicate B-MISC is going to turn to the west-northwest on Sunday and miss the islands , " he added . At 11 a.m. EDT ( 1500 B-MISC ) , B-MISC was 1,130 miles east of the B-LOC I-LOC and moving west at 14 mph ( 25 kph ) . Its exact position was latitude 14.5 north , longitude 44.2 west . Two of the corpses were identified but not the third , found headless and decomposed in a sack in a nearby canal . B-PER was first sentenced for assault but investigators began digging in the garden of his villa after the first body was found by a passer-by . B-LOC asks how paedophile suspect eluded police . B-PER I-PER B-LOC 1996-08-24 B-MISC police searched two more houses on Saturday for bodies in a child-sex scandal of murder , kidnapping and pornography that has sent a shockwave of revulsion throughout B-LOC . Recriminations built up over how the scandal 's central figure , convicted child rapist B-PER I-PER , managed to prey on children unhindered for so long . In just over a week two young girls have been found dead , from starvation , two have been freed from a dungeon-like secret compartment and an international hunt has started for at least two others . On Saturday investigators with dogs trained to find bodies searched one house at B-LOC and one at B-LOC -- both suburbs of the southern city of B-LOC . Both houses are owned by B-PER . B-MISC media speculated that B-PER , charged with abduction and illegal imprisonment of children , must have had high level protection to molest youngsters . They put forward no proof to support the speculation , but seized on a comment by chief prosecutor B-PER I-PER on B-MISC television on Friday night that he would chase down everyone involved in the case " if I am allowed to " . B-PER said between 300 and 400 paedophile porn video tapes had been seized , some of which featured B-PER . B-PER was charged a week ago after police rescued two young girls from a concrete dungeon in the basement of one of the six houses he owns in and around B-LOC . Just a day later the national euphoria at the rescue turned to disgust as B-PER led police to the bodies of two eight-year-old girls in another of his houses . B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER , had been kidnapped in June last year . B-PER said they starved to death nine months later . He also admitted kidnapping two other girls , B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER , a year ago . The fate of the girls is unknown , but there has been speculation they were sold into prostitution in B-LOC or the B-LOC I-LOC where B-PER was a frequent visitor . B-MISC police have visited B-LOC and will visit B-LOC . Five other people have been arrested including B-PER 's second wife B-PER I-PER , charged as an accomplice . The others have been charged with abduction and illegal imprisonment of children or are suspected of criminal association . B-MISC police are also holding a 74-year old B-MISC in connection with the disappearance of B-PER and B-PER , although a spokesman said no direct link had yet been established . At least part of the speculation in the B-MISC media of high-level protection for B-PER and his accomplices is based on leaked documents cataloguing a high degree of police bungling , incompetence and indifference . Among the revelations are the fact that the gendarmerie was running a surveillance operation codenamed " B-MISC " against B-PER in 1995 -- when both B-PER and B-PER and B-PER and B-PER were kidnapped . They show that the gendarmes were aware that B-PER was building cells in some of his houses for holding children , yet this information was either not passed on to other police forces searching for the missing girls or was overlooked when it was . They also show that police investigating a theft visited B-PER late last year at the house where B-PER and B-PER were being held but accepted his word that the children 's cries they could hear came from neighbours . B-ORG Minister B-PER I-PER I-PER has admitted that mistakes were made and ordered an inquiry at the same time as stressing there were no indications of a cover-up . There is also widespread disbelief that no one appeared to question how B-PER , an unemployed father of three with no visible means of support , managed to own six houses . Death toll of B-LOC bomb put at seven-newspaper . B-LOC 1996-08-24 An B-MISC newspaper on Saturday put at seven -- two women and five children -- the death toll of a bomb blast in a market west of B-LOC on Friday . B-MISC security forces said on Friday three women and two children were killed and five people wounded when a home-made bomb exploded at a market in the coastal town of B-LOC I-LOC , 65 km ( 40 miles ) west of B-LOC . The security forces also said a man carrying an explosive device also died after it went off prematurely . B-ORG paper said the blast killed seven -- a mother and her 25-year-old daughter , four young boys and a five-year-old girl . Several people were also wounded , it said . The explosion was the latest in series of bomb attacks in B-LOC 's four-year-old civil strife . The government-appointed watchdog , B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , was quoted this month by local newspapers as saying about 1,400 civilians have died in bomb attacks blamed on B-MISC rebels in the past two years . An estimated 50,000 B-MISC and more than 110 foreigners have been killed in violence pitting B-MISC rebels against government forces since early 1992 , when the authorities cancelled a general election in which radical B-MISC had taken a commanding lead .
