While 57 percent of the population supported negotiations with B-ORG ( B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ) , 30 percent opposed it , the survey by the state-controlled B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) found . But 80 percent said B-ORG had shown little interest in achieving peace in the B-MISC country when it offered a one-week truce in July while continuing to hold prison officer B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER , kidnapped in January . The problem of terrorism had neither worsened nor improved since the conservative B-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) came to power in May , according to 56 percent of those questioned , while 22 percent said it had worsened . The survey questioned 2,496 people between July 17 and 21 and has a margin of error of plus or minus two percent . Thirty killed as floods plunge B-LOC into chaos . B-LOC 1996-08-24 At least 30 people have been killed and about 100 injured in the flood-hit B-MISC city of B-LOC , newspapers reported on Saturday . They said 461 mm ( 18 inches ) of rain had drenched the B-LOC provincial capital in 36 hours , turning streets into rivers , knocking out power , water and telephone services , disrupting air and rail traffic , and sweeping away houses and cars . Newspapers quoted witnesses as saying they had seen bodies floating in the streets . Among the dead were five members of the religious B-ORG party who drowned while trying to remove books from a basement library . They said thousands of people had been made homeless after a breach opened in the city canal , inundating residential areas . Army troops were called in to evacuate residents of low-lying areas to higher ground . Officials said the B-LOC and B-LOC rivers , which both flow through B-LOC , were in high flood and emergency services backed by troops were on full alert . B-ORG I-ORG funded to develop B-MISC software . B-LOC I-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-25 A small team of engineers from B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG 's B-ORG unit said Sunday they have formed a new company , dubbed B-ORG I-ORG , to build B-MISC infrastructure software . The fledgling company , established in a ground-floor office here over the last two weeks , has received venture financing from B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG of B-LOC I-LOC , B-LOC .. B-PER I-PER , B-ORG I-ORG founder and acting chief executive , is a general partner of B-ORG . The startup company 's acting chairman is B-PER I-PER , the president of B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , a unit of B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG as well as chairman of B-ORG . B-ORG I-ORG , which opened its doors with about half a dozen initial employees , combines experience at B-ORG , B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , and B-ORG I-ORG . " B-MISC portends dramatic changes in the way we use the B-MISC , " said B-PER I-PER , vice president of engineering of the new company after serving as a senior engineer at B-ORG . B-MISC is a computer programming language introduced by B-ORG I-ORG in mid-1995 which has immediately captured the attention of the industry for its ability to operate across virtually all computer system in a relatively secure manner . Just last week , B-ORG I-ORG and the B-LOC I-LOC venture capital giant B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG said they had completed financing of a $ 100 million fund managed by B-ORG I-ORG to fund startups developing B-MISC technologies . B-MISC has been licensed by nearly 50 organisations , ranging from B-ORG I-ORG and B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG to the B-LOC government . B-PER I-PER , another former senior B-ORG engineer who is among the founding engineers at B-ORG I-ORG , said the new company aims to build software infrastructure using B-MISC to make networked applications ubiquitious . One feature of the B-MISC language is that small software programmes , known as " applets " because they are small applications , can be downloaded from the server computers at the centre of networks onto individual computers for use . In this model , individual computer users can always gain access to the latest programmes and do not need to store more software than they are currently using on their computers at any one time , also saving costs of memory and storage . B-PER I-PER , a veteran of B-ORG and a former B-ORG marketing manager , is vice president of marketing at B-ORG I-ORG , whose Web site is www.internetstartup.com . B-ORG has funded numerous B-MISC pioneers , including B-ORG I-ORG , B-ORG and B-ORG . GOLF - B-PER WINS FOURTH TITLE OF YEAR IN B-LOC . B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-25 B-PER I-PER birdied two of the last three holes to win B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC by three strokes over B-PER I-PER on Sunday . It was the fourth tournament title this year for B-PER , who shot an even-par 70 , after being tied for the lead with B-PER I-PER with three holes to play . Along with B-PER at 277 for the tournament were B-PER I-PER , who had a 68 , and B-PER I-PER , with a 66 . " It was very hard to sleep last night because there was so much I could accomplish with this win , " said B-PER , who had a three-stroke lead entering the third round . " This was a win I wanted very , very much . " B-PER 's victory gave him a 10 year exemption to the B-MISC I-MISC . The $ 378,000 first place check brings B-PER back to the top of the money list with $ 1,574,799 won this year . " This is a major championship golf course , and for me to perform well on this style of course is a big step up for me in my career and my performance in future majors , " he said . B-PER three-stroke lead was cut to two when B-PER birdied the course 's only easy hole , the par five second hole , while B-PER three-putted for par from 25 feet . On the back nine B-PER began driving erratically , and poor tee shots resulted in bogeys on the , eighth , 12th and 13th holes , bringing B-PER back to four under par , tied with B-PER , who had parred 14 straight holes after the birdie on no.2 . B-PER then set up a tap in birdie on the 16th , sending a wedge shot to 18 inches . He had another birdie on the 17th , where he his a 6-iron to six feet . B-PER bogeyed the 17th , missing a five foot par putt , and dropped from solo second place to a three way tie for second . It was the second successive year in which B-PER has finished runner up in this tournament . He lost to B-PER I-PER in sudden death last year . The defending champion was in contention , two behind B-PER for much of the day , until he bogeyed the 13th and 14th holes . GOLF - SCORES AT THE B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC . B-PER I-PER ( B-LOC ) B-ORG 82 MOTORCYCLING - B-MISC WIN BOTH ROUND B-PER SUPERBIKE RACES . B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-25 Teenager B-PER I-PER , racing in only his first season , outclassed the big names to win the first race in round nine of the world superbike championship on Sunday . B-PER , 18 , showed poise far beyond his years to overtake B-MISC B-ORG rider B-PER I-PER , last year 's championship runner-up , with four of the 25 laps left . B-ORG 's B-PER was pursued past B-PER by the B-ORG duo of B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER with B-PER briefly taking the lead in the final chicane on the last lap . But B-PER found one more spurt of power to just take the flag first with B-PER second and B-PER third . B-PER had the consolation of recording the fastest lap at 147.159 kph . B-PER , who crashed during practice on Friday , limped in fourth , four seconds behind B-PER with championship leader B-PER I-PER of B-LOC I-LOC 11 seconds behind the winner . In the second race , B-PER again challenged strongly until the fifth lap from the end when he crashed while running second to eventual race winner B-PER I-PER . B-PER , the elder brother of reigning 125cc world champion B-PER , had a race-long duel with B-PER I-PER of the B-LOC I-LOC on a B-ORG before taking the chequered flag . B-PER led for the early laps before he was passed first by B-PER , who recorded the fastest lap of 147.786 kph , and then by B-PER . With B-PER out of the race , B-PER regained second place but he could not overtake B-PER . B-PER again was the unlucky rider finishing third ahead of B-PER with B-PER in 10th place . But the strong showing by the B-MISC riders did not alter the championship table with B-PER still leading on 280 points , followed by B-PER with 269 and B-PER with 254 . B-LOC 1996-08-25 B-MISC I-MISC fast bowler B-PER I-PER concluded his B-ORG career with a flourish on Sunday by taking the final three wickets during the county 's Sunday league victory over B-ORG . B-PER , who returns home on Tuesday for an ankle operation , took the last three wickets in nine balls as B-ORG were dismissed for 154 . After an hour 's interruption for rain , B-ORG then reached an adjusted target of 109 with 13 balls to spare and record their fifth win in the last six games . B-ORG are currently in fourth position behind B-ORG , B-ORG and B-ORG . B-ORG captain B-PER I-PER completed his third Sunday league century as his side swept clear at the top of the table , reaching a career best 111 not out against B-ORG . B-ORG 's total of 205 for eight from 40 overs looked reasonable before B-PER put their attack to the sword , collecting his runs from just 100 balls with three sixes and nine fours . B-ORG eventually reached their target with only four wickets down and 7.5 overs to spare . SOCCER - B-PER CALLED INTO B-LOC SQUAD . CRICKET - RUN-OUT GIVES B-PER AND B-LOC SLIM SATISFACTION . B-LOC 1996-08-25 B-PER I-PER did his best to forget his controversial omission from the B-LOC one-day squad on Sunday but could not prevent B-LOC reasserting their dominance in the final test at B-LOC I-LOC . A super piece of fielding by B-PER , dropped as a disciplinary measure after arriving only 35 minutes before the start on the fourth morning , provided the only bright spot for B-LOC as the touring team batted on to reach 413 for five at the interval , a lead of 87 . The solitary wicket to fall was B-PER I-PER , run out for 13 attempting a second run to third man where B-PER was lurking with a point to prove . There seemed scant danger until the B-ORG player swooped on to the ball and returned off balance to county team mate B-PER I-PER who whipped off the bails . B-PER , though , could not make similar waves with the ball as B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER batted through the rest of the session with few alarms . B-PER rattled along to 30 not out , outscoring his partner who was unbeaten on 24 at the break , although the weather was again threatening to play the dominant role . Rain arrived just as the players left the field for lunch , forcing the ground-staff into action yet again . The weather delayed the resumption for over an hour , the umpires finally announcing play would start again at 1445 local time ( 1345 B-MISC ) . B-LOC 1996-08-25 B-PER I-PER 's two-out single in the sixth inning scored B-PER I-PER with the go-ahead run as the B-ORG I-ORG rallied past the B-ORG I-ORG 5-4 and took over the B-MISC I-MISC 's wild-card berth on Saturday . The B-ORG trailed 4-3 when pinch-hitter B-PER I-PER led off the sixth with a triple against reliever B-PER I-PER ( 0-1 ) and scored the tying run on B-PER 's single . After B-PER I-PER sacrificed , B-PER hit the first pitch into right field for a single , scoring B-PER . In B-LOC , former B-PER I-PER I-PER 's first career grand slam in the sixth inning off reliever B-PER I-PER lifted the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG to their fifth win in six games , a 9-5 victory over B-LOC . " Just one of those things , I was just trying to make contact , " said B-PER . " The bases were loaded and I had two strikes . I was just trying to put the ball in play . I got the good part of the bat on it and it carried out . " In B-ORG , B-PER I-PER 's two-out single in the top of the 10th brought home B-PER I-PER with the winning run as the B-ORG I-ORG sent the B-ORG I-ORG to their third straight extra-inning defeat 4-3 . B-PER I-PER ( 5-1 ) , acquired from the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG on Friday , earned the win in his B-ORG debut despite allowing the tying run in the eighth inning . At B-LOC , B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER hit solo homers and B-PER I-PER allowed six hits over seven innings to earn his first win as a starter in a month as the B-ORG I-ORG held on to beat the B-ORG I-ORG 6-5 . " Yeah , you know it 's fun , it 's always fun when you 've got a chance to go to the ballpark and win a game that 's important , " said B-PER . " Every game should be important , but it 's a little more important now . " In B-LOC I-LOC , B-PER I-PER allowed two runs over seven innings for his first win in more than two years and B-PER I-PER 's three-run double snapped a sixth-inning tie as the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG held on for a 5-4 victory over the B-ORG I-ORG . B-PER , promoted from B-ORG I-ORG on Wednesday , allowed seven hits and struck out one without a walk . It was his first win since defeating the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG on May 28th , 1994 when he was with the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . In B-LOC I-LOC , B-PER I-PER came within one out of his third complete game and B-PER I-PER homered and drove in three runs as the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG broke a six-game losing streak with a 9-2 victory over the B-ORG I-ORG in a battle of cellar-dwellers . B-PER ( 5-3 ) allowed two runs -- one earned -- and seven hits over 8-2/3 innings with three walks and six strikeouts . In his last four starts , the 21-year-old left-hander has given up only four earned runs in 29-2/3 innings . BASEBALL - B-ORG RALLY TO BEAT B-ORG . B-LOC 1996-08-25 B-PER I-PER went 5-for-5 and homered twice , including a three-run blast with two out in the bottom of the ninth inning that lifted the B-ORG I-ORG to a 6-5 victory over the B-ORG I-ORG on Saturday . " I was just trying to hang in there and hit it up the middle , " said B-PER about his homer in the ninth . " I was just looking for the ball , trying to stay on it . B-PER I-PER ( 6-2 ) picked up the win in relief for B-LOC , which has won 11 of its last 13 games . In B-LOC , B-PER I-PER threw an eight-hitter for his third complete game and B-PER I-PER homered and drove in three runs as the B-ORG I-ORG beat the B-ORG I-ORG 9-3 . B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER each added two B-MISC for B-LOC , which improved the major league 's best home mark to 44-20 . At B-LOC , B-PER I-PER scattered seven hits over eight innings and B-PER I-PER snapped a sixth-inning tie with a two-run double as the B-ORG I-ORG defeated the tired B-ORG I-ORG 5-3 . The B-ORG won for just the third time in nine games , taking advantage of a B-ORG ' team that has not had a day off since August 8th and was playing its fourth game in 43 hours . In B-LOC I-LOC , B-PER I-PER allowed two runs in seven innings and singled home the go-ahead run and B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER drove in two runs apiece as the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG defeated the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG 7-5 . B-PER ( 8-9 ) walked one , allowed five hits and struck out a season-high eight batters for B-LOC I-LOC , which has won 10 of its last 14 games . In B-LOC I-LOC , B-PER I-PER allowed two hits over seven innings and B-PER I-PER hit his major league-record 69th leadoff homer as the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG defeated the B-ORG I-ORG 7-1 for their fifth win in six games . B-PER ( 12-7 ) won his second straight start , allowing just a sixth-inning run and a pair of singles . B-LOC 1996-08-25 B-MISC champions B-ORG kicked off the season with a disappointing 2-2 home draw against B-ORG and were lucky to squeeze in an equaliser in extra time . B-ORG , who are fighting to take their third consecutive title this season , were 2-0 down until the 86th minute when a header by B-PER I-PER found the net after a string of missed opportunities , including a penalty taken by top league scorer B-PER I-PER in the 60th minute . B-PER redeemed himself by netting the equaliser just into extra time . B-ORG , who put on a skilful counter-attack throughout the game , opened the scoring 16 minutes into the match when an unmarked B-PER I-PER shot around B-ORG 's new B-MISC keeper B-PER I-PER . B-PER scored his second in the 70th minute . B-ORG , also playing their first game of the season at home , were held to a 1-1 draw by northern side B-ORG despite the fact that the visitors were reduced to 10 men in the 54th minute after B-PER I-PER was sent off for a second bookable offence . B-ORG dominated the game but their lack of a first-class striker was apparent throughout and in the 30th minute they lost key B-MISC midfielder B-PER who suffered a light knee injury . He was substituted by B-PER . B-ORG finally opened the scoring in the 81st minute with a penalty taken by B-PER after B-PER I-PER tripped up captain B-PER I-PER under the referee 's nose . B-LOC 1996-08-25 B-MISC striker B-PER I-PER gave B-ORG the perfect 70th birthday present on Sunday with two goals that gave the B-MISC I-MISC winners a 2-1 B-MISC victory over B-MISC I-MISC champions B-ORG . The victory , coming on the eve of the founding of the B-LOC club in 1926 , also marked the first time since the pre-season trophy between the B-MISC winners and league champions was started in 1988 that the B-MISC winners had won . B-PER gave B-ORG the lead in the 11th minute . B-MISC midfielder B-PER I-PER equalised for the home team , weaving past a defender , checking and firing in a left-footed shot in the 21st minute that gave young B-ORG goalkeeper B-PER I-PER little chance . B-MISC international midfielder B-PER I-PER fouled the B-MISC , whose coach at B-ORG I-ORG before he joined B-ORG in 1991 was new B-ORG coach B-PER I-PER , and B-PER rammed home the free kick from 30 metres out . All three clocked the same time of five hours 51 minutes , 52 seconds . Former world champion B-PER I-PER of the B-LOC I-LOC was in front as the leading pack of seven riders turned into the B-LOC velodrome for the final one lap sprint but quickly faded and settled for fourth . The back-to-back wins vault B-PER from sixth to second in the overall B-MISC I-MISC rankings with 112 points but B-PER continues to hold a commanding lead with 162 points after eight of the 11 rounds . B-LOC 1996-08-25 B-MISC soccer captain B-PER I-PER has decided to end his international career , B-ORG spokesman B-PER I-PER said on Sunday . B-PER told B-MISC news agency B-ORG that B-PER , 35 , would no longer be available for selection for the national squad . The B-ORG defender , who led the B-LOC into the quarter-finals at June 's B-MISC championship finals in B-LOC , had decided to devote his attention to playing for his B-LOC club , B-PER said . B-PER , who played in the B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC and the B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC , was capped 42 times for the B-LOC . CRICKET - B-LOC BANS B-PER FOR 50 DAYS . B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-25 B-MISC opener B-PER I-PER I-PER was on Sunday given a 50-day ban from international cricket for quitting this year 's tour of B-LOC , the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG said . The right-handed batsman will have to forfeit half the money he was due to earn from the tour , the news agency said after a disciplinary committee set up by the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG met at B-LOC , near the northern city of B-LOC . B-PER abandoned the B-MISC team after the third one-day international against B-LOC at B-LOC I-LOC in B-LOC on May 26 , before B-LOC began a three-test series , citing serious differences with captain B-PER I-PER . B-PER was sacked after the tour and replaced by B-PER I-PER . B-PER was not considered for the four-nation B-MISC I-MISC beginning in B-LOC I-LOC this month and the B-MISC I-MISC against B-LOC scheduled to be played in B-LOC next month . B-PER , whose ban ends on October 14 , will be free to play domestic cricket . B-LOC , Aug 25 - Captain B-PER I-PER and his B-ORG I-ORG revisited the test venue today to relive some of the magic moments of yesterday 's momentous rugby victory over B-LOC I-LOC , B-ORG reported . Most of the test 15 who beat the B-ORG 33-26 to secure B-LOC I-LOC 's first-ever rugby series in B-LOC I-LOC stood in the middle of the empty 50,000-seat B-LOC I-LOC . Magnificent , ' ' said B-PER , B-LOC I-LOC 's most capped player and the world 's most capped forward . The players relived the moves and tries , the tackles and what might have been as the emotions of victory continued . B-PER I-PER , the only No 8 in test rugby to have scored a dropped goal when he kicked a three-pointer against B-LOC during last year 's B-MISC I-MISC , added a second to his name yesterday . I was right here , ' ' he said standing at the spot where he had received the ball for the kick . The maul was there and I was going to go in but I thought I should hold off because we had the ball . When ( halfback ) B-PER I-PER got the ball he was going to go on the openside where B-PER I-PER was so I emptied my lung at him to get the ball this way . I just hit through and I was punching the air before the ball got there . It cost me a few bucks at the bar . ' ' The decision to attempt a dropped goal was a spontaneous one , B-PER said . It was just like the B-MISC I-MISC , the ball came and the chance was there . ' ' Centre B-PER I-PER said he had never felt so exhausted during a match . We were gutted and there was nowhere to hide , they just kept coming at you , ' ' he said . I was gone in the first 20 minutes , completely exhausted , but you had no choice . There was just so much riding on it . It 's amazing just how big this ground was yesterday . ' ' Two-try winger B-PER I-PER said he was so tired that he kept asking B-PER where he should be while defending . He told me I 'm buggered too so just hang in there ' , ' ' B-PER recalled . About 4000 B-MISC I-MISC supporters were partying into the early hours of today in the B-MISC I-MISC capital . Messages of goodwill continued to roll into the team hotel . B-ORG I-ORG coach B-PER I-PER said Prime Minister B-PER I-PER rang him today to offer his congratulations . He thanked us on behalf of the country , which is really nice for the team , and I understand we had tremendous support at home . ' ' B-MISC I-MISC - B-ORG results and standings . B-PER I-PER B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-25 B-LOC I-LOC 's truth commission begins issuing subpoenas this week in a bid to dig beneath the political rationales and find the sinister figures who have the blood of the country 's race war on their hands . Leaders of the major parties involved , from right-wing whites to radical blacks , appeared before Archbishop B-PER I-PER 's B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG last week to paint the broad picture of their actions for or against apartheid . Most , including former president B-PER I-PER I-PER and B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG Deputy President B-PER I-PER , offered apologies for any mistakes they had made and accepted broad responsibility for the actions of their foot soldiers . But none named those guilty of ordering or carrying out any of the gross violations of human rights which B-PER is investigating . Human rights lawyer B-PER I-PER said the hearings last week were not intended as a form of confessional and that those who personally committed crimes during apartheid would testify only before a separate arm of the commission , the amnesty committee . " I do n't think one should have expected more than what one got , " he said . " That was not the amnesty committee where perpetrators are expected to open their hearts and souls and to tell it all . " The commission , which has the power to grant amnesty to those who confess to abuses , has begun hearing the testimony from people already in jail for their deeds . But others , such as self-confessed secret police hit-squad leader B-PER I-PER , have yet to testify . B-PER 's deputy chairman , B-PER I-PER , told reporters the commission would begin issuing subpoenas to suspects who refused to appear voluntarily some time this week . He added that former hardline apartheid president B-PER I-PER could be among those called . But B-PER , who is advising several people regarded as perpetrators , said this was not the best way to achieve the commission 's aims . " A person can be forced to appear , but the only way one is going to get to the truth in its totality is if people feel it is a good idea to go to the amnesty committee . At the moment this is not the case . " He cited B-PER , who was charged with murder after confessing in media interviews to dirty tricks . His trial is due to start in December but the truth commission intends to decide on his amnesty application before that . B-PER said the law had to be changed so all judicial prosecutions were automatically suspended for those who approached the truth commission . Last week 's submissions to the commission by the B-ORG , B-PER I-PER 's B-ORG I-ORG and the right-wing B-ORG I-ORG of General B-PER I-PER left many B-MISC I-MISC unsatisfied . B-PER said the picture was incomplete because officers of the apartheid-era security forces had yet to make their scheduled , separate submission , but one black caller to a radio talk show declared : " This whole thing is utterly useless , it does n't help us at all . What the people expect is to have houses , to have jobs . " Political scientist B-PER I-PER said he doubted that the B-ORG I-ORG , which implemented apartheid in 1948 and began dismantling it in 1990 , felt it carried a burden of guilt and needed to be exculpated through the commission . " Therefore I have some doubts about achieving some form of reconciliation . One has to feel a bit guilty to feel the need for reconciling yourself to a historical adversary , " he said . Professor B-PER I-PER of the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG demurred , saying : " In the irritation , in the jokes , in the anger that white B-MISC I-MISC express about the commission , I think there 's a moral uneasiness , and I think that 's healthy . Responsibility is percolating downwards . " B-MISC refugees seek to vote in B-MISC town . B-PER I-PER B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-25 Thousands of B-MISC refugees denounced B-LOC 's elections as a farce on Sunday because B-MISC incomers would be able to vote in their old home town , cementing partition of the country . They said they were ready to force their way back across post-war ethnic lines to B-MISC B-LOC , one of several towns where B-ORG troops fear violence involving refugees determined to vote where they once lived . The refugees , rallying in B-LOC on government territory two km from B-LOC in northeast B-LOC , waved banners calling the polls a farce staged by the B-ORG I-ORG and the B-ORG I-ORG . " We demand to vote in B-LOC , " other banners said . B-LOC 's B-MISC central government and many displaced B-MISC are angered by a key provision of the B-MISC September 14 elections allowing people to vote in post-war " new places of residence . " As a result , separatist B-MISC authorities have packed former B-MISC majority towns with refugees of their own or registered other B-MISC to vote there . Critics say that what was billed as an electoral process to reintegrate B-LOC as a single , multi-ethnic state is shaping up as a referendum on partition , de facto or de jure . " Only our physical presence in B-LOC will mean that the B-LOC peace treaty has truly been implemented , " B-PER I-PER I-PER , B-LOC 's B-MISC imam-in-exile , told the refugees . " The main point of this rally is to highlight to the world powers what misfortune they brought upon us , " said B-PER I-PER , head of B-LOC municipality-in-exile . " Eleven thousand B-MISC who came from elsewhere to B-LOC will vote there . How can we then expect the reintegration of B-LOC ? But no one will stop us from returning to our homes . " B-PER I-PER , a government refugee official , said : " We want to vote where we were thrown out from . This is a protest of warning and the next step is entering our town using all means possible , so let them shoot . " B-MISC Vice President B-PER I-PER , a B-MISC , told the refugees : " We have a message for the B-MISC who are now in our homes not to plan the future of their children there because there will be no good fortune in that . " To loud applause , he added : " We will enter B-LOC , untie the B-LOC knot and ensure free movement for all . We have to enter B-LOC to free the B-MISC from their own ( separatist ) politics . " The B-LOC peace accords guaranteed refugees the right to return to their homes and ensured freedom of movement across ethnic lines . But local police , controlled by nationalist parties in B-MISC , B-MISC and B-MISC sectors of B-LOC , and civilian mobs have turned ceasefire lines into virtually impassable borders . The majority of refugees from B-LOC 's 1992-95 war are B-MISC from the B-MISC north and east . B-MISC peace troops beefed up their presence in the B-LOC area on Sunday to deter any sudden emotional attempt by the refugees to cross the B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC into B-LOC . But the crowd dispersed without incident . B-MISC and B-MISC have scuffled several times along the line in the past when B-MISC refugees tried to surge into the town . Eight killed in B-LOC casino blaze . B-LOC 1996-08-25 Eight people died on Sunday in a blaze at a B-LOC casino which the fire service said might have been started deliberately , B-ORG news agency said . The number of casinos has soared in B-LOC since the collapse of communism . The mayor has said he wants to cut their number to five as part of a war against organised crime . President B-PER I-PER signed a decree on fighting crime in July and handed wide-ranging powers to security chief B-PER I-PER , currently engaged in making peace in breakaway B-LOC . B-MISC troops start pullout , but not in B-LOC . B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-25 B-MISC troops began to pull out from southern B-LOC on Sunday under a ceasefire agreement between B-MISC security chief B-PER I-PER and rebel leaders . But in the capital B-LOC , the commander of B-MISC Interior Ministry forces in B-LOC , General B-PER I-PER , told B-ORG news agency he was delaying a pullout of troops there after a group of B-MISC disarmed an armoured column . B-ORG cameraman B-PER I-PER said a column of around 40 vehicles , including tanks , armoured personnel carriers , artillery cannons and lorries , escorted by B-MISC rebels , pulled out of the village of B-LOC towards the border , around 50 km ( 31 miles ) to the north . In B-LOC , B-PER told B-ORG he was suspending the pullout of troops from the capital until weapons seized by the B-MISC were returned . B-MISC rebel spokesman B-PER I-PER confirmed the weapons had been seized but that it was a maverick group of B-MISC . He said later that the rebels had handed them over . The pullout of the B-MISC troops is a key element of the peace plan brokered by B-PER , which aims to end the 20-month B-LOC conflict . Leftist B-MISC armed group says troops in capital . B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-25 The leftist B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) in a published report on Sunday said it operated throughout B-LOC , including the capital , and denied government assertions it was isolated to one state . Commanders " B-PER " and " B-PER " , guarded by a dozen B-ORG gunmen , said in an interview with B-ORG I-ORG outside B-LOC I-LOC that the armed group was committed to overthrowing the government . " They ( government officials ) want to present us before public opinion as a local problem , as just being from B-LOC and as irrational radicals , " Commander B-PER told B-ORG I-ORG . They said the B-ORG , whose fighters first appeared wearing military fatigues and brandishing assault rifles in the southwestern state of B-LOC on June 28 , had a 23,000-strong membership , but this could not be confirmed independently . B-ORG I-ORG also reported on Sunday that the B-ORG I-ORG has discovered a 37-page , B-ORG manual detailing guerrilla tactics and strategies . It quoted the manual as saying : " The objective of the Basic Course on War is to provide for combatants of the B-ORG basic military knowledge for the armed conflict against the police and military apparatus of the bourgeoisie . " It was the second time armed " commanders " of the B-ORG have granted interviews outside B-LOC state , an extremely poor and volatile region where leftist protesters often have clashed violently with authorities . Unlike the better known and unrelated B-ORG rebels in southeastern B-LOC state , the B-ORG has never taken on the army in direct combat , according to official reports . There have only been a few skirmishes in B-LOC in which a handful of police , soldiers and civilians have been killed or injured . Ten people gunned down in northwest B-LOC . B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-25 Unidentified gunmen dragged 10 men out ot their homes in a rural area of B-LOC 's northwest province of B-LOC and shot them to death , authorities said on Sunday . Police said the killings occurred on Saturday morning in the municipality of B-LOC but news of the massacre only reached the provincial capital of B-LOC early on Sunday . B-LOC is only 20 miles ( 30 km ) west of B-LOC , but there are no roads linking it directly to the city . Police initially said leftist B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) rebels were prime suspects in the killings . But gunmen of the left and right have killed with impunity across B-LOC for years , and there were unconfirmed reports that the latest bloodshed was the work of a right-wing paramilitary group . Port of B-LOC year profit climbs . B-LOC 1996-08-26 Year to June 30 . ( million B-MISC unless stated ) Net profit 9.050 vs 6.03 Two B-MISC border police wounded by B-LOC gunmen . B-LOC I-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-25 Two B-MISC border policemen were seriously wounded on Sunday when members of a B-MISC rebel splinter faction ambushed their patrol in northwest B-LOC , security officers said . The two were wounded in the early hours of Sunday when some 30 members of the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) ambushed their patrol on the B-MISC side of the border with B-LOC , to the north of the town of B-LOC I-LOC . The B-MISC army commander in the area , Col B-PER I-PER , told reporters the B-ORG , which is allied with the B-LOC military government and based in southeast B-LOC , had recently stepped up cross-border infiltration . B-PER said the motive for their intrusions was not clear but he had ordered reinforcements to beef up security along the porous frontier . The B-ORG was formed in late 1994 by hundreds of guerrillas who split from the B-MISC B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) and allied themselves with B-MISC government army , their former enemies . B-ORG members have since launched intermittent cross-border attacks on B-MISC refugee camps in B-LOC , where the majority of inhabitants are B-ORG supporters , and on B-MISC villages and police posts near the border . B-LOC has complained to B-LOC about the raids but B-MISC military authorities say they have no contol over the faction . B-MISC army commanders reject the explanation , saying they have evidence the B-MISC army supplies and directs the renegade ethnic minority splinter faction . B-LOC hopes jars will reveal secrets of mummies . B-LOC 1996-08-25 Archaeologists in B-LOC have found pots used by ancient B-MISC in burial rites that they say may reveal the secrets of mummification . B-PER I-PER , director of the B-MISC Museum , told B-ORG television a B-LOC team found the pots , some of which contain human intestines , in a tomb built into the rocks while digging in B-LOC , a village 40 km ( 25 miles ) south of B-LOC . B-LOC is the site of B-LOC 's second largest pyramid , built for the pharaoh B-PER more than 4,500 years ago . B-PER said the team -- from B-LOC I-LOC 's B-LOC I-LOC -- found four B-MISC jars and two unguent jars in the tomb , which belongs to an unidentifed person who lived during the B-MISC I-MISC ( 1991-1786 B-MISC ) in the B-LOC I-LOC . " This finding is important because one of the jars still contains substances and materials used in the conservation of mummies and the conservation of the intestines and all the things which were in the cavity of a person we have not identified yet , " B-PER said . " We hope that the analysis of such substances and liquids will reveal some secrets of the mummification process and materials used in this process , " he added . B-LOC I-LOC executes B-MISC man . Voting begins in second round of B-MISC election . B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-25 Voting began on Sunday in north B-LOC in the second round of parliamentary elections with 580,000 voters eligible to choose 28 members of the 128-member parliament . A thin trickle of voters began casting their ballots in this northern port city for the five rival lists of candidates as polling stations opened at 7 a.m. ( 0400 gmt ) . B-MISC president invites B-PER to home - paper . B-LOC 1996-08-25 B-MISC President B-PER I-PER has invited B-PER I-PER to meet him at his private home , B-LOC 's biggest newspaper said on Sunday . The B-ORG I-ORG daily reported that Prime Minister B-PER I-PER , who has said he has no desire to hold talks with the B-MISC president , opposes the meeting due to be held this coming week . The newspaper said B-PER scheduled the meeting at his private residence in the central B-MISC village of B-LOC after B-PER sent him an emotional appeal " to save the peace process " . B-PER met B-PER last Tuesday and voiced his opposition , B-ORG said . " I am prepared to postpone the meeting under one condition -- that you give me a commitment right now to meet B-PER yourself within 10 days , " the paper quoted B-PER as telling B-PER . It said B-PER had yet to give B-PER an answer . The office of B-MISC president is largely ceremonial . But B-PER , a former defence minister and an architect of B-LOC 's peace treaty with B-LOC , has spoken out frequently on the peace process with the B-MISC -- at times urging the former B-ORG government to slow it down . Corporate B-LOC taking new view on compensation . B-PER I-PER B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-23 Corporate B-LOC is planning major changes in employee compensation in the next few years , according to a recent study . What it comes down to is this : If you 're highly skilled , you 'll benefit nicely . But if you 're not and cannot contribute to your employer 's goals , you 'll be paid less . The survey , conducted in late 1995 and the early part of this year by management consulting firm B-ORG I-ORG , showed that the focus will be on an employee 's overall value to the company 's bottom line -- rather than how well an employee performs a specific task . Presently , for example , if an accountant 's job involves doing five specific tasks , he or she can expect a certain salary , said B-PER I-PER , a B-ORG I-ORG principal . In the future , the accountant will be evaluated solely on " knowledge , skill and abilities , " she said . In addition to using accounting skills , the accountant will also have to be creative , work well in a team , be sensitive to customer needs and set productivity goals . " The good news is , if you 're highly skilled and have many abilities , you 'll be paid more , " said B-PER . " The bad news is , if you 're not skilled and ca n't contribute to a team , to customer service and the organisation 's goals , you 'll be paid less . " Of the 750 mid-to-large size corporations surveyed , 81 percent had undergone a major restructuring in the last three years , and more than two-thirds reported that productivity and profits were up as result . Next on the agenda for these firms is developing a new compensation structure , and 78 percent report that they are considering a new , skills-based plan for both management and non-management employees . This coming shift , B-PER said , " is not just isolated or a fad . It 's an inexorable change . " After B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC , corporations adopted a " military model " creating hierarchical organisations where " the concept of defined tasks worked great , " she said . But as the economy became global , customers were more demanding and problems became more complex . " Multi-layers kept management at a distance from its customers , " B-PER said . Now organisations must change to stay competitive . B-PER says firms will place a greater emphasis on teams and team performance in giving raises . If your team does well , you 'll do well . If it does n't do well , do n't expect a raise . Is this fair to an employee who can go the distance but is on a team that ca n't keep up ? " That 's an important question we used to ask a lot , " said B-PER . " It 's not a question we ask any more . The more important question is -- ' Do we have results ? ' " To get those results , 27 percent of the companies surveyed plan to eliminate base pay increases in favour of cash bonuses and incentives , such as employee and team award programmes and education . Companies that can change their culture and view employees as business partners will do well , B-PER said . For example , the survey rated some participants in the survey as " high-performing " companies , based on their return on equity above 16 percent . Those companies also said they already offer employees variable pay and business education , give their managers more control over pay decisions and celebrate employee and team success . " They respect employees more , they trust employees more and they value their employees more , " B-PER said . " The key to success at high-performance companies is engaging employees in a business partnership . It will improve a company 's bottom line . " B-MISC police arrest detective in B-PER affair . B-PER I-PER I-PER B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-25 Investigators arrested a senior police detective on Sunday in connection with their inquiries into B-LOC 's child sex scandal , Public Prosecutor B-PER I-PER said . " B-PER I-PER was arrested and will be charged with truck theft , insurance fraud and document forgery , " B-PER told a news conference . He said there had been searches at three sites on Sunday , including one at the B-LOC judicial police headquarters where B-PER worked . B-PER , 45 , is a specialist in tackling vehicle theft . B-MISC media reported that he had been questioned twice in the past two years about thefts but released both times . He was promoted to chief detective earlier this year . B-PER said two other people had also been arrested . One was B-PER I-PER , the owner of a warehouse where stolen vehicles were allegedly stored . The other was insurer B-PER I-PER . B-PER said the investigation into the vehicle theft ring would be added to the inquiry into the paedophile sex scandal in which five other people have already been arrested . He said the connection was through B-PER I-PER , an accomplice of convicted child rapist B-PER I-PER -- the central figure in the paedophile scandal that has sent shockwaves across B-LOC . B-PER was found dead last weekend alongside the bodies of eight-year-olds B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER in a house belonging to B-PER , who said they starved to death earlier this year , nine months after being abducted in June 1995 . Two other girls have been rescued and police are hunting for at least two more who B-PER has admitted kidnapping a year ago . " B-PER has admitted killing B-PER after a disagreement between the accomplices in an affair of truck theft , " B-PER said . Another four people were also questioned at the weekend but had not been detained , B-PER added . B-PER I-PER , public prosecutor in the eastern city of B-LOC where B-PER and B-PER lived , said this was a major case involving some 50 investigators -- including two from the B-LOC B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . Five people died later in hospital . B-MISC I-MISC highway opening put off , radio says . B-LOC 1996-08-25 The planned reopening of B-LOC 's main northern B-LOC highway as a result of peace talks with an opposition alliance has been put off until Wednesday , official B-ORG I-ORG said on Sunday . The embattled B-MISC government said last week that the B-LOC highway would be opened on Monday or Tuesday following talks with the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG led by B-ORG movement of powerful opposition warlord General B-PER I-PER I-PER . The radio said on Sunday the postponement of the opening had been made due to " precautions " . It did not elaborate . The B-LOC highway , B-LOC 's main route to B-LOC I-LOC , has been controlled by B-PER since he began fighting President B-PER I-PER 's government in B-LOC in January 1994 in alliance with B-ORG party leader B-PER I-PER , then prime minister but rival to the president . B-PER rejoined the government as prime minister last June under a peace pact with B-PER and has since been trying to persuade other opposition factions to follow suit . Earlier this month , B-PER denied a B-LOC government statement that the two sides had agreed to a ceasefire in the north . Students burn B-PER effigy , battle police . B-PER I-PER B-LOC 1996-08-25 Students backed by opposition parties battled police and burned an effigy of Prime Minister Sheikh B-PER during a strike in the north B-MISC town of B-LOC on Sunday . The strikers barricaded streets , attacked the local office of the ruling B-ORG I-ORG , fought running battles with police and set alight hundreds of copies of the popular " B-ORG " newspaper , alleging it was pro-government . Police used batons and teargas to try to disperse students who were throwing stones and home-made bombs , witnesses said . The strike , called by the main opposition B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) , to denounce the deaths of four students killed by police over the last few days , coincided with a visit to the area by B-PER . Local officials said one policeman was killed by gunshots during clashes with pro-opposition students on Thursday . B-PER told a cross section of people at the B-LOC police headquarters on Sunday that the government had already suspended three police officers and ordered a judicial probe into the violent incidents . The prime minister offered financial grants to the families of those killed , ordered the best possible medical care for the injured and urged B-LOC residents to call off the strike . Opposition legislators walked out of parliament in B-LOC on Sunday denouncing " unprecedented police barbarity " against opposition students and supporters . They renewed their call for the resignation of Home ( Interior ) Minister B-PER I-PER . Hundreds of police raided the B-LOC university on Sunday , arresting nearly 30 outsiders who had been living in student dormitories and seizing weapons , university officials said . Police stormed ten residence halls on the campus , flushed out people at gunpoint and searched their baggage . They seized revolvers , sawn-off rifles , shotguns and knives . The students were later allowed to return . The swoop followed the resignation of the university 's Vice-Chancellor Dr. B-PER I-PER on Saturday over the deteriorating law and order situation on the campus . Authorities closed down the 28,000-student university on Wednedsay following gunbattles between students and police . Police said they fought armed activists from the B-ORG , headed by former prime minister B-PER I-PER I-PER . B-PER told police the home ministry had already given a " blanket order " to arrest terrorists and possessors of illegal firearms irrespective of their political identities . Nearly 100 students have been injured in the clashes in B-LOC and B-LOC , police told reporters . 16 die as bus crashes in B-LOC I-LOC . B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-25 At least 16 people were killed and several injured on Sunday when a bus fell from a mountain road into a ravine on a river bank in B-MISC B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC I-LOC I-LOC , police said . They said 14 out of 45 passengers on the bus died instantly when the vehicle fell from the narrow road while on its way from the state capital B-LOC to the nearby B-MISC town of B-LOC I-LOC in the northwest . Two died later in hospital . FEATURE - Fertile B-LOC faces drought of cash and rain . B-PER I-PER B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-26 Four shiny new green-and-yellow B-PER I-PER combines parked at this 1,750-hectare ( 4,325-acre ) farm in the grain-growing regions south of B-LOC do n't fill its chief agronomist with enthusiasm . " They did a good job this year , but they need good diesel and good engine oil , " said B-PER I-PER . " B-PER help us if there is a breakdown , " he said of the machinery , loaned to the farm after the B-MISC government bought it earlier this year . The country 's grain harvest this year is forecast to fall by more than 23 percent to only 28 million tonnes and two harsh factors are to blame . A drought scoured the steppes in May and June , stunting the growing wheat . And the farming sector , making the painful transition from B-MISC central planning to a market economy simply has no money . B-LOC 's black soil is so fertile that a diplomat described it as " rich enough to grow rubber boots " . But recently B-LOC has been losing its reputation as a breadbasket of B-LOC , earned in the years before brutal forced collectivisation under B-MISC dictator B-PER I-PER . " The wheat will not be of a good quality this year , " said B-PER I-PER , a scientist at the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , run by the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . " The temperature on the ground reached 62 decrees B-MISC ( 143.60 Fahrenheit ) this summer . We 've never seen anything so bad , " he said in an interview in his office , unlit since the government cut off electricity because of unpaid power bills . The harvest is gathered in the dry areas , but rainfall in B-LOC I-LOC has delayed harvesting there . While B-ORG 's scientists , some unpaid for months , carry on developing new strains of wheat resistant to B-LOC 's extreme continental climate , B-PER said the lack of cash in B-LOC 's agricultural sector is as bad as the drought . Collective farms and B-LOC 's nascent private farming sector have no money for fertiliser , no money for herbicides and pesticides , no money to repair old or buy new machinery , no money for fuel , and none to buy good seed . This year 's harvest is down from last year 's 36.5 million tonne harvest , which in turn compares with 50 million tonnes in 1990 , the year before independence . The decline is all the worse for people who recall wasteful B-MISC times , when the B-LOC imported grain but priced bread so cheaply that people bought it to feed their pigs . " Agriculture is very expensive , and there are no solutions to our problems on the horizon , " said B-PER . He said his farm , its 260 workers now readying the fields for winter wheat sowing , expected the land to yield 5.2 tonnes per hectare ( 2.5 acres ) but ended up with 3.9 tonnes -- still better than the national average of 2.11 tonnes per hectare this year . " We did not have money for fertiliser , we 're in debt for fuel , and we 're borrowing diesel , " B-PER said . A few kilometres ( miles ) down the two-lane road which passes B-PER 's farm , where the occasional horse-drawn buggy passes by , is the 1,700-hectare ( 4,200-acre ) B-PER collective farm , built next to a village still neat and tidy despite B-MISC decay . Chief Accountant B-PER I-PER said the collective is strapped for cash , earlier this year bartering 220 tonnes of grain for diesel to fuel six rickety grain combines and tractors badly in need of repairs and basic maintenance . The average family earns 160-200 million karbovanets a year ( $ 800 - $ 1,000 ) -- but many have not been paid in months , B-PER said . " People are working out of their own dedication . " B-PER said the farm sector has two options : " We can sit down and cry , or we can do something . " He said the government plans to increase the sowing of the winter wheat which will be harvested next year . Planted in late summer and early autumn , the grain is B-LOC 's largest export item and traditionally grows better than summer wheat in B-LOC 's soil . Further plans , he said , called for full provision of resources like fertiliser and herbicides for 25 percent of B-LOC 's arable land next year , for 50 percent in 1998 and 100 percent of the land in 1999 . " If we follow this we 'll be able to sell 10 million tonnes of grain by the year 2000 , " B-PER said . The government has been trying to phase out huge subsidies to the farm sector , and in a move back to B-MISC days has given up to 50 hectares ( 124 acres ) of land to some 36,000 private farmers willing to go it alone . Collective farms will last for the next few years , because most private farms now only produce enough to feed themselves with maybe a little extra to sell , said one private farmer : " In the future , maybe , but it 's better not to hurry . " Collectivisation brought us a lot of pain . And it went too fast . Privatising too quickly can also have a negative outcome . " B-ORG swells profit despite setbacks . B-PER I-PER B-LOC 1996-08-26 B-ORG I-ORG on Monday said it had swelled its year attributable profit and streamlined operations to strengthen it for the current financial year despite a variety of divisional setbacks . Announcing the group 's results for the year ended June 30 , chairman B-PER I-PER said : " Happily the strong improvement in financial performance is not an illusion arising from the recent weakness of the rand relative to the dollar . " B-ORG raised attributable earnings to 1,803 million rand from 1,003 million rand previously - in dollar terms an increase to $ 469 million from $ 279 million - and won despite the group 's B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG posting dismal results . " Not everything has gone well . We 've had substantial production difficulties at a number of our operations . The most obvious one with the greatest effect on the corporation was at B-ORG where we had the furnace failure , " B-PER said . B-ORG posted year attributable profit of 176 million rand from 281 million previously . Not only did the company lock in 3.92 rand per dollar in February / March , but it suffered output losses due to a furnace shutdown last August . The rand was last bid at 4.5350 against the dollar . Nor was B-ORG the only operation to fail output targets . B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG was hit hard by heavy rains . It forfeited nearly one million tonnes of production to flooding at its mines in B-LOC province . But B-PER said the greatest gloom in the year came from the B-ORG I-ORG 's blocking of B-ORG ' proposed merger with B-ORG I-ORG 's platinum interests . " The big disappointment for the year was the failure of the platinum merger . From B-ORG 's perspective we are taking the position that it is not on , " B-PER said . Looking ahead to the current financial year , he said that B-ORG would boost earnings further . " B-ORG is well placed to take up the challenges of the future . The group is soundly structured and prudently financed and is blessed with an excellent portfolio of world-class businesses . I think we can look forward to further growth " . Citing the disposal of B-ORG 's stake in industrial holdings group B-ORG I-ORG for one billion rand among other smaller disposals , B-PER said B-ORG had pruned its portfolio to concentrate on core assets . " We 've tried to clean up our overall portfolio by disposing of non-core assets . The biggest of those was B-ORG . Overall a very substantial pruning ... leaving B-ORG clearly structured along commodity lines , " B-PER said . He added that the group still had about 85 million rand after tax invested in various shares , which were market for disposal when required . Referring to B-ORG 's increased 41.5 percent stake in B-ORG , B-PER said the group would wait for coal shares to be cheaper before considering snapping up more . " I think we would have liked to have more of B-ORG but it 's the question of adding value . When we bought the shares we bought ... at quite a bit lower than the price is now ... maybe if we just wait another few years for the next downturn in coal . " Finally , B-PER said a growing proportion of B-ORG 's income was coming from offshore and unlisted investments . -- B-LOC newsroom +27 11 482-1003 B-ORG I-ORG buying B-ORG I-ORG . B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-26 B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG said Monday it will buy B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , a former B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . unit , for about $ 400 million in cash , creating one of the world 's largest makers of intravenous infusion therapy products . Under the agreement , B-ORG and B-ORG I-ORG 's wholly owned subsidiary , B-ORG I-ORG , will merge to form a new company that will develop and manufacture infusion pumps that regulate the amount of intravenous fluid being administered to a patient , as well as proprietary disposable products . The combined company will have estimated revenues of $ 353 million . B-ORG I-ORG , through B-ORG , is already one of the nation 's largest developers and manufacturers of intravenous infusion pumps and proprietary disposable products . It has sales in 38 foreign countries . B-MISC I-MISC B-ORG is a major provider of infusion systems and related technologies to the health-care industry . It has manufacturing plants in B-LOC I-LOC ; B-LOC , B-LOC ; B-LOC , B-LOC ; and B-LOC , B-LOC , and distributes its prodcuts in more than 120 countries . B-ORG I-ORG sold B-ORG on Dec. 31 , 1994 to B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG and other investors . B-ORG I-ORG said it expects to take an unspecified one-time charge to pay for the merger . It did not say when the charge would be taken . " The addition of B-ORG is expected to contribute to financial results in the full second quarter of 1997 , " the companies said . The merger will add to both companies ' historical leadership in infusion therapy and technology-based drug delivery devices , they said . In 1968 , B-ORG introduced the world 's first infusion therapy monitoring device . A year later B-ORG improved its system with the addition of an IV pump that regulated the flow of liquids through positive pressure . B-ORG introduced the world 's first volumetric infusion pump in 1974 . B-ORG had profits of $ 1.7 million , or 6 cents per fully diluted common share , on $ 53.9 million in revenues in the first half of 1996 . Excluding the effect of a one-time restructuring charge of $ 17.4 million , B-ORG had net income of $ 4.2 million on net sales of $ 112.8 million for the 1996 first half . B-ORG I-ORG reported profits of $ 8.4 million on sales of $ 29.2 million in the quarter ended June 30 . B-PER I-PER I-PER , B-ORG president and chief executive officer , will become the president and CEO of B-ORG I-ORG . He led the transition of B-ORG to a privately held company and was previously senior vice president at B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . B-PER I-PER , B-ORG I-ORG and B-ORG president , will become the new company 's executive vice president and chief financial officer . The deal is expected to close by the first quarter of 1997 , subject to regulatory approval . It has already been approved by both companies ' boards . B-MISC rises on B-ORG I-ORG , other stocks lower . B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-26 The B-MISC I-MISC industrial average opened slightly higher on Monday , boosted by B-ORG I-ORG , which gained four to 92 . B-MISC I-MISC - B-ORG I-ORG CLINCH SUPER LEAGUE TITLE . B-LOC I-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-26 B-ORG I-ORG completed their first league and B-MISC I-MISC double in 30 years on Monday when they thrashed B-ORG 66-14 to clinch the inaugural B-MISC I-MISC title . B-ORG I-ORG secured the two points they needed in the last game of the season at B-LOC I-LOC to win their first championship since 1975 and their first double since 1966 . In rain-soaked conditions , centre B-PER I-PER grabbed a hat-trick of tries , while B-PER I-PER , B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER each scored two . Captain and goalkicker B-PER I-PER scored 18 points . B-ORG I-ORG 's triumph marked the end of B-ORG 's seven-year reign as B-MISC champions . B-ORG I-ORG needed to win on Monday to take the title -- a defeat or draw would have allowed B-ORG their eighth consecutive championship . They were also the toast of B-ORG I-ORG , who managed to scrape into the top four ahead of B-ORG and qualify for the end-of-season play-offs . B-ORG finished third . B-ORG I-ORG have now set their sights on taking the treble by winning the end-of-season premiership which begins with next Sunday 's semifinal against B-ORG . B-PER I-PER B-LOC 1996-08-26 The tiny islands of the B-LOC failed to make soccer history at the weekend when they bowed out of the preliminary rounds of the B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC . Trailing fellow B-LOC I-LOC islanders B-LOC 1-0 from the first leg , they were held to a 1-1 draw at home on Saturday despite playing against 10 men for most of the match . The 2-1 aggregate took B-LOC into the group phase of the qualifiers for the 1998 finals , and kept up the B-LOC ' record of never having won an official match in their 10 years of B-ORG membership . The B-LOC must have thought they were on course for a historic breakthrough when B-MISC midfielder B-PER I-PER was sent off for a crude tackle in the 19th minute . But the visitors responded to the setback immediately -- veteran striker B-PER I-PER scoring a minute later to give them a two-goal aggregate lead . Although B-PER I-PER 's 50th-minute equaliser gave the B-MISC renewed hope they could not find the net again and were eliminated . B-LOC now play in group seven of the qualifiers against B-LOC , B-LOC and favourites B-LOC . B-LOC , who drew 0-0 with B-LOC in their first leg , won the second leg in B-LOC 6-0 to stretch their unbeaten run to eight matches and continue their remarkable progress on the B-MISC soccer stage . They now play in group five with B-LOC , B-LOC and B-LOC . German-based striker B-PER I-PER returned home to B-LOC to score the decisive only goal of their tie against B-LOC . B-PER , who plays for B-ORG I-ORG in the B-MISC , scored in the 53rd minute of Sunday 's match in B-LOC for a 1-0 aggregate win which takes his side into group six , where they will meet B-LOC , B-LOC and B-LOC . B-LOC needed a penalty shoot-out in B-LOC I-LOC to overcome B-LOC after a 2-2 aggregate scoreline . Both legs ended 1-1 before B-LOC won the spot kick decider 4-2 . B-LOC 's elimination follows their humiliating 5-1 aggregate defeat by B-LOC in June 's B-MISC I-MISC qualifying preliminaries . The other preliminary round second leg match , between B-LOC and B-LOC in B-LOC , was postponed until Friday . B-LOC won the first leg 4-1 . SOCCER - B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC COLLATED RESULTS . B-LOC 1996-08-26 B-MISC double B-MISC swimming champion B-PER I-PER was in a serious condition on Monday after being stabbed on a B-LOC street . A doctor said it was too early to say whether B-PER , the only man to retain the B-MISC 50 and 100 metres freestyle titles , would return to top-level sport . " His condition is serious , " said B-PER I-PER , deputy chief doctor of B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC in the B-MISC capital . " But he is conscious and is talking and smiling . " B-PER told B-ORG she was not an expert in sports medicine , but said it was too early to judge B-PER 's chances of returning to competitive swimming . B-PER , who won gold in the 50 and 100 metres freestyle at the recent B-MISC I-MISC , was stabbed in the abdomen late on Saturday after an argument with a group of roadside watermelon sellers in south-west B-LOC . B-PER said the wound had affected a lung and a kidney . Doctors operated on B-PER , 24 , for three hours . B-PER told B-ORG television on Sunday he was in no danger and promised he would be back in the pool shortly . " There 's no need to worry . We 're going to be walking soon -- and swimming , " he insisted cheerfully from his bed in the intensive care unit . B-ORG news agency said police had detained one of the attackers . It said the row started when B-PER and a group of his friends were returning from a party . B-PER I-PER , president of the B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC , said President B-PER I-PER had given the swimmer B-LOC 's top award for his B-MISC performance . " I am not a doctor but I think he is doing all right , " said B-PER . B-PER said the B-MISC I-MISC might ask the government to take measures to protect the country 's best athletes , some of whom have already chosen to live abroad for fear of a surge in crime in B-MISC B-LOC . B-PER I-PER B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-26 Two key players left a B-MISC championship match early on Sunday because they had to catch a plane to B-LOC to play with the national team . B-ORG I-ORG midfielder B-PER and B-ORG defender B-PER were both substituted during their teams ' game , taken to B-LOC I-LOC airport and flown to B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC in a private jet chartered by the B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC ( B-MISC ) . At B-LOC , they joined up with the national team squad for the journey to B-LOC , where B-LOC will face B-LOC in a friendly international on Wednesday . The problem arose because the B-ORG I-ORG clash was selected as the day 's televised live match , forcing it to be put back three hours from the usual kickoff time . B-ORG suffered more from their loss as B-PER 's replacement B-PER gave away a penalty from which B-ORG I-ORG scored the decisive goal in a 2-1 win . B-ORG I-ORG lead the first stage of the championship on goal difference from surprise package B-ORG , who beat B-ORG 2-1 . B-ORG , who played in a tournament in B-LOC last week , also faced a plane marathon as they attempted to keep up with a hectic fixture list . They were due to leave B-LOC Monday night , arrive in B-LOC I-LOC on Tuesday morning , catch another plane to the southern city of B-LOC one hour later and then play away to B-ORG I-ORG in the B-MISC championship the same evening . B-ORG striker B-PER , who was overlooked by B-PER for the tour which also features a game away to the B-LOC on Sunday , scored his third goal in three games as the defending champions beat B-ORG 2-1 away . B-PER , who has been top-scorer in the competition for the last two seasons , has been struggling against injury for most of this year . SOCCER - B-MISC CHAMPIONSHIP RESULTS . B-LOC 1996-08-26 Results of B-MISC first division soccer matches played on Sunday : B-ORG I-ORG 3 B-ORG 1 B-ORG I-ORG 4 B-ORG 0 B-ORG I-ORG 0 B-ORG I-ORG 2 B-ORG I-ORG 0 B-ORG 1 B-ORG 1 B-ORG 0 B-ORG 3 B-ORG 0 B-ORG I-ORG 0 B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG 0 B-ORG I-ORG 1 B-ORG I-ORG 0 TENNIS - QUENCH YOUR THIRST - IF YOU CAN AFFORD IT AT B-MISC I-MISC . B-PER I-PER B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-26 A message on television monitors all around the B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC reads : " Due to hot weather please seek shade and drink plenty of fluids " -- sound advice until you check out the price of fluids . Perhaps the advisory was cut off before concluding : " ...and bring plenty of money . " A small bottle of a garishly-coloured sports drink at the sun-drenched B-MISC I-MISC is going for $ 3.75 , while a litre of basic , life-sustaining water will set you back $ 4.00 -- for water ? " At the B-MISC water was only a dollar , and that was the B-MISC , " said one incredulous fan , noting that the B-MISC I-MISC had been notorious for price gouging . B-MISC I-MISC officials managed to insult most of the male tennis players last week with their controversial handling of the seeding and draw . When the tournament began on Monday it was the fans ' turn to be offended . " That baked lasagna better be good for $ 8.50 , " said B-MISC I-MISC B-PER I-PER , a B-MISC I-MISC regular who was eating a sandwich she had brought from home . A trio of hungry fans at the food court who had already forked over the lasagna money pronounced it good , but B-PER I-PER chimed in , " The water is ridiculous , they want four dollars for the water , you might as well get a glass of wine . " Indeed , a nice glass of chardonnay or white zinfandel was going for $ 4.75 , while an imported beer was just a bit more than the water at $ 4.50 . What 's the message here ? " Maybe they want us to be alcoholics , " B-PER joked before lifting her glass of wine . Fans will be shelling out $ 12.50 for a hamburger and a large french fries . And that little snack is guaranteed to make you thirsty . Make that $ 16.50 . Even a sandwich as pedestrian as a ham and swiss cheese is going for a whopping $ 8.00 . Of course , it is served on a tuscan roll . It must be the cost of flying those rolls over from B-LOC every day that drives up the price of the sandwich . TENNIS - B-PER AND B-PER FALL , UP-AND-COMERS ADVANCE AT B-MISC . B-PER I-PER B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-26 B-PER I-PER led a youthful charge and B-MISC I-MISC finalist B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER were fallen seeds on Monday in a hot , sunny opening to the B-MISC I-MISC tennis championships . The 15-year-old B-PER , seeded 16th , was honoured to play the first match of the season 's last B-MISC I-MISC on B-LOC I-LOC but happy to hurry off with a straight-sets victory over the 112th-ranked B-PER I-PER of B-LOC . " It was very hot and I did n't want to stay long on the court , " said a cheery B-PER , who had no worries in racing to a 6-1 6-0 victory against the overmatched B-MISC . Hoping for a longer engagement on the cement at B-LOC I-LOC were the sixth-seeded B-PER of B-LOC and 12th seed B-PER of B-LOC . B-PER , who lost to B-PER I-PER in the B-MISC I-MISC final , fell victim to an unfortunate draw in bowing to dangerous floater B-PER I-PER of B-LOC I-LOC . B-PER , ranked 17th , avenged her defeat to B-PER in the B-MISC I-MISC semifinals by winning 6-1 2-6 6-2 . " I looked at it as not a first round match , just a great challenge for me , " said B-PER , 24 . " I was really concentrating on keeping my own momentum and my own rhythm . " She is tough to play in that way because she plays very up and down . She played one great game and than a few errors . The challenge was just for me to keep playing my own game . " B-PER , who reached the final a week ago at B-LOC I-LOC , could only mourn her luck of the draw . " I was n't happy when I saw the draw . She was the first non- seeded player , " said the 21-year-old B-MISC . " It 's always tough to play somebody like that in the first round in a B-MISC I-MISC . " I think I did n't play that bad today . It was maybe my best first round match in a B-MISC I-MISC I ever played . " Monday brought the best out in B-MISC I-MISC rookie B-PER I-PER of B-LOC , ranked 110th . The 18-year-old B-PER , last year 's B-MISC junior champion , celebrated her debut in the main draw of the B-MISC by removing B-PER 6-4 6-2 . The curtain-raising victories by B-PER and B-PER provided a ringing endorsement for the newest wave of women 's players coming up from the junior ranks . The B-MISC teenager , a twice B-MISC I-MISC junior champion and a B-MISC juniors winner , had already proven her main stage mettle by reaching the quarters at this year 's B-MISC I-MISC . " I hope I can get into the last 16 , " said B-PER , seeded to face third seed B-PER I-PER I-PER in the fourth round . B-PER has been working hard on conditioning and has lost eight pounds ( 3.5 kilos ) in advance of the championships . " There will be tough matches but I hope I can get there , " she said . " Then we 'll see if B-PER will be there , too . " The fast-moving B-PER , 18 , was cool in her opening match . " I was n't scared when I heard that I was playing B-PER , " said B-PER . " I know that if I want to play professional tennis I have to do my best to try to beat her and I ca n't be scared . " B-PER is undaunted by the level of competition in the pros . " In terms of tennis , I think the junior players are really good now . In a few years , it could change a lot among the top players . " Two big-serving women 's players made quick work of B-MISC opponents . B-PER I-PER of the B-LOC , the 13th seed , was a 6-1 6-4 winner over B-LOC 's B-PER I-PER , while B-MISC veteran B-PER I-PER prevailed over B-PER I-PER 6-2 6-3 . B-MISC B-PER I-PER , seeded 14th , also reached the second round with a 6-2 6-1 victory over B-PER I-PER of B-LOC . TENNIS - B-PER GLAD HE STAYED AFTER B-MISC VICTORY . B-PER I-PER B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-26 B-PER I-PER nearly pulled out of the B-MISC I-MISC in protest over the men 's seeding fiasco but the former B-MISC champion was glad he stayed after sweating out a four-set win on Monday over qualifier B-PER I-PER . " I still feel it 's embarrassing what happened and I was about to pull out yesterday and say , ' That 's it , ' " said B-PER , one of a host of men who cried foul over seeding procedures that forced an unprecedented remaking of the men 's draw last week . " But there are so many reasons to play , especially spectators and the kids who come out here and want to enjoy watching tennis , that I decided to stay . " In a break from tradition , the B-MISC did not seed in strict accordance with B-ORG rankings , instead taking into account other factors that raised objections of favourtism toward B-LOC players . One prominent player that did not stay for the B-MISC was B-MISC I-MISC champion B-PER I-PER , who after being dropped three spots from his B-ORG ranking to a seventh seeding , withdrew and returned home to B-LOC . B-PER had pulled out of last week 's tournament with a rib injury . At a news conference attended by approximately 50 players on Sunday , B-LOC B-MISC I-MISC player B-PER I-PER expressed the players ' outrage at the seedings . " The way the B-MISC I-MISC has seeded here , tampering with the ranking system , has tarnished the image and reputation of this B-MISC I-MISC in the players ' mind , and we think that is damaging to our sport , " B-PER said . B-PER said he felt the players ought to have organised an active protest . " I feel that we made it a little easy for the B-ORG . They did n't really get hurt as much as I think they should have , " said B-PER . " I feel that we should have maybe just cancelled out the Monday , not show up today and start the tournament tomorrow . " But once the 27-year-old B-PER got on the court , he focused his energies on trying to win the year 's last B-MISC I-MISC . He took a positive first step with his 6-3 1-6 6-1 7-5 win over compatriot B-PER on a sun-baked B-MISC court . Others advancing early on Monday included 11th-seeded B-MISC B-PER I-PER , the B-MISC runner-up , B-LOC 's B-PER I-PER , and two-time former B-MISC I-MISC champion B-PER I-PER of B-LOC , who will be B-PER 's next opponent . The suspicion , however , lingers in B-PER 's mind that B-MISC I-MISC officials did tamper with the seeding process in order to benefit homegrown players . " I get the feeling that everything is done here for the B-MISC players and they forget about all the other players , " said B-PER , who lost the 1994 B-MISC final to B-PER I-PER . It was B-PER who was at the centre of the controversy that engulfed the tournament since the original draw was completed on Wednesday . The flamboyant B-MISC star was bumped up two spots from his B-ORG ranking of eight to a seeding of six . " He ( B-PER ) should be seeded the way he is playing tennis right now , " said B-PER about the unfairness of moving up B-PER , who made early exits from the B-MISC I-MISC and B-MISC . B-PER , not seeded here for the first time since 1990 , might have benefitted from some fiddling with the seedings himself after B-PER withdrew . Ranked 18th in the world , B-PER might have been slipped into that spot ahead of B-LOC 's B-PER I-PER , who is 16th but had never been played in the B-MISC and had been left out of the seedings originally . But B-PER did n't want to play that game . " I think he deserves to be seeded as everybody else who is in the top 16 deserves to be seeded , " B-PER said .
