PRESS DIGEST - B-LOC - AUGUST 26 . B-LOC 1996-08-26 This is the leading story in the B-MISC press on Monday . B-ORG has not verified this story and does not vouch for its accuracy . B-ORG - At least 20 people were killed when the two trucks in which they were travelling collided at B-LOC about 160 km north of B-LOC on Saturday , the B-LOC daily B-ORG said . B-ORG I-ORG files reorganization plan . [ CORRECTED 18:00 B-MISC ] B-LOC , B-LOC . 1996-08-26 B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , an operator of 42 family apparel stores in six northwestern states , said it has filed a reorganization plan in bankruptcy court in B-LOC . ( Corrects to make clear a reorganization plan has been filed ) . The reorganization plan calls for all secured claims to be paid in full . Unsecured claims , including those of company bondholders , will be satisfied by issuing new common stock and warrants . Unsecured claims are estimated at about $ 90 million . B-ORG said it plans to issue 9 million shares of new common stock . Of that amount , 4.05 million and 5.67 million shares will be allocated to the company 's trade creditors . Between 4.75 and 3.13 million shares will be allocated to bondholders and other unsecured non-trade creditors and 200,000 will be allocated to existing shareholders in exchange for all existing stock of the company . Bondholders and other unsecured non-trade creditors will receive warrants four about 2.2 million shares when the company 's market capitalization reaches $ 20 million . Bondholders , other unsecured non-trade creditors , and existing shareholders also will receive warrants entitling them to roughly 800,000 shares when the company 's market capitalization reaches $ 25 million . Management will receive options to purchase 10 percent of the company 's outstanding common stock with protection against dilution at an option exercise price of $ 1 million . Passengers rescued from blazing ferry off B-LOC . B-LOC 1996-08-26 More than 100 people were safely evacuated on Monday from a ferry that caught fire soon after leaving B-LOC in B-LOC 's B-LOC I-LOC , police said . Police said the 111 passengers and six crew on board the ferry B-MISC I-MISC , owned by B-LOC 's B-ORG line , were rescued by a variety of private and commercial boats after fire broke out in the engine room soon after it left port . An 88-year-old woman was taken to hospital with leg injuries , according to a spokesman for B-LOC police . The ferry , which was towed into port , had been bound for B-LOC , another in a cluster of small B-MISC islands off north-west B-LOC . B-ORG delays decision on refugee voting . B-PER I-PER B-LOC 1996-08-26 B-LOC 's election organisers will decide on Tuesday whether or not to postpone municipal elections scheduled as part of nationwide balloting , an B-ORG spokeswoman said on Monday . Officials from the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) are considering the postponement following allegations of serious irregularities in the registration of B-MISC refugees . International observers say the alleged irregularities could affect the outcome of voting for municipal assemblies . " Tomorrow ... the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG will consider the possible postponement of municipal elections only ... the other elections will be held on September 14 , " B-ORG spokeswoman B-PER I-PER told reporters in B-LOC . " I think that it would be very difficult to select which municipal elections would have to be cancelled . I think probably if the decision ( to cancell ) were to be taken it would probably be all municipal elections .. . " B-PER added that options other than postponement were also on the table , but she refused to specify what they were . The B-LOC peace agreement gave the B-ORG a mandate to organise B-MISC elections . The B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG is B-ORG 's top rule-making body for the poll . More than 600,000 refugees have registered to vote in 55 countries around the world , representing about 20 per cent of B-LOC 's total electorate . They are due to begin voting on Wednesday , August 28 , just one day after the B-ORG is supposed to make its decision . Balloting inside B-LOC is scheduled for September 14 , when citizens are slated to elect municipal and cantonal assemblies , separate B-MISC and B-MISC parliaments , a national B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG and a three-man Presidency . A B-LOC daily newspaper , B-ORG I-ORG , which is close to B-LOC 's B-MISC nationalist B-ORG party , on Monday said the B-ORG would postpone the municipal-level elections until the Spring of 1997 because of the refugee registration problems . B-ORG has a representative on the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . " I do n't know what the source of the B-ORG I-ORG report is , but it is consistent with what I have heard from western diplomats and from inside the B-ORG , " said an B-ORG staff member in B-LOC who asked not to be named . " The word is that B-PER has decided to postpone municipal elections but that he will wait for one more session of the B-ORG on Tuesday to take everyone 's temperature on the issue . " Ambassador B-PER I-PER , an B-MISC , heads the B-ORG mission in B-LOC . B-ORG and independent monitors allege that B-MISC authorities have systematically discouraged refugees from registering to cast a ballot in the places they lived before the war . Instead , the refugees were said to have been directed by their authorities to vote from strategic towns which had B-MISC majorities before the 43-month B-MISC war , but which are now underpopulated as a result of " ethnic cleansing " . Diplomats explain the purpose of this electoral engineering is to secure B-MISC control over pivotal towns inside the 49 per cent of B-LOC known as the B-MISC republic , consolidating through the ballot box what was initially taken in war . The top B-ORG refugee official in the B-LOC highlighted the voter registration problem on Monday . " Results of the registration for September elections herald a dismal future for multi-ethnicity in B-LOC , " warned B-PER I-PER , Special Envoy for the B-ORG High Commissioner for Refugees in B-LOC I-LOC . " In the run-up to elections , nationalistic political leaders are playing the ethnic / sectarian card , drumming up support within their constituencies by playing on bitter memories or fear . " After truce , B-PER faces tougher B-MISC problem . B-PER I-PER B-LOC 1996-08-26 B-PER I-PER may finally get to discuss his B-MISC peace proposals with B-PER I-PER on Tuesday after a lost weekend in the region when he was forced to abandon plans to sign a new political treaty with the separatist rebels . It could be a sobering experience for the B-LOC security chief who , just two months after being appointed by the president and two heady weeks after taking charge of the B-MISC crisis , had promised to wrap up the 20-month war by the weekend . Despite a mood of compromise in the region after some of the worst fighting of the war , B-PER may be just finding out that concluding a long-term settlement , somewhere between rebel demands for independence and B-LOC 's insistence that B-LOC remain part of B-LOC , will be no easy matter . A chain-smoking former paratroop general with a sharp line in deadpan putdowns and a soldier 's knack for making life sound simple , B-PER managed to arrange an ambitious ceasefire in the region last week , days after the B-MISC army threatened to bomb its way back into the rebel-held B-MISC capital B-LOC . He returned at the weekend , pledging to conclude a political settlement that would make this truce work where all others have failed . But then he apparently thought better of it . Saying he needed to tidy up legal loose ends on the deal -- and also cover his back against unnamed pro-war schemers in B-LOC -- he flew back to the capital empty-handed on Sunday . He met B-MISC Prime Minister B-PER I-PER on Monday and , according to the press service of B-PER 's B-ORG I-ORG , could meet B-PER on Tuesday . It was not clear if the start of B-PER 's holiday , announced later , would affect plans to talk . B-LOC 's as yet undisclosed proposals on B-LOC 's political future have , meanwhile , been sent back to do the rounds of various government departments . It is not known what caused the delay in the peace plan . Speculation mounted last week that B-PER was operating out on a limb in B-LOC as B-PER , hardly seen since his reelection last month , kept out of sight and then gave an interview criticising his envoy just as he clinched a truce . But B-PER took pains at the weekend to insist B-PER was playing for a united team and that the proposals he took to rebel chief-of-staff B-PER I-PER had been agreed by B-PER . If that were the case , it was unclear why B-PER suddenly found it necessary to have the deal verified in B-LOC . B-PER himself said he was concerned that powerful interests in B-LOC , who have profited from the war and want it to go on , would seize on any inadequacy in the deal to remove him . B-PER warned that B-PER risked the same fate as a former B-MISC army commander in the region who sought a compromise and was blown up last year by -- so the B-MISC say -- B-MISC forces . B-PER may also have made new demands on B-PER , forcing him to check back with the B-LOC on what he could offer . A rebel spokesman said the two military men had come close to agreement on a face-saving formula acceptable to both sides and involving a referendum on independence at some future date . B-PER said voters should decide B-LOC 's future but stressed there was no question of the government letting the region quit the B-LOC I-LOC -- something B-LOC fears could encourage separatist tendencies in other ethnic regions , particularly in the strategic B-LOC I-LOC . B-PER may be be finding that closing that political gap between the two sides is more difficult than just ending a war . B-PER on holiday from Monday - B-ORG . B-LOC 1996-08-26 B-MISC air traffic controllers will go on strike on September 3 demanding higher pay , the chief of the B-MISC association of air traffic controllers ( B-ORG ) said on Monday . B-PER I-PER told a news conference the strike by more than half of the 1,380 traffic controllers and technicians would paralyse traffic which has increased by 10 percent since last year . More than 1,500 planes per day fly over B-LOC , in a strategic location between B-LOC and the B-LOC and the B-LOC I-LOC , B-PER said . The director general of the air traffic service B-PER I-PER said last Friday that a controllers ' strike would be illegal . B-PER said he could not curb the summer charter flights of national carrier B-ORG I-ORG , which carries thousands of foreign tourists to the B-MISC B-LOC I-LOC resorts . But B-PER said it would be " discrimination " against the other airlines if only B-LOC planes were guided in . " Under the law before launching the strike we have to sign an agreement with our employer for a minimal transport servicing of emergency flights , " B-PER said . B-PER said a lock-out with military air controllers was impossible as they did not speak B-MISC . The controllers are demanding the monthly wage be increased to $ 1,000 per month from the current $ 230 , as well as the resignation of the air traffic service 's management . B-PER I-PER told B-ORG that a B-ORG extraordinary shareholders meeting on Saturday had decided that the price of the 250,000 bonds would be set as a 10-session average price of B-ORG shares plus a premium . " The premium will be no lower than 15 percent and will be set by management before the issue ... which we expect at the beginning of next year , " B-PER said . B-ORG , based in southern B-LOC , wants to offer the bonds to large investors in a public offering , paying an annual coupon of no more than 80 percent of the yield of the benchmark 52-week T-bill . B-ORG ups B-LOC GDP forecast , lowers peso . B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-26 B-ORG brokerage on Monday raised its forecasts for 1996 gross domestic product growth to 4.3 percent from 3.8 percent , but it kept its 1997 projection unchanged at 4.5 percent , a statement said . Economist B-PER I-PER said the revisions were chiefly fueled by stronger than expected growth of 7.2 percent in the second quarter and he forecast an annual GDP rise of 6.1 percent in the third quarter and 4.9 percent in Q4 . The firm also revised down its year-end peso forecast to 7.85-8.15 per dollar from 8.20-8.50 . It forecast an end 1997 peso in the range of 9.20-9.40 . B-ORG kept its 1996 and 1997 inflation forecast unchanged at 26 percent and 20 percent , expecting the government 's 1997 inflation target to be around 15 percent . It bumped up its average interest rate projection in 1997 to 25.8 percent from 23 percent . Fiscal policy was expected to be loosened a bit in the second half of this year , boosting growth without running into a deficit . B-MISC peso closes lower , importers buy dlrs . B-LOC 1996-08-26 B-LOC 's peso closed lower at 1,044 after coming under pressure from dollar-buying by importers seeking to meet their commitments abroad , interbank dealers said . It was the second consecutive session that saw the peso , which ended at 1,041 Friday , close lower . " The ( dollar 's ) rise was due to demand from importers who have a lot of wire transfers accumulated , " one dealer said . Contributing to the peso 's weakness , another dealer said banks who might have sold greenbacks in Monday 's trading appeared to shy away from the market . This , according to the trader , was typical of month-end position-squaring -- and the fact that a stronger B-LOC currency helps limit some foreign exchange losses . Dealers reported 355 trades for a total of $ 142 million and said the peso hit an intra-day high of 1,037 before heading lower into the close . -- B-PER I-PER I-PER , B-LOC newsroom , 571 610 7944 B-LOC 's B-PER leaves B-LOC for B-LOC . B-LOC 1996-08-26 Heavy fighting broke out between two rival B-MISC factions in northern B-LOC at midnight Sunday and at least 29 people were killed , one of the groups said on Monday . The B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) said the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) had broken the B-MISC ceasefire agreed between the two parties last week . The factions reached a ceasefire on Friday after a week of fierce fighting which had put an end to a truce agreed a year earlier . " The B-ORG leadership who pledged to end fighting and cooperate with the latest B-LOC initiative started a major military offensive against B-ORG positions , " the B-ORG said in a statement . It said heavy fighting started at midnight in the region dividing the two warring factions , with the B-ORG aiming to break through to B-ORG 's headquarters in B-LOC . The B-ORG said 29 B-ORG fighters were killed in the attack . It did not provide details of B-ORG casualties and a B-ORG spokesman was not immediately available for comment . The statement said the B-ORG resumed its attack on Monday morning on B-ORG positions near B-LOC and indiscriminately shelled the town of B-LOC , killing a priest and injuring some civilians . The fighting has threatened a B-MISC peace plan to unite the mountainous B-MISC region in northern B-LOC against President B-PER I-PER . " B-LOC will contact the B-MISC government to find out the truth of the matter and to discuss the possible consequences of such an unfortunate step , " he added . It is not clear when the conference will be held . B-PER I-PER B-LOC 1996-08-26 No more mild-mannered and meek B-PER I-PER , the vice president and likely heir apparent to President B-PER I-PER , emerged on Monday as the new B-MISC attack dog leading a front-line assault on B-PER I-PER and B-ORG Speaker B-PER I-PER . While B-PER takes a train trip to the B-MISC I-MISC that will renominate him on Wednesday for a second term , B-PER is the bright star in the convention city now . Crowds anxiously wait for his appearances , thrusting out hands for him to grip as they scream " 12 more years " -- a wishful hope to eight years of B-PER after a B-PER re-election . Over a 15-hour span from Sunday evening to Monday morning , so many people jammed B-PER events that the fire marshal stopped members of B-ORG , reporters and others from entering a B-MISC rally and a meeting of the B-LOC I-LOC delegation . In his appearances , the often stiff and wooden B-PER seemed transformed into a new energetic , gesturing " pol " as he ripped into B-MISC presidential nominee B-PER and B-PER , who has emerged as the favorite right-wing foil of B-MISC . B-PER told a roaring labor rally of about 1,000 union workers that B-PER and B-PER were the virtual personifaction of evil , without even mentioning that former Housing Secretary B-PER I-PER is B-PER 's running mate . " With equal measures of ignorance and audacity this two-headed monster of B-PER and B-PER has been launching an all out assault on decades of progress of behalf of working men and women , " B-PER said to whoops of " 12 more years . " " They want to drive you out of politics and they ca n't , " he added . " They want to silence your voices in elections . " At a downtown hotel Monday , the 48-year-old B-PER gave B-LOC delegates a taste again of the new B-PER . " I want you to ask this question . What would B-LOC face if the same extremist coalition , the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , also controlled the executive branch ? " B-PER said . Noting the next presidential term will probably see two or three B-ORG I-ORG justice nominations , he warned , " Their extremist agenda would come out of the B-ORG I-ORG , into and through the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , down through the B-ORG I-ORG . " He painted a scene of horrors he saw if B-MISC controlled the B-LOC I-LOC and the B-ORG they hold now . " Our personal and religious liberties would be at risk . B-MISC would be at risk of withering on the vine . B-MISC would be at risk of being taken away from poor children . Education would be at risk . The environment would be at risk from the polluters that control that coalition , " he said . His new style mixed an assault on B-MISC with what he sees as " productive opportunity , a vision for the future that lifts up working families , that builds B-LOC stronger , that builds B-LOC stronger . With your help we can re-elect B-PER I-PER . " B-PER 's tax cut plans were called " deja-voodoo economics .... It 's a warmed-over plan that failed and drove our economy into a ditch . We got burned once and we wo n't let that happen to our nation again . " B-PER ridiculed B-PER 's defense of the tobacco industry , praised B-PER for " courage " in advancing regulations of it . To the delegates of B-LOC , a leading dairy state , B-PER had the right audience in poking fun at B-PER 's comparison to addiction to tobacco to those who ca n't tolerate milk . " Some people say milk is bad for you , " B-PER said as B-LOC delegates held aloft a plastic inflated cow . He praised B-PER for vetoing the B-MISC B-ORG ' attempt to repeal parts of the B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC , and criticized B-MISC for " slashing money to combat drugs in schools . " " The choice has never been starker , the stakes today have never been higher , " B-PER said . " We 're not going to let them get away with that . " Actor B-PER highlights B-MISC ' first night . B-LOC 1996-08-26 The highlights of the first day of the B-MISC convention on Monday were expected to feature a mix of party leaders and people who have overcome adversity . Among the latter were gun control advocate B-PER I-PER and actor B-PER I-PER and the politicians included B-MISC I-MISC B-PER I-PER and Sen . B-PER I-PER . Here are thumbnail profiles of the convention 's key Monday speakers . B-PER I-PER -- The nation 's toughest gun control law is named after B-PER I-PER 's press secretary B-PER I-PER but it was his wife who was the major force behind its passage . As head of B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , B-PER I-PER , 54 , campaigned nonstop for tough gun control in the years following the shooting of her husband and then President B-PER in 1981 . Her reward was the passage in 1993 of the " B-MISC I-MISC " which requires a mandatory five-day waiting period for purchase of handguns and also mandates background checks for would-be gun purchasers . B-PER recovered fully from his wounds but B-PER , who was close to death after being shot by B-PER I-PER I-PER . , suffered serious brain damage . B-PER was B-PER 's second wife and they have a son , B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER . Before the assassination attempt , she had worked for B-MISC congressmen and for the B-ORG I-ORG . B-PER I-PER -- B-PER was best known for playing the comic book hero B-PER in four movies but his greatest heroics came in real life . B-PER , an accomplished rider who owned several horses , suffered multiple injuries including two shattered neck vertebrae when he was thrown from his horse at an equestrian event in B-LOC , B-LOC , on May 27 , 1995 . Almost entirely paralyzed , B-PER underwent extensive surgery to fuse the vertebrae to the base of the skull and prevent any further damage to his spine . That allowed him to be moved to a semi-upright position . Over time he regained the power of speech , so much so that he was asked to address the opening night of the B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC . B-PER , 43 , was classically trained as an actor but became the prototypical handsome leading man . He performed in summer stock and soap operas before being plucked as an almost unknown to play the lead in " B-PER " and three sequels . B-PER I-PER -- B-PER , B-ORG B-MISC leader , is a politician with a " B-PER I-PER " reputation who sought the presidency eight years ago and is widely believed to still have ambitions for the job . B-PER , 55 , the son of a milkman from a working class district of B-LOC I-LOC , is a consummate congressional insider , sufficiently skilled in compromise and the ways of the legislature to manage the often-unruly B-ORG B-MISC . A former lawyer , he was in the front line of President B-PER I-PER 's battle with the B-MISC B-ORG over the budget but has opposed the president 's decision to sign the B-MISC welfare reform bill . He advocated tough action against foreign countries to cut B-LOC trade deficits but sometimes been out of step with the party 's liberal wing . He was an opponent of abortion until 1986 and voted for President B-PER I-PER 's big tax cut bill . B-PER , a red-haired square-jawed man , is a less than fiery orator . His 1988 bid for the B-MISC nomination only took off after he recreated himself as a firebreathing reformer of the establishment , standing up for blue collar workers and farmers . B-PER I-PER -- B-PER , 48 , was largely unknown outside B-LOC and his state of B-LOC I-LOC when he surprisingly beat more prominent rivals to become B-ORG B-MISC leader after the party lost its majority to the B-MISC in 1994 . A mild-mannered and youthful man who rose rapidly after entering the B-ORG in 1987 , he presented himself as a B-LOC moderate , as a B-MISC winner in a B-MISC state able to unite B-ORG factions . Concern that he might be steamrollered by the vastly more experienced B-MISC leader B-PER I-PER was dispelled when he showed a tough edge , outmaneuvering B-PER in a wrangle over scrapping a gas tax and raising the federal minimum wage . In his early B-ORG years he was seen as a " prairie populist " , working on legislation protecting farmers ' prices and also on compensating veterans sickened by B-MISC I-MISC defoliant spraying in the B-MISC I-MISC . B-PER was a key player in President B-PER I-PER 's failed attempt at sweeping healthcare changes but when he became minority leader he declared he would be no water-carrier for the B-LOC I-LOC . He has made clear he opposed B-PER 's signing of the B-MISC welfare reform bill . He has spent his adult life in politics , coming to B-ORG as an aide in 1972 after three years in the B-ORG I-ORG and then being elected to the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG himself in 1978 . B-LOC 1996-08-26 B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG said Monday that 10 of 24 lawsuits involving chronic beryllium disease have been dismissed since July 1 . The leading B-LOC beryllium producer said in a conference call it has traditionally been pro-active regarding the workplace disease , a lung ailment which can affects a small percent of people whose immune systems are susceptible . Of the 14 remaining suits , 10 were filed by employees of industrial B-ORG I-ORG customers and B-ORG I-ORG liability in such suits is typically covered by insurance , B-PER I-PER , vice president of corporate communications , said on the call . The company was responding to an article in Sunday 's B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . He said the article largely reiterated information about the suits and the disease which had previously been made public via B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG filings and annual reports . " B-ORG I-ORG has been a leader in dealing with health and safety issues ( related to chronic Beryllium disease ) for nearly 50 years , " he said . " We have a record of going beyond regulatory requirements ... and we consistently share the most current information available ... with customers and employees . " The customer employee suits were filed in 1990-95 , he said . A class action filed by a former B-ORG I-ORG employee in April 1996 was dismissed in July , he said . The company is " vigorously defending " the remaining four suits filed by former and current B-ORG I-ORG employees , he said . B-LOC 1996-08-26 B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG carried only local business stories on August 26 , 1996 . B-PER makes political debut on B-PER train trip . B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-25 - B-PER I-PER , until now carefully shielded from the exposure of public life , made her political debut on Sunday on her father 's whistlestop train trip . B-PER , 16 , was at President B-PER I-PER 's side as he rode the rails through parts of B-LOC I-LOC , B-LOC and B-LOC , and was introduced at every stop . She even worked ropelines , shaking hands with excited fans . B-PER I-PER I-PER saw her husband and daughter off on the trip in B-LOC , B-LOC I-LOC and then went on to B-LOC to begin a rigorous B-MISC I-MISC schedule . Asked if B-PER would have a prominent role in the campaign , B-LOC I-LOC spokesman B-PER I-PER said : " She 'll do what she did today when she can . She has to go back to school . " The president 's daughter is going into her senior year of high school at B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , a private school in B-LOC . B-PER said B-PER has asked to go on the train trip and attend the convention where her father will be renominated , but said her exposure did not signal the start of a new political career . B-PER " is a very poised young lady , but she 's not that much interested in politics , " the spokesman said . B-MISC closing share market report . B-LOC 1996-08-26 B-MISC shares drifted to a lower close on Monday , dragged down by weakness in the domestic bond market and turnover depressed by the B-LOC bank holiday and lack of any significant B-LOC economic data . The B-MISC index of leading shares closed 4.54 points easier at 556.19 , the day 's low . The B-MISC market had been on the defensive all day but a softer start to B-LOC I-LOC did little to boost sentiment in late trade , dealers said . " It was always going to be a tough day with participation so low . But the only thing really worrying the market was the bonds , and that dragged us lower , " one dealer said . Stocks were down across the board , with B-ORG I-ORG topping the volume list and closing down 1.90 guilders at 58.70 . The post and telecoms firm posted an 8.5 percent rise in first half earnings on Friday , just below analysts ' expectations . B-ORG I-ORG reported first half results well under forecasts on Monday and the shares suffered as a result . They were trading unchanged just before the release of figures but closed 2.40 guilders down at 80.70 after it reported net profits of 34.9 million guilders against 36.6 million last year and estimates ranging from 37.5 to 47.2 million . B-ORG also forecast post tax earnings rising 21 percent for the full year . Banking group B-ORG traded ex-dividend today and finished 0.60 guilders weaker at 52.90 as a result . But B-ORG shrugged off its ex-div tag to soar a further 4.10 guilders to 214.40 continuing its explosive rally sparked by the 51 percent jump in first half net profits last week , which set the market alight on Friday , sending the shares up 18.40 at 210.00 by the close . Engineering concern B-ORG started the day well as the shares attracted some follow-through interest to the announcement late on Friday that its B-ORG I-ORG unit had won a major order . But the rally was short-lived and B-ORG ended just 0.20 up at 51.00 guilders . -- B-ORG I-ORG +31 20 504 5000 B-PER to quit B-MISC assembly seat as film opens . B-LOC 1996-08-26 Former businessman and soccer boss B-PER I-PER said that he would give up his seat in the B-ORG I-ORG by Wednesday , the day a film by B-PER I-PER in which he stars opens in B-LOC . " I will no longer be deputy by the time the film opens , " he said in a broadcast interview . " Just about , " he told B-ORG I-ORG radio when asked whether he had sent his letter of resignation to B-ORG speaker B-PER I-PER . A B-PER spokeswoman confirmed that no letter or call had yet been received . B-PER , 53 , was resigning just ahead of expected government action to eject him from the B-ORG following a finding by the B-ORG I-ORG that he was bankrupt and thus ineligible for public office for a five-year period . B-PER , the target of a blizzard of legal actions over his now-destroyed business empire and the B-ORG soccer team he once ran , has a starring role in B-PER 's " Homme , femmes : mode d'emploi " ( Men , women : instructions for use ) . He plays a power-hungry lawyer in the movie described as " a tender and cruel comedy " by B-PER , who is making his 35th film . " I have paid too dearly for mixing two careers , " B-PER said . " In B-LOC , you cannot be a film artist and a national politician at the same time . That is why I will no longer be deputy by the time the film opens . " Justice Minister B-PER I-PER began last month the formal process of ejecting B-PER from the B-MISC parliament as well as stripping him of his seat in the B-MISC parliament . The B-MISC procedure was expected to be completed before October 2 , when the B-ORG I-ORG is to reconvene after a summer break , but the B-MISC procedure was expected to take longer . B-PER 's lawyer has said he intends to appeal to the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG in an effort to prevent or delay the loss of his B-MISC seat . But such an appeal , even if the court were to accept the case , which it is not obliged to do , would not suspend enforcement of the B-MISC judgement against him . B-PER faces a probable spell in prison after he loses his parliamentary immunity , since two appeal courts have confirmed jail sentences of eight and six months against him for tax fraud and rigging a soccer match . He is appealing in both cases to the B-ORG I-ORG . B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG drains 3.9 bln B-MISC at tender . B-LOC 1996-08-26 The B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG drained 3.9 billion francs at a securities repurchase tender held on Monday to allocate funds for injection into the money market on Tuesday . It accepted bids for 44.3 billion francs in new liquidity , 3.9 billion less than the 48.2 billion leaving the market on Tuesday when a previous pact expires . The new pact expires on September 3 . The B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG said it allocated 13.4 billion francs to bidders offering B-ORG bills as collateral , satisfying 3.4 percent of such demand . It allotted a further 30.9 billion to bidders putting up private paper , satisfying 12.5 percent of this demand . -- B-ORG I-ORG +33 1 4221 5452 B-ORG [ RABN.CN ] SEES H2 NET GROWTH UNDER 10 PCT . B-LOC 1996-08-26 B-MISC co-operative bank B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG 's net profit growth might slow to less than than 10 year percent in the second half of 1996 , executive board chairman B-PER I-PER said on Monday . The unlisted bank earlier announced a 1996 interim net profit of 853 million guilders , up 21.5 percent on the 702 million guilders reported in the first half of 1995 . He said second-half profit growth would depend on customer demand for loans , which was already easing , and the performance of financial markets , which were strong in the first half and boosted securities , trading and underwriting income . " We expect reasonable growth in the second half . Maybe it will be in single-digits , " B-PER told B-ORG . He said growth in customer demand in the first half was 50 percent above normal but it was hard to maintain this pace . B-ORG 's net profit was 1.43 billion guilders in 1995 . The bank earlier warned that profit growth would slow in the second half , citing the increasing momentum in profit growth in the comparative period of 1995 and increased investment . But B-PER was unable to quantify second half investment to improve and extend domestic and offshore services . -- B-PER I-PER , B-LOC newsroom +31 20 504 5000 PRESS DIGEST - B-LOC - B-ORG I-ORG AUG 26 . B-MISC PM proposes Sept 18 for no-confidence debate . B-LOC 1996-08-26 B-MISC Prime Minister B-PER I-PER on Monday proposed September 18 as the date for parliamentary debate on an opposition no-confidence motion accusing him of incompetence . The president of parliament had earlier said September 11 could be set for the debate . The opposition motion against B-PER accuses him of being incompetent , lacking ethical leadership and alleges his administration is corrupt . His critics allege he may be attempting to delay the debate . B-PER has denied the accusations and said he is ready to clear himself in parliament . " In my opinion September 18 would be a convenient date for the government to answer questions . This has nothing to do with the accusation that I am trying to escape the debate , " B-PER told reporters after meeting coalition partners . B-PER 's 13-month-old , six-party coalition government controls 209 seats in the 391-seat lower house of parliament . Political infighting within B-PER 's B-ORG I-ORG party has raised doubts whether he can hold his supporters together and defeat the opposition motion , political analysts said . " We are still waiting to fix a date . September 18 is regarded as tentative because we still have not received the order to fix it on the agenda , " said an official at parliament 's agenda section . The last no-confidence debate against B-PER 's coalition in May was won by the government . B-ORG - 6mth parent forecast . FOCUS - B-ORG end mixed but B-LOC recovers . B-PER I-PER B-LOC 1996-08-27 B-MISC bourses closed mixed on Tuesday with B-LOC clawing back most of the day 's losses despite an unsteady start on B-ORG I-ORG , hit by inflation worries . The dollar weakened during the day with many dealers sidelined because of uncertainty over B-LOC 's monetary direction ahead of the important B-MISC B-ORG economic survey out on Wednesday . But it recovered at the close of trade . Stocks in B-LOC started the week badly after a three-day weekend , slipping 0.3 percent , but bargain-hunters later moved in and the B-MISC index recovered most of the lost ground to end only just in negative ground . Tuesday 's patchy showing in B-LOC followed a string of records last week , culminating in Friday 's trading high of 3,911 , fuelled by a wave of B-MISC interest rate cuts . The B-LOC bourse drew little help from the unsettled morning on B-LOC I-LOC , which slipped in and out of positive ground after a stronger-than-expected August consumer confidence report refuelled inflation fears , pulling B-ORG I-ORG back from their early peaks . Shortly after the report appeared showing the confidence index rising to 109.4 in August from a revised 107.0 in July , B-LOC I-LOC relinquished virtually all its morning gains . " B-ORG remain very sensitive to any indication of a strong economy and we 're still in that summer doldrum period of light trading , " said B-PER I-PER , market strategist at B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . " Consequently , stocks and bonds are both subject to rapid swings . " B-LOC was the one bright spot in B-LOC . Floor trading ended up 0.25 percent and the computerised B-MISC index climbed nearly 0.4 percent , given a push by the performance of chemical shares . " The market is trading 100 percent on fundamentals at the moment as interest rate fantasy disappears -- it 's all company news , " said one trader . B-MISC shares ended slightly down amid growing unease about a difficult autumn for the government which also weighed on the franc , dealers said . Bond prices were weaker and the franc was quoted at 3.4210 per mark for the first time since August 13 as worries about the government 's autumn budget and a weak B-LOC currency lifted the mark and squeezed B-MISC investments . The dollar , which dropped sharply on Monday because of jitters over the B-MISC B-ORG survey , weakened further in quiet trading but regained losses to end the day close to Monday 's levels . " Besides the B-ORG , there 's nothing really until the B-LOC jobs numbers next week , " said a B-LOC bank corporate dealer . " There is still the summer malaise hanging over the market . " Foreign exchange markets regard the B-ORG report as an important indication of the country 's future monetary policy direction . If it points to weakness in the economy , the report will help the dollar regain some lost ground as speculation of a near-term rise in B-MISC interest rates will evaporate . The B-MISC discount rate is currently at a record low of 0.5 percent . The dollar was also pressured by the mark 's strength against B-MISC currencies amid renewed concerns over B-LOC 's economic and monetary union ( B-MISC ) timetable . CURRENCIES The dollar was at 1.4788 marks and 107.74 yen at the close of B-MISC trading compared with 1.4789 marks and 107.55 yen on Monday . B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-27 Armed hijackers believed to be B-MISC released between 60 and 70 people on Tuesday from a B-ORG I-ORG plane carrying 199 passengers and crew that landed in B-LOC after being diverted on a flight from B-LOC to B-LOC , authorities said . A spokesman for B-LOC airport said that the unidentified hijackers were demanding to see a B-MISC member of the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , called Mr B-PER , and that police were trying to trace him . Police spokeswoman B-PER I-PER said police had already contacted B-PER and were trying to arrange to bring him to B-LOC , 30 miles ( 48 km ) north-east of B-LOC , to talk to the hijackers . The airport spokesman said the six hijackers , who police said were armed with grenades and possibly other explosives , were believed to be B-MISC nationals . The hijackers started to release people for the B-MISC plane in batches of 10 , starting with women and children , in what police described as a " controlled release " . Police said most of the passengers were B-MISC but that there were also an unknown number of B-MISC , B-MISC , B-MISC , B-MISC and B-MISC . Later they said the number of passengers released from the plane had reached 80 . FEATURE - " Eco terrorists " target B-LOC builders . B-PER I-PER B-LOC 1996-08-27 Ecological warfare has broken out across the B-MISC construction industry , striking some of the biggest corporates as activists give up peaceful protests and seek to hit builders where it hurts -- their profit margins . Described by one B-MISC company as " eco-terrorism " , it is seen as the new business risk of the 1990s . Famous names like B-ORG I-ORG , B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG and B-ORG , a unit of conglomerate B-ORG I-ORG , have all been targeted . Activist groups are no longer seen by B-MISC firms as a harmless , badly organised ragbag of students and hippies . " You only have to see them in action at protests , " said B-PER I-PER , spokesman at B-ORG , B-ORG 's aggregates company . " They walk around with mobile phones and camera equipment , they communicate and gather support for demos via the B-MISC -- we 're talking about a highly sophisticated organisation . " One road protestor under the codename B-PER I-PER told construction journal " B-ORG " earlier this year , " If it comes down to full-scale economic warfare , we will aim to drive them out of business . " As well as financial threats , companies also emphasise the " terror " tactics used . B-ORG 's contract to build the controversial B-LOC bypass , which runs through a conservation area , has led to violent protests delaying building , bomb threats , staff intimidation and picketing of chief executive B-PER I-PER 's home . A B-ORG spokesman told B-ORG : " We 've had all sorts of protests at the head office and the chief executive 's house . But it 's when it gets to the ( employee ) families -- that it goes across the line . " Tactics used by some underground groups including the cryptic B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , which distribute leaflets with instructions on home-made explosives , are now the subject of a police investigation . Other larger activist groups include B-ORG I-ORG , B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , B-ORG I-ORG and B-ORG I-ORG . The groups have targeted specific projects like the B-LOC bypass and the B-LOC motorway through B-LOC I-LOC in the southern county of B-LOC . But they are also campaigning on broader issue such as stopping the government road building programme and out-of-town superstores which they say create more traffic , pollution and damage local communities . The government has slashed its road-building spending . Although protests may have contributed to the decision it has been seen primarily as economic rather than ecological . B-PER I-PER , chief executive of the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , said : " I do n't think many firms involved in tendering for sensitive projects realise the impact environmental activity has on the cost of running a project . " But they are more alert than they were 3-4 years ago . There 's no doubt it 's a big issue now . " He says the damage comes in two forms : " Tangible -- in the form of extra costs , additional security , threats to staff and the more intangible damage caused by negative publicity . " B-PER said the cost of protesting can be heavy once the company is locked into a contract . " I do often hear on the industry circuit of tales where the company tenders at low margins and the demonstrations which follow means they are running the project at a loss . " B-ORG says it 's not just contractors in the front line but also suppliers like itself . Its own quarries came under attack after it emerged that it may be a supplier for the B-LOC bypass . " It was called the " B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC ' , " said B-ORG 's B-PER . " We had 300 B-ORG I-ORG protestors invade and occupy our site . Hundreds of thousands of pounds ( dollars ) of damage was done in one day . Plus there was the knock-on cost of lost production and extra security in future . " B-PER I-PER , analyst at investement bank B-ORG , said this new phenomenon has led to a change in the way the industry evaluates project risk . " When talking to B-ORG about the B-LOC link ( through B-LOC I-LOC ) they made it fairly clear that their risk assessment methods have been changed and now involve a very clear environmental risk analysis . " B-PER says others have done the same . " As a result of eco-terrorism we are looking at controversial jobs more closely to see if the profit margins are wide enough to cover things like extra security . " For an industry already suffering from razor-thin margins , overcapacity and stagnant demand , eco-terrorism is the latest bizarre twist in the construction sector 's tale of woe . B-MISC I-MISC ends in high spirits . B-LOC 1996-08-26 B-LOC 's annual B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC , the largest in B-LOC and second in the world only to B-LOC , ended peacefully on Monday with an estimated 800,000 revellers singing and dancing the day away in high spirits . Police said they made 30 arrests and there were two stabbings . But there was no repeat of the ugly scenes that used to scar the street festival , and police praised the crowds over the two days of festivities as good-natured . Around 400 police were wounded in riots in 1976 when the carnival , now in its 31st year , acquired its darker reputation from which it is now only slowly recovering . Shopkeepers still board up their windows and many residents leave town for the weekend , but for four or five years there has been no disorder and relatively little crime . B-LOC newspaper reports central bank scandal . B-LOC 1996-08-27 B-LOC 's central bank suffered seven billion rupiah ( $ 2.9 million ) in losses resulting from fake transactions , the B-ORG I-ORG reported on Tuesday . A B-ORG I-ORG spokeswoman confirmed the newspaper report but declined to give further details . The bank 's governor B-PER I-PER was quoted as saying on Monday about 5.4 billion rupiah of the seven billion rupiah had been recovered . The newspaper said it was the central bank 's first public scandal in its 43-year history . The paper said five people had been arrested and police were looking for two more suspects . ( $ 1 = 2,341 rupiah ) GOLF - PLAYERS DIVIDED ON CART REQUEST FOR B-PER . B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-27 B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER are divided on whether B-PER I-PER I-PER should be allowed to return to the B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC using a motorised cart to transport him around the course . The B-MISC has not played for nearly a year because of rheumatoid arthritis in both his feet , and organisers of a pairs event to be staged in B-LOC , B-LOC from October 17 to 20 have been asked to provide him with a buggy . " If the ( B-MISC 's tournament ) committee decides to change the rule I would not be against it , " said B-PER , B-PER 's compatriot and B-MISC I-MISC captain . But commitee member B-PER said it could set an unhelpful precedent . " I know B-PER 's situation is very unfortunate , but I do n't think we can start giving dispensations , " he said . " You 've got to have a rule for everybody and I do n't think it 's feasible . " The use of carts is generally prohibited in the professional game , and if B-PER is allowed to use one in B-LOC , he might then request one for the qualifying tournaments for next year 's B-MISC I-MISC . B-LOC 1996-08-27 B-PER I-PER , the 43-year-old former B-LOC captain , is to continue playing county cricket for at least another season , his club B-ORG announced on Tuesday . Opener B-PER 's decision comes towards the end of a season in which he has underlined his consistency by becoming the leading scorer in B-ORG 's history , beating B-PER I-PER 's aggregate of 29,434 . B-PER , who retired from test cricket after the 1994-95 tour of B-LOC but is now an B-LOC selector , is seventh in this season 's first-class averages with 1,429 runs at 64.95 , having hit five centuries and one double century . B-ORG secretary-general manager B-PER I-PER said : " He is a remarkable batsman and still the best in this country . No-one will argue with that . You just have to look at his record to appreciate that fact . " SOCCER - B-LOC CLUB BOSS BANNED FOR HEADBUTT . B-LOC 1996-08-27 The B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG has banned first division club B-ORG I-ORG 's president B-PER I-PER for two years for headbutting a visiting team player , a federation statement said . B-LOC 's soccer bosses also fined B-PER , a well-known miners ' union leader , 10 million lei ( $ 3000 ) for the half-time attack on B-ORG I-ORG 's B-PER I-PER last Sunday . Miners led by B-PER rioted in B-LOC in 1990 and 1991 , bringing down the reformist government of premier B-PER I-PER . B-PER is awaiting trial for assault and criminal damage in a bar in his home town of B-LOC , 300 kms west of B-LOC . The attack on B-PER came during a tunnel skirmish between opposing players as they left the field . " B-PER 's blow was not too painful because I 'm a tall man , " B-PER told B-ORG on Tuesday . B-PER is one of the tallest players in B-LOC 's first division , towering over B-PER by some 17 cms , B-ORG I-ORG , promoted to the first division this year , won the league game 1-0 . B-PER is barred from taking part in any official soccer activity during the ban . SQUASH - B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC FIRST ROUND RESULTS . B-PER I-PER B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-27 B-PER I-PER produced some of his vintage best on Tuesday to extend his grand run at the B-MISC I-MISC by toppling B-MISC champion B-PER I-PER in straight sets at the B-MISC I-MISC . B-PER , competing in the 54th consecutive and final B-MISC I-MISC event of his illustrious career , turned back the clock at B-LOC I-LOC with a flowing 6-3 6-3 6-3 serve-and-volley victory over the fifth-seeded B-MISC . " It 's a win that I can be proud of , " said the 30-year-old B-MISC , winner of two B-LOC Opens and six B-MISC I-MISC titles in all . " It 's never easy to beat the B-MISC champion . " B-PER , who has said he will retire at season 's end , made it look easy under gray skies at the B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC . The unseeded B-MISC struck quickly , breaking B-PER in the first game and never let loose his grip on the one hour 44 minute match as he served and volleyed with the grace that made him one of the dominant players of his time . " There 's not doubt about it , B-PER was definitely off his game and I took advantage , " said B-PER . " I still have my days where I feel great out there . " Also reaching the second round were top-seeded defending champion B-PER I-PER , a 6-2 6-2 6-1 winner over last minute replacement B-PER I-PER of B-LOC , called on after B-PER I-PER of B-LOC withdrew because of a sprained ankle . Third seed B-PER I-PER of B-LOC also charged into the second round with a 6-1 7-6 ( 7-2 ) 6-2 romp over B-PER I-PER of B-LOC . B-PER I-PER of B-LOC , the 10th seed , also advanced . B-PER claimed a 4-6 6-1 6-4 6-2 victory over B-LOC 's B-PER I-PER . On the women 's side , second seed B-PER I-PER got off to a strong start by beating fellow-American B-PER I-PER 6-0 6-1 and was joined in the second round by B-LOC 's B-PER I-PER I-PER ( seeded third ) , B-MISC champion B-PER I-PER ( 8 ) and B-PER I-PER of B-LOC ( 17 ) . The women 's draw lost another seed when B-MISC B-PER I-PER overcame B-PER I-PER of B-LOC 2-6 6-3 6-1 . The fifth- seeded B-PER joined B-PER I-PER ( 5 ) and B-PER I-PER ( 12 ) on the sidelines . B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-27 B-PER I-PER pitched eight scoreless innings and B-PER I-PER drove in the game 's only run with a first-inning single as the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG claimed a 1-0 victory over the B-ORG I-ORG on Monday . B-PER ( 8-13 ) , who entered the game with one complete game in the first 56 starts of his career , limited the B-ORG to two hits and two walks with four strikeouts . " We 've been working all year on my follow-through , and I really concentrated on that , " B-PER said . " It gave me more life in all of my pitches , so the ball moved more . " At B-LOC , B-PER I-PER homered and drove in three runs as the B-ORG I-ORG had 10 extra-base hits and B-PER I-PER won his first game in almost a year in a 9-5 rain-shortened seven-inning victory over the B-ORG I-ORG . B-PER ( 1-0 ) , who made his first start since June 3rd and underwent arthroscopic surgery on his right shoulder earlier in the season , allowed five runs and six hits in five innings . In B-LOC , B-PER I-PER allowed two runs over seven innings and B-PER I-PER had a run-scoring single in the seventh to lift the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG to a 3-2 victory over the B-ORG I-ORG . B-PER ( 14-9 ) allowed five hits , walked five and struck out 10 for his 11th win in 12 decisions . The B-ORG moved within one-half game of first-place B-ORG in the B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC . BASEBALL - B-ORG WIN , B-ORG LOSE . B-LOC 1996-08-27 B-PER I-PER 's bases-loaded walk scored B-PER I-PER with the winning run in the bottom of the 10th as the B-ORG I-ORG regained control of the top spot in the wild-card race with a wild 12-11 victory over the B-ORG I-ORG . Trailing by a run entering the 11th , the B-ORG rallied against B-ORG reliever B-PER I-PER ( 0-2 ) with a walk and a triple by B-PER I-PER to tie the game . Then B-ORG manager B-PER I-PER decided to intentionally walk B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER to load the bases but B-PER was nowhere near the plate to B-PER . The decisive pitch nearly hit B-PER and gave the B-ORG a one-half game lead over the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG in the wild-card race . In B-LOC , B-PER I-PER 's eighth-inning single snapped a tie as the B-ORG I-ORG edged the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG 2-1 in the opener of a three-game series . B-ORG I-ORG starter B-PER I-PER left the game in the first inning after B-ORG shortstop B-PER I-PER lined a shot off his left elbow . The B-ORG have lost 12 of their last 19 games and their lead in the B-MISC B-MISC over B-ORG fell to five games . At B-LOC , B-PER I-PER pitched a six-hitter for his third complete game of the season and B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER hit solo home runs in the second inning as the surging B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG won their third straight 4-1 over the B-ORG I-ORG . B-ORG has won seven of eight and is 20-6 since August 2nd . The B-ORG I-ORG are two games over .500 for the first time this season . In B-LOC , B-PER I-PER pitched 5-1/3 scoreless innings and B-PER I-PER scored one run and doubled in another as the B-ORG I-ORG held off the slumping B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , 3-2 . Eldred ( 6-5 ) walked one and struck out three . B-PER I-PER retired one batter and B-PER I-PER retired the next four but loaded the bases in the eighth . In B-LOC , B-PER I-PER 's solo homer in the ninth inning snapped a tie and B-PER I-PER pitched a three-hitter for his first win in over a month , leading the B-ORG I-ORG to their 11th straight victory over the B-ORG I-ORG , 2-1 . With the score tied 1-1 in the ninth , Thome hit a 2-2 pitch from starter B-PER I-PER ( 6-11 ) over the left-field fence for his 29th homer . In B-LOC , B-PER I-PER allowed three runs over seven innings to make homers by B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER stand up as the surging B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG held off the B-ORG I-ORG , 5-3 . B-LOC returned home from a 10-game road trip and won for the eighth time in nine games as B-PER ( 11-8 ) allowed nine hits and struck out eight without a walk . BASEBALL - B-MISC I-MISC RESULTS MONDAY . B-LOC I-LOC Results of B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC games played on Monday ( home team in CAPS ) : B-MISC I-MISC B-ORG 2 B-ORG 1 B-ORG 12 B-ORG 11 ( 10 innings ) B-ORG 5 B-ORG 3 B-ORG 3 B-ORG 2 B-ORG 4 B-ORG 1 B-ORG 2 B-ORG I-ORG 1 B-MISC I-MISC B-ORG I-ORG 1 B-ORG 0 B-ORG I-ORG 3 B-ORG 2 B-ORG 9 B-ORG 5 TENNIS - B-PER , B-LOC ADVANCE , TWO WOMEN 'S SEEDS FALL . B-PER I-PER B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-26 B-PER I-PER is playing in his 10th B-MISC I-MISC and enjoying his highest seeding ever , but the 24-year-old B-MISC had to overcome a case of the jitters Monday before winning his first-round match on opening day . B-PER , seeded second behind defending champion B-PER I-PER , took two hours 40 minutes to defeat 186th-ranked B-PER I-PER of B-LOC 3-6 6-1 6-0 7-6 , 8-6 in the tiebreaker . " I was pretty tight the whole match , " conceded B-PER , one of the hottest players on tour this summer with a 16-2 record on hardcourts that included two titles and a runner-up finish . " Everyone has moments when they get tight . Hopefully , this will have been my nerves for the whole tournament . " Joining B-PER into the second round was B-MISC runner-up B-PER I-PER , the 11th seed , who also needed four sets to get past talented B-MISC B-PER I-PER 6-4 2-6 7-6 ( 7-5 ) 6-1 . B-PER 's win was not comfortable , either . The 27-year-old B-MISC hurried off the B-LOC I-LOC for treatment of an upset stomach after his two and a half hour struggle against B-PER . " Towards the end of my match my stomach felt like week-old sushi , " said B-LOC . " Maybe it was a combination of the heat and something I ate . " B-PER and B-PER were the only men 's seeds in action on a day that saw two seeded women 's players fall . B-MISC I-MISC runner-up B-PER I-PER of B-LOC , the sixth seed , was undone by an unlucky draw that put her against 17th ranked B-MISC I-MISC B-PER I-PER in her opening match . B-PER claimed revenge for the semifinal defeat she suffered to B-PER in B-LOC by taking a 6-1 2-6 6-2 victory . Last year 's B-MISC junior champion , B-PER I-PER of B-LOC , removed another seed from the draw by eliminating number 12 B-PER I-PER of B-LOC 6-4 6-2 . Other men 's winners included a pair of former B-MISC I-MISC tournament champions whose victories set up a showdown in the second round . B-LOC 's B-PER I-PER , the 1991 B-MISC champion , and two-time B-MISC I-MISC winner B-PER I-PER of B-LOC will face each other next after beating B-MISC B-PER I-PER 6-3 1-6 6-1 7-5 , and B-MISC B-PER I-PER 6-2 6-0 7-6 ( 7-1 ) , respectively . B-PER I-PER , who scored his first professional title eight days ago in B-LOC I-LOC , advanced to the second round with a 6-4 1-6 6-4 6-3 win over B-LOC 's B-PER I-PER . B-MISC bad boy B-PER I-PER caught a break Monday when he advanced after the retirement of B-MISC B-PER I-PER due to heat exhaustion . B-PER was leading 6-7 ( 5-7 ) 6-4 6-1 3-1 . B-PER blamed breezy conditions for some of the erratic play in his match with B-PER , who had beaten him in the round of 32 at the 1992 B-LOC B-MISC . B-PER committed an untidy 53 unforced errors , though he made seven fewer than the B-MISC , who also walloped a woeful 24 double faults . The most deflating double fault came when B-PER was serving to force a fifth set , leading 6-4 in the tiebreaker . The set point came after confusion at the net on the point previous , which was awarded to B-PER after the two exchanged shots at close quarters at the net . First B-PER approached the umpire , then B-PER , then B-PER again before play finally resumed . " Those little seconds were like an hour to me , " said B-PER , who promptly fired two serves barely contained by the baseline as he frittered away his best chance . B-PER ran off the next three points to close out the match but for B-PER , the contest was a personal victory . The 26-year-old B-MISC had risen into the top 30 in 1992 . The next year a close friend was struck by a stray bullet while riding home in a car from a soccer game in B-LOC I-LOC . He died slumped against B-PER , who subsequently lost interest in tennis . " Two months ago I started talking about quitting , " said B-PER , who decided to give it one last try and made it through the B-MISC qualifying tournament last weekend . " I believe in my game again , " he said . At the end of the day , a spate of withdrawals from the tournament were announced . Eighth seed B-PER I-PER withdrew because of a bruised right knee , and 1988 B-MISC champion B-PER I-PER bowed out due to a groin pull , organisers said . Women 's ninth seed B-PER I-PER I-PER pulled out because of tendinitis in her right wrist . SOCCER - B-MISC FIRST DIVISION SUMMARY . B-LOC 1996-08-27 Former B-MISC champions B-ORG held B-MISC champions B-ORG to a goalless draw in a lacklustre league match on Tuesday . B-ORG , who start their B-MISC I-MISC campaign next week against B-ORG I-ORG , dominated the match but were unable to score . Unbeaten in four matches , they still trail leaders B-ORG by one point . B-ORG , who have won all their three league matches so far , host B-ORG on Wednesday night . Despite another dismal performance , especially in defence , B-ORG restored some pride by keeping the reigning champions at bay after losing 2-1 at home to B-ORG last Saturday . After two seasons in the second division and after taking on half a dozen new recruits this season , some of whom do not speak a word of B-MISC , B-ORG are not playing with any fluidity . B-LOC 1996-08-27 B-MISC league leaders B-ORG I-ORG said on Tuesday they would appeal against a nine-month ban imposed on B-MISC international defender B-PER I-PER for his part in a post-match brawl . B-PER , also fined 10,000 B-MISC francs ( $ 8,400 ) , traded punches with B-ORG I-ORG 's B-MISC player B-PER I-PER after a match on Saturday . When officials and coaching staff tried to intervene , B-PER launched a flying kick at B-PER , but only succeeded in kneeing B-ORG I-ORG coach B-PER I-PER in the stomach . B-PER , who appeared to have elbowed B-PER in the final minutes of the 3-0 win by B-ORG , was suspended for seven matches and fined 1,000 francs ( $ 840 ) by the B-MISC league disciplinary committee . Club president B-PER I-PER said he was astonished the committee had arrived at its decision so quickly and vowed the club would appeal . B-ORG coach B-PER I-PER described the incident as " shocking " , but said B-PER was also to blame . " B-PER physically and verbally provoked B-PER during the match . The referee could not have seen it or he would have punished him , " B-PER said . " During the scuffle , B-PER threw the first punch . Tomorrow , if someone punches me , I would not know how to react . " B-PER , who won his one B-MISC cap against B-LOC in February 1994 , cannot play in B-LOC or elsewhere until May next year . CYCLING - B-PER CLEARED OF DOPING . B-LOC 1996-08-27 Veteran B-MISC B-PER I-PER has been cleared of doping after testing positive for high levels of testosterone during the B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC in June , the B-MISC cycling federation said on Tuesday . " He has been cleared . The case is closed , " a spokesman said . B-PER tested positive for the banned hormone after the fifth stage of the B-MISC , in which he finished third overall . But the spokesman said subsequent tests in B-LOC proved his body produced higher-than-average testosterone levels naturally . B-PER , who won the B-MISC I-MISC in 1990 and two successive world titles , was banned for three months in 1994 after testing positive for the stimulant caffeine . B-PER 0:10 B-ORG SLIPS ON B-LOC BOURSE BUT FUTURE STRONG . B-PER I-PER B-LOC 1996-08-27 Expectations that B-ORG I-ORG , the B-MISC bourse 's first foreign listing , will report a disappointing first half have depressed the stock below its issue price , but analysts expect a rebound in the long term . " The first half of the year is unlikely to be as strong as expected so the company will probably be unable to reach its annual plan in 1996 , " said B-PER I-PER , a London-based analyst for B-ORG I-ORG . The B-MISC packaging materials company , which floated its shares in B-LOC in July , for most of the past two weeks hovered below the 6,425 forints / Global Depositary Receipts price of its initial offering , which was oversubscribed . The company , which asked for a two-week delay from the usual August 15 deadline for reporting first-half results , closed on Tuesday at 5,800 forints , down 300 . " B-ORG 's first-half figures will be ... between one-third of two-fifths of its annual plan , " said B-PER I-PER , a B-MISC analyst for B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . Analysts blame , at least partly , B-LOC 's macroeconomic environment for the weaker figures for B-ORG which , operating in B-LOC , B-LOC and the B-LOC I-LOC , now generates about 55 to 60 percent of its annual sales from B-LOC . B-LOC 's Gross Domestic Product fell one percentage point in the first quarter while real wages plunged 7.2 percentage points in the first half of 1996 . Both will have their impact on B-ORG 's figures , the analysts said . Despite the current difficulties , however , analysts were convinced that B-ORG 's outlook was strong . " The eastern B-MISC market offers good chances , " said B-PER . " Just like many other companies on the bourse , B-ORG has big growth opportunities . " " At the same time , it 's an advantage for B-ORG that it has a foreign management which perhaps understands the market better , " B-PER added . " B-ORG is a very good story in the long-term as the per capita packaging consumption is still so low in east B-LOC that a very strong increase can be expected ( long-term ) , " B-PER said , saying that several recent moves by B-ORG boosted its position . Among them , he noted that B-ORG had acquired the outstanding stake in its B-MISC folding company B-ORG I-ORG , increasing its ownership to 100 percent , so in the second half the whole of B-ORG 's figures will be consolidated . The company also repaid some $ 21 million of debt , well above the originally planned $ 8 million to $ 9 million . In addition , its B-MISC operation began with some six weeks of delay due to cold winter weather and the test run was also longer than planned . -- B-LOC newsroom ( 36 1 ) 266 2410 DIRECT EQUITY TRADES ON THE B-MISC B-ORG - AUG 27 . On Monday , the company said it had agreed to be acquired by B-ORG I-ORG in a deal valued at $ 14 billion . B-ORG shares surged on the news while B-ORG fell on fears of dilution . B-PER left out of B-LOC B-MISC I-MISC squad . B-LOC 1996-08-27 B-LOC 's most experienced player , defender B-PER I-PER , was left out of the national squad for the first time in 11 years on Tuesday when new manager B-PER I-PER named his side to face B-LOC in a B-MISC I-MISC qualifier . The 36-year-old B-ORG I-ORG player won the last of his B-MISC record of 82 international caps against the B-LOC I-LOC in B-LOC in April . " B-PER accepted the situation . He has n't played any first-team games for B-PER this season and he 's not the type of player I would have brought on as a substitute , " B-PER said . " But he surprised me in training over the last two days because of his involvement . He 's certainly is still very much part of my plans for the future . " At 24 , 25 or 26 you could get away with it , not having played first-team games . But at 36 it would be asking too much of B-PER , " he said . B-MISC rebels say missionaries should be freed . B-PER I-PER B-LOC 1996-08-27 The main rebel group in south B-LOC said on Tuesday it was trying to arrange the release of six B-MISC I-MISC missionaries , including three B-MISC nuns , held for nearly two weeks . B-PER I-PER , B-LOC spokesman for the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) , said it was urgently trying to contact B-ORG commander B-PER I-PER at B-LOC in the south to free the six . " The movement is making arrangements for them to be set free . This is a decision of the leadership , " B-PER said . " Commander B-PER I-PER is a soldier so he must accept the leadership 's decision . But communications at this time of year are very difficult because of rains and a lack of power , " he added . The B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG in B-LOC said on Monday that four of the six had been charged by the B-ORG with spying , spreading B-MISC and hindering recruitment into the rebel group . " These charges are the interpretation of the church , " B-PER said on Tuesday . " We have no idea why they are being held . We are still trying to establish contact with the local commander . " Asked whether this meant the commander was out of control , B-PER said the rebel movement was working on the problem . He said he believed all six were being held in the mission compound at B-LOC and were reported to be in good health . The B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG in B-LOC said on Monday that B-MISC Sisters B-PER I-PER , 73 , and B-PER I-PER , 68 , B-MISC Father B-PER I-PER , 48 , and B-MISC Father B-PER I-PER , 48 , were held in a prison in south B-LOC by the B-ORG . It said B-MISC Sister B-PER I-PER , 52 , and B-MISC Brother B-PER I-PER , 28 , were held inside the compound . The church in B-LOC said on Monday B-PER , B-PER , B-PER and B-LOC were held in a prison until the weekend , when they were moved to join the other captives at the compound . The B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG said the B-ORG in the B-MISC capital had attributed the detentions of the six to a local commander and had promised they would be freed by August 23 . But the church learned in a recent meeting with the local commander that no instructions to release the prisoners were received and they would be held until investigations were completed . It said last Friday they were visited by Monsignor B-PER I-PER , apostolic administrator of the diocese of B-LOC in southern B-LOC , and an B-ORG administrator and appeared in good condition . " On August 17 the mission was surrounded ( by the B-ORG ) and sealed off . The evening of the same day the missionaries were put in prison or isolation . Later the mission was looted , " it added . An B-MISC foreign ministry official said the charges against them were " fairly bizarre " and a matter for concern . He said B-MISC diplomats in B-LOC were working with the B-MISC I-MISC church in southern B-LOC and with B-LOC and B-MISC diplomats in the region to help free the missionaries . The B-ORG has fought B-LOC 's government forces in the south since 1983 for greater autonomy or independence of the mainly B-MISC and animist region from the B-MISC , B-LOC I-LOC . B-ORG postpones B-MISC municipal elections . B-LOC 1996-08-27 The B-LOC diplomat in charge of elections in B-LOC announced on Tuesday that voting for municipal assemblies would be postponed because of irregularities by the B-MISC in registering voters . Ambassador B-PER I-PER , representing the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) , told reporters that municipal polls due on September 14 with other B-MISC elections would be put off . " I have made a chairman 's decision that it is not feasible to hold municipal elections on September 14 , " said B-PER . He said no exact date had been set but it was possible the local elections would take place in the spring of 1997 . According to B-ORG officials , B-MISC authorities have pressed their refugees to register to vote in towns now under B-MISC control , but which used to have B-MISC majorities . Human rights workers say authorities in B-LOC and B-MISC I-MISC territory have conducted a well-organised campaign to coerce refugees into registering only on B-MISC territory and failed to inform them of their rights under the B-LOC peace agreement . Diplomats say the effect of the electoral engineering would be to establish political control over districts they conquered and ethnically cleansed in war . The response of the B-MISC I-MISC to the B-ORG 's announcement was not immediately clear . But B-MISC I-MISC leaders have hinted they would boycott the poll if the municipal elections were postponed , or go ahead with their own . The B-MISC I-MISC cabinet , in a letter to the B-ORG , said on Monday that any delay of local elections would be " a direct and flagrant violation fo the B-LOC agreement " . The B-MISC , who administer half of B-LOC in a B-MISC republic , said they had met all conditions for holding the September elections . Diplomats fear that the crisis could cast doubt over the entire election process , which already appears set to confirm B-LOC 's ethnic partition rather than its reintegration as the B-LOC peace agreement had planned . New talks in B-LOC as B-PER waits for B-PER . B-PER I-PER B-LOC I-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-27 B-MISC and rebel military commanders finally met in B-LOC on Tuesday for delayed talks aimed at finalising a ceasefire arranged last week by President B-PER I-PER 's envoy B-PER I-PER . The B-MISC army commander in the region , General B-PER I-PER , arrived at the rebel-held village of B-LOC I-LOC , some 20 km ( 12 miles ) south of the B-MISC capital B-LOC for discussions with rebel chief-of-staff B-PER I-PER . But B-PER himself , the B-LOC security chief , is still waiting back in B-LOC to meet B-PER over his plans for a lasting political settlement in B-LOC . B-ORG news agency quoted the B-LOC press service as saying B-PER , who left for a state holiday home near B-LOC on Monday , would hold no working meetings on Tuesday . B-PER interrupted talks with B-LOC 's separatists on a political deal on Sunday , saying he had to consult with B-PER . After a meeting failed to materialise on Monday , B-PER 's spokesman said he might meet the president on Tuesday . But B-PER 's spokesman rebuffed the suggestion , saying the president had left B-LOC for a holiday near the capital . The B-MISC postponed the talks after a B-MISC band disarmed a column of B-ORG I-ORG troops on Sunday . The B-MISC said a renegade group seized the weapons and said on Monday they had all been returned . The B-MISC command insisted that not all the weapons were the same as those taken . B-ORG said the weapons and the practical implementation of the ceasefire signed by B-PER and B-PER last Thursday would be on the agenda of today 's talks . Neither spoke to reporters before the meeting , which started around 10.45 a.m. ( 0645 B-MISC ) . Also in B-LOC I-LOC on Tuesday morning , was B-PER I-PER , the B-MISC diplomat who heads the B-LOC mission of the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) . B-PER , who helped broker an earlier truce in May , was not taking part in the B-MISC talks . B-PER 's peace mission this month has stopped some of the worst fighting of the 20-month-old conflict . However , tension on the ground indicates that it could falter if the momentum for a settlement is not maintained . Three B-MISC servicemen were wounded in a total of six shooting incidents overnight , B-ORG news agency quoted the B-MISC military as saying on Tuesday morning . B-ORG news agency quoted an army source accusing rebel fighters of failing to turn up for joint B-MISC police patrols in some districts of the capital B-LOC on Tuesday . But the separatist command told B-ORG news agency the patrols , part of the truce brokered by B-PER last week , would begin on Tuesday after delays for " technical reasons " . B-PER 's spokesman said he might meet officials during his break , but indicated B-PER was low on the list by saying B-PER would need time to study the proposals before talking to him . B-MISC news agencies also quoted the B-LOC spokesman as saying that B-PER 's representatives had not sought a meeting , hinting at an attempt by the president to put his popular and outspoken protege in his place with a lesson on protocol . B-PER , 65 , has kept a low profile since he was reelected in July , prompting new speculation that the two heart attacks he suffered last year and a rumoured drinking problem could be taking their toll , weakening his grip on affairs of state . Aides have dismissed such speculation , insisting that he simply needs a rest after his energetic election campaign . Some analysts say the B-LOC leader , whose order sending troops and tanks into B-LOC in 1994 started B-LOC 's ill-fated military campaign , could merely be reluctant to put his name to a peace process which might fall apart . But B-PER , who has no real power without his boss and has hinted at dark forces in B-LOC working against him , appears to think a deal will not stick without strong backing from B-PER . His proposals have not been spelled out but are expected to involve a compromise between the separatists ' demand for independence and B-LOC 's insistence that B-LOC remain part of the B-LOC I-LOC . B-LOC and B-LOC target B-ORG , B-ORG membership . B-LOC 1996-08-27 B-LOC and B-LOC pledged to intensify cooperation on Tuesday and reinforced their determination to join the B-ORG I-ORG and B-ORG at the earliest possible date . B-MISC President B-PER I-PER and his B-MISC counterpart , B-PER I-PER , met for talks at the start of a two-day visit to B-LOC by B-PER . It was their fourth meeting this year . They said in a statement they agreed to have regular telephone contact to discuss progress in strengthening ties with the B-LOC . " We expect our cooperation will help both countries towards entering the B-ORG I-ORG and B-ORG , " B-PER said . " We have similar ambitions as far as our internal development and international life is concerned , " B-PER said . B-LOC and B-LOC are hoping to be among the first group of former eastern bloc countries to join the B-ORG I-ORG and B-ORG . They have already signed an association agreement with the B-ORG I-ORG and are both part of the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , which also comprises B-LOC , B-LOC and the B-LOC I-LOC . B-LOC 's trade with B-LOC rose to $ 142.3 million in 1995 from $ 118.8 million in 1994 . During his visit to B-LOC , B-PER is also scheduled to meet Prime Minister B-PER I-PER , representatives of B-MISC political parties and representatives of the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . Nationalists want B-PER ousted for B-LOC pact . B-LOC 1996-08-27 Junior Nationalist members of B-LOC 's ruling coalition called on Tuesday for the impeachment of President B-PER I-PER for backing a friendship treaty with neighbouring B-LOC . B-PER 's B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , the senior coalition partner , immediately dismissed the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) demand as crude electioneering . " It is a desperate move by the B-ORG , which is losing its only reason for existing ahead of the electoral campaign , " said B-ORG executive president B-PER I-PER . " This treaty is both necessary and good , " B-PER said , adding that the B-ORG 's stance was threatening its position in the government . The treaty agreed unexpectedly two weeks ago will end years of disputes over the status of B-LOC 's large ethnic B-MISC minority . It will also boost both countries ' chances of admission to B-ORG and the B-ORG I-ORG . " If they ( the B-ORG ) are so vexed , they could leave the government ... We might also help them to do it , if they go on like this , " he said . The B-ORG holds four key ministries -- justice , transport , agriculture and communications . B-ORG leader B-PER I-PER said in a statement B-PER , in power since the fall of communism in 1989 , should be impeached for treason for compromising on the issue of ethnic B-MISC minority rights in the treaty due to be signed next month . B-PER 's call came on the eve of the official launch of B-PER 's campaign for a new term at November 3 polls . His appeal to the opposition to back his attempt to oust B-PER was unlikely to succeed , analysts said .
