Presidential officials were not available to comment on the call for B-PER 's impeachment . B-MISC MPS see little hope of electing president . B-PER I-PER B-LOC 1996-08-27 B-LOC 's parliament failed for a second time to elect a president on Tuesday , dealing a blow to incumbent B-PER I-PER and pushing the country towards stalemate in its choice of a new head of state . Neither B-PER , who oversaw B-LOC 's first steps into statehood after the collapse of the B-LOC I-LOC , nor his arch-rival , former communist B-PER I-PER , have secured the 68 votes necessary from the 101-member parliament . B-PER garnered 49 votes and B-PER 34 in Tuesday 's ballot for the five-year presidency of B-LOC . A third and final vote was due to be held when parliament reconvened on Tuesday but legislators were not expecting a clear result . If there is no result the decision will be ceded to an electoral college . " The votes are a strong message to B-PER that he is not favoured by some politicians any more , " B-ORG I-ORG head B-PER I-PER told B-ORG . Under a constitution agreed in 1992 , a year after independence , the president has no executive powers . His only political role is to smoothe the functioning of government in periods of crisis . But B-PER , 67 , has been accused in parliament of taking too much power and not always consulting parliamentarians before making decisions . His relations with a leftist-led government have sometimes been tense . His support in the first round of voting on Monday was much lower than expected , scoring only 45 votes , which political analysts put down as a vote of no confidence in his performance . This support only inched up to 49 in the second vote . Support for B-PER , 68 , remained constant at 34 votes . If the third vote fails to give either B-PER or B-PER 68 votes , the parliamentary speaker will convene an electoral college of 101 MPs and 273 local goverment representatives to hold a new poll that could include new nominations . This would be the first time that the former B-MISC republic has had to call together an electoral college . In its first presidential election in 1992 B-PER won the necessary votes in in a parliamentary election against B-PER . Parliamentary organisers said the exact timetable remained unclear but it would probably take about a month to organise an electoral college which could also hold several rounds of voting before a clear winner emerges . B-LOC assembly fails to elect state president . B-LOC 1996-08-27 The B-MISC parliament failed for a third and final time to elect a new state president on Tuesday , refusing a second mandate for incumbent B-PER I-PER . Neither B-PER nor his rival B-PER I-PER could garner the 68 votes needed from the 101 members of parliament to become president . In the third vote B-PER won 52 and B-PER won 32 votes . The final decision will now be made by a larger assembly . B-PER won 49 in a second vote earlier on Tuesday and 45 in the first on Monday . B-PER won 34 votes in the first two secret ballots . B-PER I-PER , chairman of the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG said 96 members of parliament cast votes , with one ballot paper invalid and 11 abstentions . The election will now go before an electoral college involving MPs and local government representatives that will be convened by the parliamentary Speaker in the next day or so . It could take up to a month before a new vote but the timetable is not yet clear . This is the first time the former B-MISC republic has had to convene such a group . B-LOC 1996-08-27 B-LOC 's parliament again failed to elect a new state president on Tuesday when neither of two candidates secured a majority in second-round voting . Incumbent president B-PER I-PER won 49 votes compared to 34 won by his rival , deputy Parliamentary Speaker B-PER I-PER . But B-PER 's support was not enough for the 68 needed for election and a third secret ballot will take place later in the day ( 1300 B-MISC ) , parliamentary officials said . To win a clear mandate for the five-year presidential term , a candidate must secure 68 votes from the 101-member parliament . B-PER I-PER , Chairman of the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , said 96 members of parliament voted in the second round , with 12 abstentions and one ballot paper invalid . On Monday , in the first round of voting , B-PER secured 45 votes and B-PER 34 . B-PER 's popularity has suffered in recent years , with politicians criticising him for taking too much power and acting without consulting parliament . If a third round of voting fails to give either candidate 68 votes , the parliamentary speaker has to convene an electoral college of all 101 MPs and 273 local government representatives for a new vote that could take up to a month . The newspaper said the B-ORG I-ORG special administration of B-ORG ends in December 30 and after that the bank has to be liquidated or turned into a federal bank since there are no conditions to return B-ORG to B-LOC I-LOC state government . A B-ORG I-ORG spokesman said he could not confirm or deny the report . B-ORG has been under central bank special temporary administration since December 1994 . The central bank management could be lifted if B-LOC I-LOC state decided to take part in the recent federal government 's plan to restructure state banks . Under the plan , the federal government would provide 100 percent of the financing needed to restructure debt of state banks being privatized , liquidated or turned into development banks . It also offers to refinance up to 50 percent of the debt held by state banks whose governments decide to keep control of their banks . Although the plan was designed under terms proposed by B-LOC I-LOC state governor B-PER I-PER , he has showed no interest in taking part in the plan because B-LOC I-LOC 's debt with B-ORG has increased sharply , B-ORG I-ORG said . B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-26 B-PER I-PER , the former dictator who ruled B-LOC for two years , died at age 78 on Monday . B-PER died after being brought to a hospital a week ago following a fall at home that resulted in a blood clot in the brain . He was operated on earlier in the week but failed to recover from surgery . The former dictator , who ruled from 1971 to 1973 , was best known for allowing B-PER I-PER I-PER , B-LOC 's famed populist leader , to return to B-LOC after 17 years of forced exile . B-PER took over the leadership of the country after five years of dictatorship . But unlike his two predecessors , B-PER I-PER Ongania and B-PER I-PER , who ruled B-LOC with an iron hand , B-PER steered the country toward democracy . That resulted in general elections in March 1973 when the B-ORG led by B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER I-PER returned to power . B-PER was a candidate in the election but failed to defeat his old adversories and never returned to public office . He was imprisoned for four years in 1951 for taking part in a coup attempt to overthrow B-PER led by General B-PER I-PER . B-PER 's rule saw the gradual rise of left-wing activism which culminated in another period of brutal B-MISC dictatorship from 1976 to 1983 , during which the military launched its " dirty war " that resulted in 10,000 missing people . In his autobiography published in 1990 , B-PER described himself as a military man with " democratic ideas . B-LOC 1996-08-27 Dark northern spring and white wheat bids were mostly steady on Tuesday but a few locations quoted weaker values as newly harvested spring wheat flooded the market , several cash grain dealers said . " There 's too much nearby wheat coming into the market so we 're backing off the basis to slow it down , " a B-LOC dealer said . Bids there dropped 10 cents per bushel . Harvest was also progressing well in parts of B-LOC I-LOC , but one dealer there said new crop movement remained limited to a steady trickle . " We 're seeing some new crop coming in now but it 's slow going , " the dealer said . Elsewhere , basis values were mostly steady in quiet conditions with little noteworty domestic or export business , dealers said . Durum bids were steady after jumping 50 cents per bushel in some areas on Monday . Poll shows B-PER lead over B-PER jumps to 15 pts . B-LOC 1996-08-27 An B-ORG I-ORG poll released on Tuesday showed President B-PER I-PER 's lead over B-MISC challenger B-PER I-PER stretching to 15 points in advance of the Nov. 5 election . The poll , taken on Sunday and Monday as the president engaged in a whistle-stop train trip to the B-MISC I-MISC in B-LOC , put B-PER at 51 percent , B-PER at 36 percent and B-PER I-PER of the B-ORG I-ORG at 8 percent . A similar poll conducted on Saturday and Sunday had showed a nine point lead for B-PER , ahead by 47-38 percent . B-PER , down by around 20 points in early August in B-ORG polls , had closed to within four percentage points immediately after the B-MISC convention in B-LOC I-LOC earlier in August . Other polls also showed a strong B-PER bounce after B-LOC I-LOC but B-PER then rebuilding his lead . Tuesday 's poll involved 1,002 registered voters and had a margin of error of 3.5 percentage points . B-ORG said a parallel poll of 824 likely voters showed the president ahead by 11 points , with B-PER at 50 percent , B-PER at 39 percent and B-PER at 6 percent . The poll of registered voters showed a shift in favor of the B-MISC in the elections for B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , with 51 percent saying that if the vote were today they would go for a B-MISC and 41 percent opting for a B-MISC . That compared with the previous poll 's 48-43 lead for the B-MISC . The poll gave B-PER a 53 percent to 39 percent lead over B-PER if B-PER were not in the race . The poll indicated a fall in the number of people who believed B-PER would be able to fulfil his promise to cut the federal budget deficit and cut income taxes by 15 percent at the same time . It showed 23 percent believed it possible compared to 70 who believed it was n't . That compared to 26-57 in the previous poll . B-LOC bulk millfeeds - Immediate supply tight . B-LOC 1996-08-27 Millfeed supplies for prompt shipment remained tight and prices continued to move higher , millfeed dealers said . High-priced corn and increased demand for livestock feed continued to support millfeed prices in nearly all sectors . Flour mills sold much of their production through September leaving little available for prompt shipment . B-LOC sources said feed mixer demand was keeping pace with millfeed production and driving prices higher . B-LOC sources said with corn priced there at $ 200 per ton and barley at $ 140 , the millfeeds at $ 125 represent a good value . In the southeast B-LOC , dealers said feed mixers continued to be steady buyers with demand increasing for October to March positions . The closely-watched B-LOC I-LOC rail market was steady at $ 115 per ton bid and $ 118 offered . -- B-LOC newsdesk 312-408-8720-- B-LOC I-LOC girl has surgery for hairy face . B-LOC 1996-08-27 A two-year old B-MISC I-MISC girl began surgical treatment on Tuesday for a rare condition that has left half of her face covered with a hairy , dark-brown patch of skin . The girl , B-PER I-PER , suffers from a " hairy nevus " on the right side of her face , a condition that has only been reported a few times in medical journals , the B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC I-LOC I-LOC said . In addition to social ostracism , the condition also carries a high risk of cancer . It will be corrected by gradually expanding healthy skin with a surgical balloon , then transplanting that skin to the afflicted side of her face . " She is doing well , " hospital spokeswoman B-PER I-PER said . " The surgery is under way . " B-PER said Tuesday 's surgery involved placing five balloons in B-PER 's forehead , shoulders and the back of her neck and partially filling them with a saline solution . More saline solution will be inserted in 16 weekly treatments . The girl , who was accompanied to B-LOC by her parents , will need more surgery later to correct the condition on her chest , back and legs , the hospital said . B-LOC home sales dip in July - report . B-LOC 1996-08-27 Home sales across B-LOC were down 2.3 percent in July , compared to a month earlier , but up 21 percent for the year , according to the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . The association said a total of 4,464 single-family homes were sold in July , compared to 4,570 in June . The average selling price , $ 206,464 , was up 10.6 percent over July 1995 . Condominium sales edged up 6.0 percent for July and 24.8 percent for the year , the group said , while prices for condos nudged up less than 1.0 percent to an average of $ 123,394 . In July , the average rate on a 30-year fixed rate mortgage was 8.25 percent , below June 's 8.32 percent but still higher than February 's 7.03 percent , the report noted . -- B-LOC bureau , 617-367-4106 B-ORG train derails , three injured - officials . The B-MISC oppose multi-party democracy and want to establish a communist state . But the B-MISC government said the insurgents must give up violence before it negotiates with them . " They ( the insurgents ) should first give up their violent activities , " Home ( Interior ) Minister B-PER I-PER I-PER said . About 54 people have died in B-MISC insurgent activity and in police action against them since February , officials said . B-MISC opposition parties have accused the police of having killed more people than the insurgents . Some human rights groups have criticised the government 's handling of the situation . On Monday , he had offered to talk to leaders of the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) , the B-MISC faction which leads the insurgency . " The government is ready to guarantee security of the B-MISC representatives who want to take part in peaceful dialogue , " B-PER said . A multi-party democracy was set up in B-LOC six years ago , after a popular movement by the centrist B-ORG I-ORG party jointly with the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) party . B-LOC 1996-08-27 The Speaker of B-LOC 's parliament , B-PER I-PER I-PER , said he had received death threats from anonymous callers after opposition parties threatened to boycott proceedings chaired by him . He told the B-MISC newspaper B-ORG I-ORG on Tuesday that such threats were possibly coming from " those who want to push the country into chaos and unrest . " The callers said his life could be cut short , the newspaper said . The speaker was not immediately available for comment . B-PER , a former foreign minister and veteran diplomat , was appointed speaker of the 330-member parliament on July 13 , a month after general elections returned the B-ORG I-ORG of Prime Minister Sheikh B-PER to power after 21 years . B-PER also was president of the 41st session of the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG in 1986-87 . Former prime minister B-PER I-PER I-PER , now the opposition leader in parliament and head of the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) , said her followers might boycott assemby sessions chaired by the " partisan " speaker . " The ruling Awami league is making parliament ineffective and the speaker is contributing to that by not allowing the opposition MPs enough time to speak , " she told a rally in northern district of B-LOC on Monday . B-PER , speaking to a group of engineers in B-LOC on Monday , accused the B-ORG of resorting to " terrorism " as part of its plan to create instability and chaos in the country . " This is not desireable ... and we will deal with such designs sternly , " the prime minister said . B-LOC June M2 up 3.8 pct m / m , up 8.2 pct y / y . " We are pleased that B-ORG shareholders ahave chosen so overwhelmingly to accept this offer . We now have the opportunity to realize the potential of B-ORG 's excellent assets , " B-ORG chairman and chief executive B-PER I-PER said in a statement . The B-MISC 30-a-share deal means B-ORG will own B-ORG 's attractive B-LOC gold deposit in B-LOC . B-ORG said details involving the allocation between B-ORG shares and cash will be available shortly . B-ORG 's offer of B-MISC 30 a share or part cash , part share offer was B-ORG 's second attempt to swallow the small B-MISC gold prospector . B-MISC B-ORG , the world 's third largest gold producer , sweetened its July 11 bid to B-MISC 30 a share from B-MISC 27 on August 16 after a fresh batch of drill results from the B-LOC deposit . Experts have speculated the deposit has potential reserves of up to 12 million ounces . More drilling results are expected soon . The B-ORG bid took observers by surprise , since B-ORG 's exploration was still in its early stages . B-ORG shareholders had the option to choose B-MISC 30 cash or 0.79 B-ORG shares plus 50 cents for each B-ORG share . But she said more had to be done . The B-PER walked on to the stage , he on her arm and with the aid of a cane , to a rousing reception from the convention . B-PER was shot in the head in 1981 by gunman B-PER I-PER , who tried to kill B-PER in a deranged bid to impress B-PER I-PER , an actress he never met but with whom he was obsessed . B-LOC 1996-08-27 A hijacked B-ORG I-ORG plane with 199 passengers and crew on board was expected to land at B-LOC 's B-LOC airport later on Tuesday morning , a police spokeswoman said . They said police and the emergency services were implementing a well-rehearsed contingency plan to handle the hijacking . One of them negotiated through the pilot in B-MISC . The pilot said several hijackers appeared to be placed around the plane . Painted parrot scam lands B-MISC in jail . B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-27 A conman who painted common B-MISC parrots with dye to make them look like rare birds worth thousands of dollars was jailed for fraud on Tuesday . B-PER I-PER painted six green parrots , worth about B-MISC 100 ( B-MISC 79 ) a pair , with a cinnamon hair dye and traded them as B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC , valued at B-MISC 14,000 a pair . B-PER , 32 , of B-LOC , was sentenced in the B-MISC I-MISC District Court to two years in jail for fraud after trading three pairs of impostor birds for 21 parrots worth a total of B-MISC 28,000 . " Everyone was fooled , " said pet shop owner B-PER I-PER , who unknowingly traded the disguised birds . " I 'd already had three local breeders have a look at them and sent photos and videos of the birds to the eastern states for authentication -- they said they 're nice birds , " B-PER told reporters outside court . " After I was told they were dyed , I checked them over again . It was a perfect paint job except for one feather under a wing of one bird that was only half dyed , " B-PER said . B-PER said B-PER , a bird enthusiast , would have succeeded with the fraud if he had not tried to trade a fourth pair of bogus birds after an associate had told police of the scam . If not for the informant , the painted parrots ' true colours would not have been known for six months , he said . " They moult in the summer , so five or six months down the track , I would have looked like the guilty party , " B-PER said . B-LOC motorist 's arrest brings free flight to B-LOC . Nuclear pact will be a step to B-MISC . B-LOC 1996-08-27 B-LOC on Tuesday reaffirmed its support for a global nuclear test ban treaty blocked by B-LOC last week , saying the pact would be an important step in achieving total nuclear disarmament . " Although the final draft of the treaty probably did n't totally satisfy any country , it was in general balanced , " the official B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG newspaper said in a commentary . B-LOC blocked the B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC ( B-MISC ) at the B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC in B-LOC , saying the pact did not contain a clause committing the five declared nuclear powers to a timetable for nuclear disarmament . B-LOC I-LOC 's stance , which was seen as effectively thwarting 2-1/2 years of negotiations at the B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC , drew widespread but generally muted foreign criticism . B-LOC has also pledged to oppose any forwarding of the draft treaty to the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . B-LOC said many countries had compromised to complete the treaty and that the issue of a disarmament schedule could be discussed in future negotiations . " The completion of the test ban treaty would be an important and practical step in the gradual process of achieving total nuclear disarmament , " it said . B-LOC has pledged support for the pact since reaching a deal with the B-LOC I-LOC that made international inspections of nuclear sites more difficult than in earlier drafts of the accord . The newspaper said B-LOC advocated the complete ban and destruction of nuclear weapons but that there was little hope other nuclear powers would soon adopt the same stance . " Some nuclear powers stubbornly uphold policies of nuclear deterrence based on first use of nuclear weapons , " it said . B-LOC held on July 29 what it said would be its last nuclear test before a self-imposed moratorium that took effect the following day . B-LOC was the last declared nuclear power to announce a halt to testing . B-LOC declares food poisoning threat receding . B-LOC 1996-08-27 The government said on Tuesday that the threat from a mysterious killer germ , while still requiring vigilance , appears to be receding in the western B-LOC city of B-LOC , where the epidemic hit the hardest . The food poisoning epidemic caused by the B-MISC colon bacillus in B-LOC appears to be " settling down " , Health Minister B-PER I-PER was quoted by a government spokesman as telling the cabinet . The B-MISC colon bacillus has been found responsible for a widespread food poisoning epidemic that has killed 11 people and made over 9,500 ill this year . B-LOC , near the regional commercial centre of B-LOC , has been hit hardest by the deadly bacteria , with nearly 6,500 , mostly schoolchildren , affected by the disease . Two children in B-LOC have died from complications associated with the bacteria . B-PER told a cabinet meeting on Tuesday that no new victims have been reported since August 8 , indicating that the peak has passed , at least for B-LOC . B-LOC officials agreed with the assessment , but said it was too early to feel relieved . " There are still patients hospitalised and problems which must be dealt with , " a city spokesman said , citing the issue of whether to allow children infected with the bacteria but not showing symptoms to attend school from September . Health authorities believe school lunches were the source of the food poisoning in B-LOC , but researchers have been unable to pinpoint the exact source of the infection . The outbreak has prompted authorities to tighten sanitary standards at slaughterhouses and meatpacking plants and sparked calls for an overhaul of the nation 's school lunch programme . The ministers agreed at Tuesday 's cabinet meeting to step up inspection measures for school lunches in September and October , when schools around the country resume . B-LOC 's B-ORG I-ORG also announced that it will compile hygiene guidelines based on B-LOC government methods of checking the safety of farm produce to prevent another outbreak of the epidemic . As of Monday , 31 children were still hospitalised in B-LOC city , of whom six were in serious condition . B-LOC aluminium shipments surge 8.9 pct in July . B-LOC 1996-08-27 B-MISC shipments of aluminium mill products in July surged 8.9 percent over the same month last year to 224,609 tonnes , while production rose 6.4 percent to 222,457 tonnes , according to preliminary data released on Tuesday by the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . The surge reflected strong demand from the beverage can and housing construction sectors , federation officials said . Figures released two weeks ago from B-LOC 's seven largest mills already showed that B-LOC 's can sheet output reached its highest monthly level ever in July , reflecting above-average temperatures that sparked a jump in beer consumption . A federation official added that the half-year through September 1996 also appeared likely to set a new record for can production , despite cooler temperatures in August . July inventories stood at 75,632 tonnes , down 2.6 percent from the prior month . July foil output was off 0.2 percent year-on-year at 11,525 tonnes , while foil shipments fell 0.8 percent to 11,244 tonnes . June mill output data were revised slightly downward to 210,622 tonnes from the preliminary 210,683 , while shipments were revised marginally upward to 213,989 tonnes from 213,845 . Final figures for June pegged can stock shipments at 40,144 tonnes , up 2.4 percent year-on-year . Shipments to the auto sector fell 5.5 percent to 15,286 tonnes , while the construction sector rose 2.4 percent to 79,390 tonnes . Exports dipped 3.7 percent to 18,867 tonnes . -- B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( 81-3 3432 6179 ) B-LOC thanks B-LOC for support on human rights . B-LOC 1996-08-27 B-LOC has publicly thanked B-LOC for its strong support at the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , where B-LOC has come under attack from B-MISC nations for its human rights record . B-LOC 's President B-PER I-PER offered his gratitude in a meeting on Monday with visiting B-LOC President B-PER I-PER , the official B-ORG news agency said . B-PER also acknowledged the B-MISC I-MISC nation 's support for B-LOC 's stance on B-LOC , which B-LOC views as a renegade province , while B-PER was quoted as thanking B-LOC for economic and technological aid , the agency said late on Monday . In April , B-LOC quashed a draft resolution by the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG expressing concern over continuing reports of B-LOC 's violations of fundamental freedoms . After the defeat of the resolution , drafted by the B-ORG I-ORG and the B-LOC I-LOC , B-LOC 's B-ORG I-ORG thanked 26 countries for backing its motion for " no action " on the document . It was the sixth year in a row that B-LOC avoided censure at the B-ORG 's main human rights forum . B-LOC has been accused of a wide range of human rights abuses , often in violation of its own legal code , in an effort to silence dissent . A B-ORG commentary earlier this year said a plot by the B-MISC to force its human rights standards and values on other countries was doomed to failure . B-LOC 's B-ORG I-ORG cuts prime lending rate . B-LOC 1996-08-27 B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , one of the island 's leading state-run banks , said it was cutting its prime lending rate by 0.05 percentage point , effective on Tuesday . The bank said in a statement it was cutting its prime lending rate to 7.35 percent from 7.40 percent . It also would cut its three-month-to-three-year time deposit rates by between 0.05 and 0.10 percentage points . The moves made B-ORG the first major bank to cut rates in response to a call on Friday from central bank governor B-PER I-PER . In the central bank 's latest bid to jumpstart B-LOC 's sluggish economy , B-PER ordered a reduction of up to a half-percentage point in banks ' reserve requirements and called on commercial banks to pass on the savings in the form of interest rate reductions . -- B-ORG I-ORG ( 5080815 ) B-MISC to strike over B-LOC demolition . B-LOC 1996-08-27 B-MISC leaders in B-LOC called on Tuesday for a two-hour strike to protest what they called B-LOC 's war on B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC after police demolished a building there . B-MISC police demolished a 10 metre ( yard ) by 20 metre structure in B-LOC 's B-LOC I-LOC they said had been built with funding from the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG for use as a social club . Police used a huge crane to lift a bulldozer over the B-LOC I-LOC 's walls to reach the building amidst narrow alleys , witnesses said . Bystanders at the scene said work had begun on the building in 1991 and it had yet to be completed when the B-MISC police bulldozed it . The B-ORG I-ORG was set up under the 1993 B-MISC interim peace deal . " There has been a call for a general strike between one ( 1000 B-MISC ) and three o'clock , " B-MISC lawmaker B-PER I-PER I-PER told B-ORG . " This is a war that has been declared on us and we want our people to come and see the site where they declared the war . " Prime Minister B-PER I-PER 's government , which took office in June , has said it will not allow the B-ORG , set up under a 1993 interim peace deal to control parts of the B-LOC I-LOC and B-LOC I-LOC , to operate in B-LOC . B-LOC 's previous government held the same position but in general turned a blind eye to B-ORG I-ORG activity in the city . Tuesday 's demolition came a day after B-ORG officials said they had bowed to B-PER 's demand they close offices in B-LOC . They said two of the three offices B-LOC wanted closed had been shut . B-PER has made closure of the three offices a condition for resuming peace negotiations with the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) . B-LOC captured B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC in the 1967 B-LOC I-LOC war and annexed it . It says it will never cede any part of the city . B-MISC want B-LOC I-LOC as capital of a future state . The city is up for negotiation at final peace talks which have yet to resume under B-PER . B-ORG adopts rules to improve investor access to best stock prices . B-LOC 1996-08-28 The B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG Wednesday approved rules designed to give stock market investors a better chance at getting the best price available for their orders . The so-called order handling rules , which were proposed last September , were approved in a 4-0 vote . The new rules will require specialists at stock exchanges and market makers on B-MISC to allow customers to view price quotes from other electronic trading systems that may not be readily available to them . The rules will also require that customer limit orders be displayed with prices better than those available in quotes publicly available at the time . Specialists and market makers are companies or individuals recognised as qualified to maintain an orderly market in a stock . In a limit order , investors specify the price at which they are willing to buy or sell , as opposed to a market order executed at prevailing prices . " These rules are intended to empower all investors , by allowing their orders to compete on a level playing field , and by providing the disclosure they need to make informed decisions , " said B-ORG Chairman B-PER I-PER . The B-ORG 's goal , he added , was to create " one system where one price could be available to everybody . " The director of the B-ORG 's division of market regulation , B-PER I-PER , said B-LOC I-LOC firms will probably need to spend about $ 7 million to carry out the improvements called for by the new rules . In proposing the rules last year , the B-ORG noted that while technology has improved , commonplace practices still existed that worked against investors ' best interests . It noted that customers whose orders were not displayed lost the chance of getting the best possible price available in the market . It also cited the potential problem of a two-tiered market in which market makers quote one price to public investors while quoting better prices in private systems , thus robbing investors without access to " hidden " quotes the benefit of the best available prices . Earlier this month , the B-ORG settled charges of alleged malpractices on B-MISC when the parent of the B-MISC market , the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , agreed to spend $ 100 million over five years to upgrade its oversight of brokers ' trading practices . The B-ORG dropped a third proposal that would have allowed investors with market orders to trade at a better price if there were shifts in prices before their orders were executed . The agency said it would monitor effects of the two new rules before considering the " price improvement " proposal again . The agency also proposed rule changes that would require continuous " bid " and " ask " quotations from exchange specialists and market makers who trade more than 1 percent of a stock during any quarter on B-MISC . The B-ORG 's limit order display rule will mean a major change for B-MISC , where such orders have never been displayed . The president of the B-MISC , B-PER I-PER , was to hold a news conference Wednesday afternoon to elaborate on the new rules ' effects on the market , the second largest in the world . B-MISC CABINET APPROVES TELEVISION DECREE . B-LOC 1996-08-28 The B-MISC cabinet on Wednesday granted a reprieve for media mogul B-PER I-PER 's B-ORG television empire with a decree extending the current legal framework for television stations until January 31 , 1997 . The decree plugs a legal void in which magistrates could have forced the former prime minister to take one of the three stations he controls off the air because of a court ruling that no single proprietor should be allowed to keep three channels . Passengers injured in train collision in B-LOC . B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-28 A passenger train collided with a locomotive at a main railway station in B-LOC on Wednesday and police said around 10 people were injured . B-MISC television reported earlier that more than 20 had been hurt in the accident at the station in B-LOC , 300 km ( 180 miles ) west of B-LOC . " One locomotive was stationary and the passenger train collided into the back of it , " a police spokesman in B-LOC told B-ORG by telephone . The express passenger train travelling from B-LOC , southeast of B-LOC , with around 80 people on board , hit the back of a service locomotive used to shunt wagons into sidings . The police spokesman said he was not sure whether any more passengers were still trapped in the wreckage . Doctors and medical staff from a hospital across the road from the station were at the scene of the accident within minutes and were able to treat the injured quickly , he added . Greater damage was averted as the driver of the passenger train had time to apply his emergency brakes before the collision occurred , a state railways spokesman told B-MISC news agency B-ORG . B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG eyes hog market . B-LOC 1996-08-28 B-LOC 's largest grain handling firm said Wednesday it expects to forge a partnership with hog farmers by 1997 with a view to expanding the company 's scope into pork production . " B-LOC is well positioned to take advantage of growing world markets for pork , " B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG chief executive B-PER I-PER said in a company statement . B-ORG said it was analyzing potential partnerships with hog farmers and expected the first deal to be in place in 1997 . The end of B-LOC 's rail freight subsidy last year caused a shift in feed grain production to the eastern Prairie . Analysts said livestock production would likely shift to the eastern Prairie rather than feed grains being shipped to the western Prairie . B-ORG said it may develop pork production systems that provide farmers with large integrated units , and it may consider contracting programs between producers and packers which would operate within the existing hog market framework . B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG has an export monopoly but some B-LOC farmers earlier this month called for an open market in hogs . -- B-PER I-PER I-PER 204 947 3548 ATHLETICS - B-MISC I-MISC MEETING RESULTS . B-PER I-PER B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-28 B-LOC 's B-PER I-PER fulfilled his prediction that he would break the world 4,000 metres world record in the world track cycling championships on Wednesday . B-PER clocked four minutes 13.353 seconds to slice more than six seconds from the previous world mark of 4:19.699 set by B-MISC champion B-PER I-PER of B-LOC in B-LOC in July . B-PER qualified in second place , also beating his old record in 4:17.696 . " I was very nervous before the start but then I was amazed by the speed of my ride , " B-PER said . " I do n't know if I can go any faster . Who knows what will happen in the later stages ? " B-PER , 28 , did not contest the B-MISC pursuit because of its proximity to the B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC in which he led the B-MISC B-ORG team . However , he took a bronze medal in the B-MISC road time-trial and then returned home to prepare for the world track series in the B-LOC indoor velodrome . He adopted the " superman " riding position with arms at full stretch perfected by fellow B-MISC B-PER I-PER , the 1995 world champion , and taken up in B-LOC by B-PER . B-PER was forced to pull out of his title defence because of a viral infection . Qualifiers for Wednesday evening 's quarter-finals : 1. B-PER I-PER ( B-LOC ) 4:13.353 2. B-ORG 105-4 . At B-LOC : B-ORG 73-3 v B-ORG . SOCCER - B-PER AND B-PER OUT OF B-LOC SQUAD . B-LOC 1996-08-28 B-LOC soccer manager B-PER I-PER confirmed on Wednesday that the B-ORG pair of B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER would miss B-LOC 's B-MISC I-MISC qualifying match against B-LOC on Sunday . The two men , both suffering from back injuries , joined the B-LOC squad at training but it was soon clear they had no chance of making the flight to B-LOC on Friday . " They had some scans and X-rays yesterday and they 're out , " said B-PER . " The more important thing for me was to get them down here and have a chat . To go another five weeks without that chance would have been foolish , " he added . B-PER , who has already lost the services of midfielder B-PER I-PER and defender B-PER I-PER , delayed naming any replacements . There was also concern over injuries to B-PER I-PER , B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER . HORSE RACING - JOCKEY B-PER RECEIVES 21-DAY B-PER . B-LOC 1996-08-28 Leading rider B-PER I-PER received a 21-day ban from the disciplinary committee of the B-ORG I-ORG on Wednesday . B-PER had been reported after being found guilty of irresponsible riding at the provincial track of B-LOC 10 days ago . It was his fourth riding offence this season . Although five days of the ban were suspended until January 1 , B-PER will miss next month 's big B-ORG I-ORG meeting , including the ride on top stayer B-PER I-PER in the B-MISC I-MISC . B-PER shot to prominence in 1994 when he won the B-MISC B-MISC I-MISC on B-LOC I-LOC in his first ride in a classic . ROWING - B-PER MAY SEEK FIFTH B-MISC GOLD . B-LOC 1996-08-28 B-LOC 's B-PER I-PER said on Wednesday he might change his mind and go for a fifth consecutive B-MISC gold medal at the B-ORG I-ORG in B-LOC . B-PER is one of only five athletes who have won gold medals at four successive B-MISC . He shared victory with B-PER I-PER in the coxless pairs at the B-MISC I-MISC and said at the time that would be his last shot . But he has had second thoughts since then . " I 'm only 34 . Rowing is an endurance sport . " CRICKET - B-PER DISMISSES B-PER IN FIRST CLASS DEBUT . TENNIS - SERIOUS B-PER IS HAVING FUN AGAIN . B-PER I-PER B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-28 Outspoken B-PER I-PER exchanged his reputation as the clown prince of tennis on Wednesday for a new no-nonsense attitude that has made life on the courts fun again . " I think I 'm much more focused on what I have to do , and that 's playing tennis , " B-PER said after routing B-MISC B-PER I-PER 6-2 6-0 6-1 in the opening round of the B-MISC I-MISC . It was B-PER 's sixth victory in a row after winning his first tournament of the year last week at the B-MISC I-MISC . " I realised this year , that without putting 99.9 percent of your mind into tennis , I do n't think you can successful , " said the 22-year-old B-PER . " The whole day I 'm thinking abnout tennis . I felt that all the other things I was doing the years before , they were distracting me , they were not helping me at all . " For B-PER that meant confining his post-match comments to tennis and not going off on tirades about about peripheral issues such as the poor quality of food in the players lounge , an entertaining rant that took his mind off the task at hand . " I know what I 'm here for , " said B-PER , who lost in the second round of the B-MISC the last two years after reaching the quarters in 1993 , the same year he tried his hand as a restaurant critic . " I 'm not here to fight the press or talk about the food or entertain the people off the court . I 'm here to play tennis and to win . I have much less fun off the court . I have much more fun on the court , " he said . Just three years ago B-PER was one of the world 's best , with a ranking of six after reaching the B-MISC I-MISC semifinal and winning three tournaments . But B-PER 's ranking slowly began to drop last year as he struggled with a wrist injury . The B-MISC finally hit a low of 44th two months ago . " It 's somewhere where I would n't like to stay very long , " B-PER said of his current ranking of 36 . " It 's a part of the penalty that I have to accept . " As part of his new businesslike approach , B-PER hired B-MISC coach B-PER I-PER at the start of this year and the partnership is beginning to pay off . " At the beginning of the year we started from zero , " said B-PER . " Winning in B-LOC I-LOC ( last week ) was like winning for the first time . " While B-PER 's 77-minute romp past B-PER was rather ordinary , the fact that the two were playing each other was rather remarkable . In the original draw , B-PER and B-PER were slotted to play each other . When controversy forced the draw to be done over -- against odds of 151-to-1 -- B-PER and B-PER drew each other a second time . " When I saw the new draw I did n't have to change my preparation , " B-PER said . " I think it 's destined that it turned out for me . " TENNIS - WEDNESDAY 'S RESULTS FROM THE B-MISC I-MISC . B-PER I-PER B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-27 It was n't supposed to be this hard for defending champion B-PER I-PER to win her opening match at the B-MISC I-MISC on Tuesday night . But the script that called for the usual first-round demolition by the top-ranked top seed was rewritten by 29th-ranked B-MISC B-PER I-PER playing with nothing to lose abandon . B-PER , of course , prevailed 6-3 7-6 , but not before some tense moments that even had the B-MISC superstar thinking the match was going three sets . " I won the second set , which I did n't think I would do , being down 5-2 and the chances she had at 6-5 , " B-PER recalled . Several of the other women 's seeds eased into the second round with more typical B-MISC efficiency Tuesday . As afternoon turned to evening , fourth-seeded B-MISC B-PER I-PER took apart B-MISC B-PER I-PER in 58 minutes with the loss of just two games , one more than second seed B-PER I-PER , who opened the second-day programme by crushing B-MISC B-PER I-PER 6-0 6-1 . Third seed B-PER I-PER I-PER , the 1994 champion , and eighth-seeded B-MISC gold medalist B-PER I-PER dropped three game each en route to the second round . But the day was not without its seeded casualties on the women 's side . Fifth-seed B-PER I-PER of B-LOC was picked off by B-MISC B-PER I-PER and B-MISC semifinalist B-PER I-PER of B-LOC , the 10th seed , fell 6-2 7-5 to 53rd-ranked B-MISC B-PER I-PER . B-PER 's defeat left no other seeded players in B-PER 's quarter of the draw , which lost B-PER I-PER ( 6 ) and B-PER I-PER ( 12 ) on Monday . But B-PER , winner of 20 B-MISC I-MISC titles , was not about to join that list . " At some points I felt a little nervous , " she admitted . " When it came down to the important points , I felt more confident . " B-PER , a first-round loser here for the fifth consecutive year , was clearly going for winners , hitting the lines and running B-PER around the court as she broke the top seed twice in the second set to grab that shocking 5-2 lead . B-PER ran off the next three games to restore some semblance of order . But B-PER , her long black ponytail flying as she raced for shots , held her serve and twice had set point on B-PER 's serve at 6-5 before the B-MISC unleashed a forehand pass to force the tie-break . " I lost the moment , " lamented B-PER , who has reached the fourth round at B-LOC four times and was a semifinalist in B-LOC earlier this month . Still , the feisty B-MISC got off to a 3-0 lead in the tie-breaker before a pair of costly double faults gave B-PER her chance to avoid a third set . " Usually in the first one or two matches , you want to find your rhythm and want to get into it , " said B-PER , who won seven of the last eight points in the breaker . " To be in that situation today , a couple of times having to play well , get down and play point-by-point , definitely is a good start . " BASEBALL - B-PER HAS SURGERY , OUT UP TO SIX WEEKS . B-LOC 1996-08-27 B-ORG I-ORG right fielder B-PER I-PER underwent surgery on Monday to remove a fractured bone from his right hand and will miss four to six weeks , the club announced Tuesday . B-PER , a leading candidate for B-MISC I-MISC B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC honours , was injured August 20th when he was hit by a B-PER I-PER pitch in the first inning of an 8-1 victory over the B-ORG I-ORG . The 27-year-old B-PER leads the league with 40 homers and is tied for 10th with 100 B-MISC . B-LOC 1996-08-28 B-MISC striker B-PER scored a hat-trick as B-ORG I-ORG maintained their 100 percent record and stayed on top of the B-MISC first division with a 3-1 win at B-LOC on Wednesday . B-ORG 's main rivals for the title , defending champions B-ORG I-ORG , celebrated the novelty of having the roof of their new 51,000 seat stadium closed against the rain , with a 1-0 win over B-ORG I-ORG . B-ORG were missing six first-team players but B-PER I-PER I-PER shot home the winner from a 20-metre free kick in the 30th minute of a dull game . B-PER , signed in close season to replace compatriot B-PER who left to play for B-ORG , opened the B-ORG scoring in the 19th minute when he fired home after good work from B-PER I-PER . The B-MISC found the mark again two minutes after halftime and again in the 56th minute before midfielder B-PER I-PER scored a consolation goal for B-ORG five minutes from time . B-ORG I-ORG suffered an early shock when they went 1-0 down after four minutes against de B-ORG I-ORG . PRESS DIGEST - B-LOC - AUG 28 . B-LOC 1996-08-28 These are the leading stories in the B-MISC press on Wednesday . B-ORG has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy . B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG - B-PER I-PER , the B-LOC Under-Secretary of State for International Organisations , will on Wednesday continue his work in B-LOC visiting B-LOC , where he should be received by B-PER I-PER , leader of B-ORG . On Tuesday B-PER participated in a meeting of a joint-commission where he considered that the B-MISC politicians should advance faster and find a way to cooperate . In his opinion the quartering of B-ORG forces must be concluded in all the B-MISC territory and the troops must be selected and integrated in the armed forces , the government forces must be concentrated in the principal units and the free circulation of people and goods must be reality in all the country . B-MISC TRUTH BODY TO SUMMON APARTHEID POLICE . B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-28 B-LOC I-LOC 's B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG said on Wednesday it would subpoena persons accused of human rights violations to appear before it . " We can subpoena anyone we want to , even the president of the country , " spokesman B-PER I-PER told B-ORG . " Subpoenas are due to be served on a number of people this week . " Media reports have speculated that the commission , which is trying to heal the wounds of apartheid by confronting the past , could subpoena apartheid-era President B-PER I-PER and former police generals B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER . In submissions last week to the commission B-ORG I-ORG leader and former president B-PER I-PER I-PER said he had received no co-operation from B-PER in compiling his party 's report . Since it began work in April the commission has been hearing harrowing tales from the victims of apartheid-era abuses , by both the white minority regime and its opponents . It also wants to hear from those who committed the abuses , to whom it can offer amnesty in return for frankness . Hopes that reformed perpetrators would come forward voluntarily have faded but the commission has the legal power to force them to appear . B-PER declined to give say who would be subpoenaed . " At the moment we have a preliminary list of less than 10 people , but this is just the beginning , " he said . The commission was set up last year to probe 30 years of human-rights violations during the apartheid era . It is chaired by B-MISC I-MISC winner , retired Archbishop B-PER I-PER . B-PER said the commission could announce the names of subpoenaed persons on Monday next week . B-MISC AIRPLANE LANDS IN B-LOC ON BOMB THREAT . B-LOC 1996-08-28 A B-MISC airliner on flight from B-LOC to B-LOC on Wednesday landed in emergency at B-LOC airport after receiving a bomb threat , said an airport official . " The plane landed at B-LOC airport at 1503 ( 1203 B-MISC ) after receiving a signal that there is an explosive on board , " the official , who declined to be named told B-ORG . The plane , surrounded by 11 fire-engines , is being checked for explosives at the moment . Nothing has been found so far , added the official . In March a B-MISC I-MISC airliner hijacked while on a flight from northern B-LOC to B-LOC landed in B-LOC airport to refuel before landing in B-LOC , where the hijacker was arrested . B-ORG B-LOC well tests 1,100 bbl / day . B-LOC I-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-28 B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG said Wednesday an exploratory well in B-LOC 's B-LOC area tested in excess of 1,100 barrels daily and will begin production immediately . The company said the 90 percent owned B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC logged 28 feet of productive B-LOC I-LOC at 5,350 feet . Reserve estimates from this well are at 250,000 gross barrels of oil . The B-LOC well is one of the prospects developed by B-ORG through its early 1996 purchase of B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , the company said . It said another , the B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC , has logged 128 feet of productive B-LOC I-LOC at 5,400 feet and is flowing water free at the rate of 590 barrels of oil per day on a 15 / 64ths-inch choke . B-ORG owns a 16 percent working interest in this well with most of the rest held by the privately owned operator . B-ORG said full production has begun and initial estimates of gross reserves attributable to this well range up to one million barrels of oil . A third well drilled in this area , the B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC , encountered the B-LOC I-LOC but tested wet . At the company 's B-MISC prospect , the B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC , has reached total depth in the B-LOC I-LOC at approximately 3,800 feet and has been abandoned , B-ORG said . It said this acreage earning well brought an interest in an additional 5,120 acres , building the company 's gross land position in this area to 8,320 acres . At the B-MISC prospect , the B-MISC I-MISC has reached total depth of 11,500 and has logged 278 feet of B-LOC I-LOC . Testing has begun and results will be announced within the next several days , B-ORG said . Including the costs of the two abandoned wells , the company said , these first prospects have added to reserves at a finding cost of about B-LOC $ 2 per barrel of oil equivalent . -- B-PER I-PER 212-859-1710 . B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-28 Average daily shipments from B-LOC copper service centers in July fell three percent from the previous month , but were higher than in July 1995 , the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG reported . " July was still above the historic average for that month , " the B-ORG said . In the first seven months of 1996 , shipments of copper sheet , coil and strip were 2.2 percent ahead of the same period last year . Alloy shipments , however , were 7.5 percent down . B-LOC lowers noise limits for three B-LOC airports . B-LOC 1996-08-28 The B-MISC government on Wednesday lowered the noise limits for B-LOC 's B-LOC , B-LOC and B-LOC airports and announced it would make a bigger effort in detecting and fining violators . The limits , effective from January 1 , 1997 , are reduced as much as possible while still complying with international obligations , a spokesman for the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG said . The maximum noise level during the day is trimmed by three decibels to 94 , while the night time level is reduced by two decibels to 87 . " It is a smaller reduction in terms of loudness than was sought by local people . Nevertheless I am satisfied that the overall benefits will be worthwile , " Lord B-PER , minister for aviation , said in a statement . The ministry said it believed the new limits could be met with existing aircraft . " They can be flown in quieter ways , " a spokesman said . The reduction in noise levels is the same as proposed in a consultation paper which was published in October 1995 . The present noise levels have applied at B-LOC , one of the world 's busiest airports , since 1959 and at B-LOC since 1968 . The number of monitors will be increased and some will be repositioned to detect noisy planes . -- B-ORG I-ORG +44 171 542 7717 Tennis - B-PER beats B-PER in B-MISC I-MISC . B-LOC launches war on fictitious civil servants . B-LOC 1996-08-28 B-LOC launched a drive on Wednesday to rid the civil service payroll of fictitious workers as part of new prime minister B-PER I-PER 's campaign to cut government spending . Deputy Minister for Finance B-PER I-PER said teams of inspectors would check government offices in the capital and the provinces to root out civil servants who drew salaries but had left their jobs , were dead , or had never existed . Some 50 million B-MISC francs ( $ 50,000 ) has been pumped into the exercise to deter the inspectors from taking bribes . B-PER told reporters the annual wage bill of 171 billion B-MISC francs represented 50 percent of current state expenditure , " whereas the acceptable proportion in countries similar to ours is one third " . B-PER , who took office last month , has said he plans to cut public service spending by 30 percent by the end of the year as part of measures to revive the economy . B-LOC is rich in minerals and has a vast potential for hydroelectric power generation but it faces stiff competition from its B-MISC I-MISC neighbours for foreign investment . B-ORG was the loser of the day with prices closing at $ 0.300 , down from $ 0.355 on Tuesday and $ 0.445 on Monday . B-PER said uncertainty about when B-ORG would issue B-MISC and about whether shares from the B-MISC market could be converted into B-MISC had hurt prices . " B-MISC investors ... will be investing in B-MISC and I do not think people in B-LOC will be able to come up with the money for the underlying shares to drive the B-MISC shares to those levels , " B-PER said . B-ORG has also tightened the rules restricting shareholers ' rights to trade its shares . B-MISC recover 75 pct of confiscated land . B-LOC 1996-08-28 B-LOC has restored ownership rights to pre-communist private owners of 75 percent of the arable land or around four million hectares , an B-ORG I-ORG official said on Wednesday . " So far 75 percent has been returned with the land restitution almost completed in some regions like B-LOC I-LOC but lagging behind in other areas , predominantly in the mountains , " the official told a news conference . The ministry has said that it planned to return 96.6 percent of the arable land or 5.2 million hectares to its original owners by the end of this year . A land reform act passed four years ago abolished B-MISC collective farms , allowing the return of 5.4 million hectares to original owners or their heirs . -- B-ORG I-ORG , ( ++359-2 ) 981 8569 B-MISC chancellor to meet B-PER Sept 7 - B-ORG . Exiled B-MISC protest confusing voting rules . B-PER I-PER B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-28 B-MISC refugees in B-LOC , the first to vote last weekend in their country 's first post-war election , found the rules confusing and some had no idea who they voted for , refugees and officials said on Wednesday . " For the most part they really did n't understand what was going on , " the director of the B-LOC camp B-PER I-PER told B-ORG on Wednesday . " It was confusing , they had no experience of voting , many of the refugees are only semi-literate and none of them knew anything about the candidates , " he said . " They just voted along ethnic lines where they could . " The B-MISC election is set for September 14 and voting began on Wednesday for most of the 600,000 B-MISC living abroad . The B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , which is running the election , allowed the ballot to be held on Sunday in four B-MISC refugee camps . Some B-MISC refugees among the 385 registered voters B-LOC 's largest camp B-LOC have written to the B-ORG complaining that they were unable to vote in contests for the president or assembly of the B-LOC I-LOC , where most B-MISC live . This was because their pre-war homes are now in the B-MISC territory , so they were voting for the national assembly of the B-LOC I-LOC , most of the candidates for which are B-MISC . For the foreign powers which back last year 's B-LOC peace agreement , the main point of the election rules is that by voting as though they were still in their pre-war homes , B-MISC should override the effects of ethnic cleansing and reassert the concept of a single multi-ethnic state . But B-PER I-PER , one of the refugees who signed the letter of complaint , told B-ORG : " We only realised after voting that we were being denied the rights of other B-MISC I-MISC to choose our president . This vote seals the division of my country . " Under the election rules citizens vote for a three-man presidency and B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG for all B-LOC and for assemblies and cantonal seats in either the B-LOC I-LOC or the B-LOC I-LOC . On Sunday voters in B-LOC also cast ballots for municipal councils but these will be invalidated following the cancellation of local elections by the B-ORG on Tuesday . B-PER I-PER , who also signed the letter , alleged that elderly voters were directed who to vote for by B-MISC translators who stood in the polling booth to help them . " Probably 100 refugees were shown where to put their cross , " he said . Seventy eight-year-old B-PER I-PER , a B-MISC I-MISC who has spent the last five years in B-LOC , told B-ORG she had cast her ballot because she 'd been told to by the camp authorities but had no idea who she voted for . " At first the organisers would n't let anyone help me but when they saw I did n't understand a young translator ringed the names I had to mark , " she said . " I do n't know who I voted for . " B-PER I-PER of the B-MISC office organising the elections on behalf of the B-ORG told B-ORG on Wednesday her office was studying the letter but said they had followed B-ORG instructions very carefully . " The envelopes , each with the five different voting slips , were sealed until voting and had written instructions on how to vote , " she said . " But of course those who could not read had to be shown . " B-LOC presidential race next round on Sept 20 . B-LOC 1996-08-28 B-LOC will hold the next round of an inconclusive state presidential race on September 20 , parliamentary officers of the B-MISC state ruled on Wednesday . This comes after three votes in the 101-strong parliament on Monday and Tuesday failed to give either incumbent B-PER I-PER or rival candidate B-PER I-PER the necessary 68 votes for a clear mandate . The outcome was a rebuff for B-PER , failing three times to win backing in his bid for a second term as head of state of the former B-MISC republic . Parliament 's press officer told B-ORG that Speaker B-PER I-PER will convene an electoral college involving 101 MPs and and 273 local government representatives on September 20 . Both B-PER , 67 , and B-PER , 68 will automatically be listed as candidates but the election will also be open to new nominations with the backing of any 21 members of the college . The winner has to secure a majority from the college within two rounds of voting otherwise the election will go back before the parliament . B-PER likely to fail on B-LOC - B-MISC minister . B-PER , who has arranged a military truce with separatist rebels in the southern B-LOC region , was in B-LOC this week seeking support for a deal on B-LOC 's political status . But B-MISC President B-PER I-PER has seemed unwilling to meet his envoy and went on holiday on Monday . He also reportedly criticised B-MISC Foreign Minister B-PER I-PER , saying his style of work resembled that of the B-MISC 1970s and 1980s . B-LOC state budget soars in June . B-LOC 1996-08-28 B-LOC 's state budget deficit jumped sharply in June to 1,242.9 billion lei for the January-June period from 596.5 billion lei in January-May , official data showed on Wednesday . Six-month expenditures stood at 9.50 trillion lei , up from 7.56 trillion lei at end-May , with education and health spending accounting for 31.6 percent of state expenses and economic subsidies and support taking some 26 percent . January-June revenues went up to 8.26 trillion lei from 6.96 trillion lei in the first five months this year . B-LOC 's government is expected to revise the 1996 budget on Wednesday to bring it into line with higher inflation , new wage and pension indexations and costs of energy imports that have pushed up the state deficit . Under the revised version state spending is expected to rise by some 566 billion lei . No new deficit forecast has been issued so far . In July the government gave a 6.0-percent wage and pension indexation to cover energy , fuel and bread price increases , which quickened inflation to 7.5 percent last month . In the original state budget , approved in March , revenues were envisaged at around 16.98 trillion lei and expenditures 20.17 trillion lei for 1996 . The state budget deficit was originally forecast to be 3.19 trillion lei for the whole year . On Wednesday , the leu 's official rate was 3,161 to the dollar . -- B-ORG I-ORG 40-1 3120264 B-LOC I-LOC says B-MISC pair kidnapped by B-MISC . " We 've got an international problem and I 'm prepared to use our military might . We want to stop drugs at the border , " he said . B-PER I-PER , who said local and state governments cannot fight illegal drugs alone . " We need all the help we can get . B-LOC 1996-08-28 Profit taking continued to weigh on B-ORG lumber futures but prices ended only slightly lower as strong cash markets underpinned futures , traders said . The same pattern of the past few days persisted with futures declining early on the profit taking before firming late . There was cash-related buying late from people who want to take delivery of the September contract , they said . Cash sources noted that although the cash market is generally quiet , prices remain firm on demand for prompt delivery wood , they added . Random Lengths quoted cash spruce at $ 419 per tbf , up $ 5 from last Friday and $ 7 over the last midweek quote . Reduced concern over Hurricane B-MISC prompted some of the early profit taking . Expectations the storm would turn more to the north partly eased concerns , they said . Lumber closed $ 2.20 to $ 0.20 per tbf lower with September off $ 0.70 at $ 413.20 and November off most at $ 369.00 per tbf . -- B-PER I-PER 312-408-8725 WHEAT--Rains boost B-LOC HRW planting prospects . B-PER I-PER B-LOC I-LOC , B-LOC . 1996-08-28 Above-normal summer rainfall in the B-LOC B-LOC I-LOC has produced near-ideal conditions for planting the 1997 hard red winter wheat crop , analysts said Wednesday . From central B-LOC north to B-LOC , rains throughout July and August have relieved most of the drought conditions that plagued the region earlier this year . " Our moisture situation is excellent , especially for fall planting of winter wheat , " said B-PER I-PER , extension wheat marketing economist at B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . The irony of the above-average summer rainfall was not lost on B-LOC I-LOC wheat producers , who only three months ago were caught in a drought so severe that old-timers likened conditions to the " B-MISC I-MISC " days of the 1930s . " It 's definitely a turnabout from this past year , but you know last year we had pretty good moisture about this time of year , and then about October 1 it quit , " said B-PER I-PER , executive director of the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . " Hopefully that 's not going to happen this year . " According to figures released by the B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC , an average of 20.19 inches fell across the state between March 1 and August 26 , 1996 . That 's about 1/2 inch above the average for the same time period , according to B-PER I-PER , associate state climatologist at the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . He noted that the majority of that 20.19 inches had fallen since July . As an example of just how dry it was , data showed that between October 1 , 1995 and March 1 , 1996 , the state received an average of only 4.6 inches of rainfall . In northern B-LOC , the current rainfall situation was similar to most of B-LOC , said B-PER I-PER , executive assistant for the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . " Up here in the B-LOC I-LOC , we 've had some extremely beneficial rains that came through within the last several days and are really setting us up for ideal conditions for planting wheat , " B-PER said . But he warned that the situation was not as ideal in central and southern B-LOC , where mositure levels were still short despite the rains brought by Hurricane B-MISC last week . In B-LOC , typically the number one B-LOC hard red winter wheat producer , topsoil moisture levels were rated mostly adequate during the week ended Sunday , according to the state 's agricultural statistics service . In its weekly report released Monday , the service said B-LOC topsoil moisture was rated eight percent surplus , 77 percent adequate and 15 percent short to very short . B-LOC 's B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG showed similar conditions , rating topsoil moisture levels as seven percent surplus , 81 percent adequate and 12 percent short to very short . The bank is a division of B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . The bank said most of the charges resulted from loan portfolios from banks and thrifts that were acquired in the 1980s . B-ORG I-ORG said it has discontinued B-MISC as an element of its motor vehicle or boat installment loan contracts . B-PER I-PER B-ORG I-ORG 1996-08-28 B-LOC 's ambassador on Wednesday lashed out at economic sanctions imposed by B-MISC states and said any thought of an arms embargo would be a windfall for guerrillas fighting his army-run government . In a lengthy debate on B-LOC before the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , Ambassador B-PER I-PER said the new military government took over to stabilise the country and wanted negotiations under former B-MISC President B-PER I-PER . Nearly every B-MISC member who spoke , as well as most B-ORG I-ORG members , however , were unsympathetic towards the government of President B-PER I-PER , an army major put in power in a July coup by the B-MISC military , which is locked in a guerrilla war with the majority B-MISC . " These ( B-MISC ) brothers should have been the first to bind the wounds of B-LOC , " B-PER said of the economic embargo . " Quite the contrary , B-LOC has seen economic war declared against it by fellow B-MISC people ... a gratuitous immolation of the people of B-LOC . " He said his government had just asked B-ORG human rights monitors to increase their numbers in B-LOC in an effort " to put an end to this vicious circle of violence . " More than 150,000 people have been killed in violence between the minority B-MISC and the majority B-MISC since 1993 . B-LOC 's envoy , B-PER I-PER , said coups should be relegated " to the dump heap of history " as there could be no justification for the overthrow of a legitimate government . B-LOC has proposed a resolution , still under discussion , that would impose an immediate arms embargo on B-LOC and call for negotiations . The draft suggests further sanctions against those who impede a political solution . Among the council 's five permanent members , B-LOC and the B-LOC I-LOC appeared to support most elements of the B-MISC proposal , while B-LOC , B-LOC and B-LOC were cautious . B-PER , a B-MISC , said any arms embargo would leave the army unable to defend itself against B-MISC guerrillas and leave the population exposed to " armed terroritsts . " But B-MISC Ambassador B-PER I-PER said : " Every weapon that reached B-LOC is a weapon aimed mainly at killing an unarmed civilian . We must not send a signal different from the B-MISC leaders themselves . Inaction is becoming the worst possible course of action . " B-LOC 's parliament has been suspended and political parties are banned but B-PER told reporters B-PER would reconvene a new type of national assembly in October . The B-LOC I-LOC said the coup leaders had taken no steps to restore democracy and indiscriminate killings continued . Ambassador B-PER I-PER said the new government should have " unconditional " negotiations with all parties inside and outside of the country . He said B-LOC strongly supported the economic sanctions imposed already and if these did not work the council would consider " an arms embargo or targeted sanctions against faction leaders . " But he said the international community had to be prepared for the worst and avoid a replay of the horrors in neighbouring B-LOC , where widespread genocide broke out against the B-MISC two years ago . B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-28 About 8,000 protesters marched through B-LOC on Wednesday demanding the removal of B-MISC Prime Minister B-PER I-PER , witnesses said . " From here we will march to B-LOC and by B-PER we will not let B-PER and ( B-PER 's husband B-PER I-PER ) B-PER escape justice , " B-PER I-PER , leader of the main opposition B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG told a rally organised by a 16-party alliance . B-PER accused B-PER of corruption and nepotism , charges she has denied in the past . Witnesses said protesters carrying colourful party flags walked for several miles , chanting anti-government slogans . The event was part of an opposition campaign launched on August 14 , B-LOC 's independence day . B-PER said similar rallies would be held in the B-LOC provincial capital B-LOC and the B-LOC provincial capital B-LOC before an opposition march on the capital B-LOC . " I promise the people of B-LOC that those responsible for the extra-judicial killing of innocent youths would not be spared , " B-PER said . B-LOC 's ethnic B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) accuses the government of killing many of its militants in cold blood . The government has denied the charge and blames the B-ORG for much of the violence that killed 2,000 people in the city last year . Political observers said the turn-out was disappointing for a city of about 12 million people , possibly indicating that the B-ORG , although a member of the opposition alliance , had not mobilised its supporters for the event . The turbulent southern port has been calmer this year , but police say more than 300 people have died in political unrest . The B-ORG speaks for B-MISC I-MISC who migrated from B-LOC at B-LOC in 1947 and their descendants . B-PER , a former prime minister , is the main political rival of B-PER , who defeated him in the October 1993 election . He said only the removal of the government and an early election could save B-LOC from disaster . " We will dislodge the B-PER government . It is a holy war for us , " he said . B-PER has vowed to complete her five-year term . B-LOC B-ORG Apr-Jul ' 96 sales , output up . B-LOC 1996-08-28 B-LOC 's leading cement firm B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) said on Wednesday its cement sales rose to 3.1 million tonnes in April-July 1996 from 2.93 million a year ago . B-ORG Chairman B-PER I-PER told shareholders at the firm 's annual meeting cement output rose to 3.14 million tonnes in the first quarter of 1996/97 ( April-March ) , from 3.01 million a year ago . B-PER said B-ORG had secured government approval to take over a sick cement firm with a grinding capacity of 275,000 tonnes per year . " We will take it over early next month , " he said . Talking about the cement industry in general , B-PER said B-MISC production rose by about 10 percent in 1995/96 . " The industry saw capacity expansion of about 13 percent over 1994/95 from 77.79 million tonnes to 87.45 million tonnes , " B-PER told shareholders . He said B-MISC cement exports dropped about eight percent from the previous year because of stiff international competition and inadequate infrastructural facilities . B-ORG 's own export performance was marginally better than in 1994/95 on account of a 36 percent rise in exports to B-LOC and the opening of a new market - B-LOC I-LOC , he said . Despite power shortages , B-ORG achieved a satisfactory growth in production during the year with the help of its power plants . B-ORG sold 9.4 million tonnes in 1995/96 , retaining its top position in the B-MISC cement industry , B-PER said . -- B-LOC newsroom +91-22-265 9000 B-LOC bank sanctions $ 6.5 mln loan to B-LOC B-ORG . B-PER I-PER B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-28 B-MISC fishermen said on Wednesday they had been forced at gunpoint to ferry refugees fleeing the ethnic war in B-LOC I-LOC to B-LOC , as a protest strike by more than 30,000 fishermen entered its ninth day . " There is little we can do when at mid-sea . The B-ORG ( B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ) accosts us and , at the point of a gun , forces us to take refugees , " said senior fishermen leader B-PER I-PER . Some 850 refugees have landed in recent weeks at the port of B-LOC in the southern B-MISC state of B-LOC I-LOC , home to 50 million B-MISC people , port officials say . B-LOC is 15 km ( 10 miles ) off the coast of B-LOC I-LOC . State chief minister B-PER I-PER has publicly welcomed the refugees , who are fleeing the 13-year war between B-MISC separatists and government troops that B-LOC says has cost 50,000 lives . But the influx has triggered fears of a repeat of the 1980s when some 200,000 refugees landed in B-LOC I-LOC . Intelligence officals said more than 5,000 B-MISC were waiting on the western coast of B-LOC I-LOC to cross into B-LOC . The B-MISC government has warned its fishermen that their boats would be impounded if they were caught ferrying refugees . The fishermen went on strike last week to protest the government 's cancellation of three trawlers ' fishing licenses after the boats were caught carrying B-MISC refugees . B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG secretary B-PER I-PER said the strike would continue indefinitely and the fishermen would block road and rail traffic if their demands were not met . " Until the government releases our boats from naval custody and B-MISC I-MISC naval custody , and gives us assurance ( it will not revoke licences of boats ferrying refugees ) , we will not call off our strike , " B-PER said . B-ORG spokesmen could not immediately be reached for comment , but B-MISC I-MISC fishermen denied that B-MISC were being coerced into carrying refugees across the B-LOC I-LOC . " B-MISC fishermen come right up to B-LOC to fish , and when refugees request them to ferry them across , they readily oblige . Only some take money , " B-MISC I-MISC boatman B-PER said . B-PER denied the fishermen charged the refugees for passage to B-LOC and said it was unfair to penalise them for the refugees ' arrival . " We have not gone to sea since August 19 , but refugees are arriving daily nevertheless . How could we alone be held responsible for the influx ? " he said . An B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG official said the government planned to urge fishermen not to cross the international boundary between B-LOC and B-LOC I-LOC , but admitted this would be hard to enforce because of B-LOC I-LOC 's pomfret-rich waters . B-PER I-PER B-LOC 1996-08-28 A firm start on B-LOC I-LOC helped push leading B-LOC shares to a new record high on Wednesday and B-MISC stocks closed floor trading up but the B-LOC bourse slipped sharply , hit by a weakening franc and fears of industrial unrest . On the foreign exchange markets , a survey indicating weaker than expected B-MISC business sentiment boosted the dollar in early trading but it failed to build on its gains against the yen and slipped lower against the mark in quiet afternoon trade . B-LOC shares , boosted by B-LOC I-LOC , added to early gains with the blue chip B-MISC I-MISC index hitting a new peak of 3921.8 before dropping back slightly . One focus was B-ORG I-ORG , which rebounded after fears faded that the cancellation of " open skies " talks between the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG and the B-MISC government may jeopardise its tie-up with B-ORG I-ORG . The conclusion of an open skies agreement had been made a prerequisite of the proposed link-up by the B-LOC . Better-than-expected B-MISC trade figures had little impact on equities . The B-MISC July trade deficit totalled 506 million sterling ( $ 788 million ) while June 's world deficit was 1.12 billion pounds . Forecasts were for deficits of 900 million sterling and 1.4 billion sterling . B-MISC shares shed some gains on profit-taking but nonetheless ended the floor session higher buoyed by demand for chemical stocks and a stable dollar . The 30-share B-MISC index closed at 2,563.16 points , up 4.32 . However , B-MISC stocks extended opening losses to more than one percent in morning trading , falling through the 2000 point resistance level on the main B-MISC index . Dealers blamed a weakening franc and worries about the 1997 budget and possible autumn strikes B-PER I-PER , leader of B-LOC 's B-MISC B-ORG union , criticised government plans for spending cuts in the 1997 budget on Wednesday and warned of labour unrest as B-LOC gets back to work after the holidays . Later in the day , helped by the firmer B-LOC I-LOC opening , B-LOC climbed back to the 2000 level but still remained well into negative territory . In foreign exchange the dollar was trading at around 108.40 yen in the B-MISC afternoon , up from its B-MISC close on Tuesday of 107.55 but off the day 's highs . It had been boosted overnight by the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG 's quarterly corporate survey , or " tankan " , of major manufacturers -- an important gauge of business sentiment . The unexpectedly weak figures convinced markets that B-MISC interest rates would stay at rock-bottom levels -- weakening the yen . The B-MISC discount rate is currently at a record low of 0.5 percent . The B-ORG sought to put the best face on the data which defied economists ' predictions of improving sentiment and was the first decline in business sentiment in a year . A B-ORG spokesman said " the doors to the recovery have not been shut ... the recovery is still continuing . " These remarks gave the yen some backbone and the dollar failed to progress further . " The dollar 's gains were less than spectacular , suggesting that while it 's likely to benefit from revised B-MISC rate expectations , a breakout from the established trading range does n't appear likely , " said currency economist B-PER I-PER . Dealers said shares were also affected by a slippage in bond prices due to lower than expected June industrial production , showing the economy was still faltering .
