" What happened concerning continuous violations and crimes from this new B-MISC leadership means they are declaring a state of war against the B-MISC people , " B-PER told the B-MISC legislature . Accusing B-MISC Prime Minister B-PER I-PER of stupidity , B-PER launched his strongest attack on the right-wing government since its election in May . The tirade was sparked by B-LOC 's announcement on Tuesday of plans to expand the B-MISC settlement of B-LOC I-LOC and its demolishing of a community centre in B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC . " B-LOC has started the war on B-LOC . They are idiots to have started the B-LOC battle , " B-PER said in B-MISC . " There will be no B-MISC state without B-LOC . B-PER should know he is stupid to have started this battle . " B-PER called for a general strike " for B-LOC " on Thursday in all of the B-LOC I-LOC and B-LOC I-LOC . There has not been a joint shutdown there since May 1994 when B-MISC troops began withdrawing under an interim self-rule agreement signed in 1993 . The strike will have little effect on the B-MISC economy while hurting B-MISC merchants in B-LOC I-LOC and B-LOC who cater to the tourist trade . Some 25,000 B-MISC labourers are likely to stay away from their jobs , mainly in construction , in B-LOC . But B-MISC , once the backbone of the building industry , have been largely replaced by labourers from B-LOC and B-LOC . " On Friday , all B-MISC , including B-MISC in B-LOC ... will go to ( B-LOC 's ) B-LOC mosque and pray . B-MISC and B-MISC who do not pray should accompany them and stand behind them , " B-PER said . Officials in B-PER 's office were not immediately available for comment on B-PER 's remarks . B-MISC travel restrictions , imposed after bombings by B-MISC militants in February and March , ban most of the two million B-MISC in the B-LOC I-LOC and B-LOC from entering B-LOC . B-PER , who opposes trading occupied land for peace , made B-LOC a central issue in his election campaign , accusing B-ORG Prime Minister B-PER I-PER of planning to hand control of the B-MISC eastern part of the city to the B-MISC . B-LOC captured B-LOC I-LOC in the 1967 B-LOC I-LOC war and claims both halves of the city as its capital . The B-ORG wants B-LOC I-LOC as the capital of a future B-MISC state . In his speech to the crowded legislature , B-PER signalled he was not abandoning diplomacy although " alarm bells are ringing " . He unexpectedly broke off his address to take a telephone call from B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC envoy B-PER I-PER , who held talks in B-LOC on Tuesday with B-MISC and B-MISC officials . When B-PER returned to the podium , he said senior B-ORG negotiator B-PER I-PER , better known as B-PER I-PER , and B-PER aide B-PER I-PER could meet on Thursday . He quoted B-PER as telling him : " The important thing is the B-MISC are prepared to move . " B-PER said he replied : " is this like their previous promises ? " " No , they have good intentions , " B-PER quoted B-PER as saying . B-MISC have been pressing B-LOC to carry out a long-delayed partial troop pullout from the flashpoint B-LOC I-LOC city of B-LOC agreed by the previous B-ORG government . The B-MISC government is studying redeployment plans submitted by Defence Minister B-PER I-PER which are likely to demand a wider than agreed army presence in B-LOC . B-LOC 1996-08-27 Former B-LOC B-MISC Gov . B-PER I-PER has decided not to endorse B-PER I-PER as the presidential candidate of the B-ORG I-ORG , B-ORG reported late Tuesday . B-ORG quoted aides and family members as saying B-PER , who competed with B-PER to head the ticket for B-PER 's party , had told them he would definitely not endorse B-PER , but they did not know whether he would endorse another candidate . An announcement was planned in B-LOC Wednesday . B-PER , 60 , is a three-term B-LOC governor who left office in 1987 and vied for the B-ORG I-ORG nomination after becoming disillusioned with both the B-MISC and B-MISC parties . B-PER is a friend of President B-PER and supported him in the 1992 election . B-PER won his party 's official nomination as its presidential candidate in a secret ballot earlier this month . B-PER I-PER B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-27 B-LOC investors in troubled B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG were considering late on Tuesday whether to appeal a B-LOC court decision in favour of B-ORG I-ORG and pledged to continue pursuing other legal actions . A B-LOC appeals court on Tuesday gave B-ORG I-ORG a reprieve , throwing out an injunction that the insurance giant said could have led to its collapse . A lower court issued the injunction on Friday and ordered B-ORG I-ORG to give investors , known as B-MISC , more information before requiring them to decide whether to accept a settlement offer as part of a reorganisation plan . " My prediction is that the B-MISC will appeal , " said B-PER I-PER , a B-LOC B-MISC and a chief negotiator for the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . " At this point , it is a sufficiently important decision that I 'm confident that they will appeal , " he said . " But to say that they definitely will would be premature until we determine what the exact basis for the court 's ruling is . " Under the reorganisation plan , B-ORG I-ORG plans to reinsure its massive liabilities into a new company called B-ORG . The arrangement calls for investors to make additional payments to fund B-ORG but also provides them with 3.2 billion stg in compensation to help reduce their prior outstanding liabilities . The B-MISC had been scheduled to decide whether to accept or reject the offer by 1100 B-MISC Wednesday , but B-ORG I-ORG chairman B-PER I-PER said on Tuesday the offer would be extended . At least eight B-LOC states have still some form of litigation pending , said B-PER I-PER , spokesman for the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG State Chairmen , a group representing B-LOC B-MISC . " It goes without saying that we 're rather disappointed , " B-PER said of the decision by the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG for the B-ORG I-ORG , sitting in B-LOC . But , he said , " we still have hope that somebody is going to see our point of view in this . " The B-LOC attorney general told B-ORG I-ORG last week it was considering a new legal action against the B-MISC insurance market , based on allegations of consumer fraud . " We have notified them of our concerns and asked them to give us a response , " said B-LOC attorney general B-PER I-PER . B-PER said she was concerned that the B-ORG I-ORG agreement immunizes it from future litigation regarding B-ORG and requires that all legal actions be heard outside of B-LOC . In addition , she said she was concerned the plan may not offer investors enough protection from additional , future liabilities . Meanwhile , an appeal of a lawsuit filed by some 600 B-MISC in B-LOC is still pending before the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG for the B-ORG I-ORG , B-PER of the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG said . That lawsuit , which seeks rescision and restitution , was dismissed in a B-LOC district court . That case " is what I call the most significant alternate remedy for us , " B-PER said . The individual B-MISC , however , now must decide whether to accept B-ORG I-ORG settlement offer or reject the offer and pursue litigation . B-PER said he has advised B-MISC that " they must make , individually , a risk benefit analysis . " Rejection involved forfeiting the compensation offer and risking the possibility of owing B-ORG I-ORG two to three times more than B-ORG I-ORG is now willing to accept , he said . But , in rejecting the offer , the B-MISC would retain their rights to pursue litigation , he said . B-MISC police made B-MISC gestures , officials say . B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-28 B-MISC riot police made B-MISC gestures at a private function earlier this month and may face dismissal for their actions , the B-MISC B-ORG I-ORG said on Wednesday . The ministry declined to detail gestures the B-MISC policemen had made at the August 13 function but added seven had been suspended from duty pending an internal inquiry . A spokesman for public prosecutors in the southern city , where dictator B-PER I-PER held some of his most infamous B-MISC party rallies in the 1930s , said there were no plans to prosecute the officers as the gestures had not been made in public . Gun-wielding motorist snapped by cool passenger . B-LOC 1996-08-28 A motorist threatened a fellow driver with a starting pistol as he overtook him illegally in the inside lane on a motorway near B-LOC and was photographed in the act by the driver 's wife , prosecutors said on Wednesday . Prosecutors in the city of B-LOC said the 32-year-old man drew alongside the other car at about 110 kph ( 70 mph ) and aimed his pistol at the driver . But the driver 's wife kept her nerve , got out her camera and photographed him . The man has been charged with dangerous driving , coercion and threatening behaviour . B-MISC prosecutors file sex tourism charges . B-LOC 1996-08-28 B-LOC prosecutors said on Wednesday they had filed charges against two B-MISC men for sexually abusing children in B-LOC and distributing pornographic films and pictures of their degrading acts . The case is one of only a handful in which authorities have managed to track down suspects under a law which lets them pursue B-MISC who commit sex offences abroad . The pair , identified only as 43-year-old clerk B-PER I-PER and businessman B-PER I-PER , 33 , are alleged to have carried out acts of sexual indecency with children as young as 10 years old between 1994 and 1995 . Their videos included pictures of one of the accused tying up a B-MISC boy and performing acts of sadistic torture on him , prosecutors said in a statement . In another scene , a young girl performed oral sex with an unidentified adult man . The new law was introduced with much fanfare in 1993 . But prosecutors face huge difficulties in gathering evidence and bringing witnesses to testify in a B-MISC court , and only one person has so far been convicted under the law . Investigators are probing several other cases . The B-LOC prosecutors said they had been alerted to the two men by customs officials who intercepted packages containing pornographic photographs and order forms . B-MISC tomato warriors paint the town red . B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-28 Revellers painted the town red on Wednesday as the 1996 edition of the world 's biggest tomato fight began in the eastern B-MISC village of B-LOC . Thousands of people pelted each other with armfuls of ripe tomatoes as streets , walls and windows were coated in a blood-red wash . A single firework after midday signalled the start of the fruit-throwing frenzy , during which participants hurl some 100 tonnes of tomatoes trucked in for the occasion . Local historians say the tradition began in 1945 when disgruntled locals began spontaneously to bombard the priest and mayor at the annual fiesta in B-LOC ( pronounced B-LOC ) . The festival 's fame has grown and now attracts between 15,000 and 20,000 people , many of them foreigners . PRESS DIGEST - B-LOC - AUG 28 . " The directors report that negotiations with the vendors of B-ORG I-ORG are proceeding and they expect an agreement ( conditional on shareholder approval ) will be signed next week , " B-ORG said in a statement . -- B-ORG I-ORG +44 171 542 7717 B-LOC bills gain ground after see-saw session . B-LOC 1996-08-28 0515 B-MISC The B-LOC I-LOC money market gained slightly at Wednesday 's close after what dealers described as a see-saw trading session . Ninety-day bank bill rates shed five points to 9.93 percent and September bank bill futures rose four to 90.18 . However , bonds finished largely flat . " Our bonds were better bid initially but they sold off on a lack of demand , and the short end went with it too on a lower currency . " There were big buyers at the base of where the market sold to , and when the currency got bought back on talk of a samurai the market got bought back again , " a dealer said . Volumes were reasonable in the money market but thin in bonds . Dealers said the market seemed to be trading a range and would wait for more political polls to provide direction . They were confident of further eurokiwi issuance but said the timing was less of a certainty . -- B-LOC newsroom ( 64 4 ) 473 4746 B-ORG - B-ORG I-ORG expects strong full yr . B-LOC 1996-08-28 B-MISC investment company B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) said on Wednesday it expected a strong full year result . " We think we 're in a position to produce a strong result , however a lot of our profitability must inevitably depend on a number of ( company ) results , " said B-ORG director B-PER I-PER . B-ORG earlier said its net profit for the six months to June 30 rose to 9.77 million pounds from 6.93 million in the previous first half . The company did not declare an interim dividend as in the previous year . B-PER said the B-MISC share market had been somewhat negative for much of 1996 and this had some effect on the company 's first half results . " However , it certainly is a very pleasing result for the first six months , " he said . B-PER said most of the company 's half year earning stemmed from the sale of its 50 percent stake in B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG of B-LOC . He said the company decided to sell its B-LOC investment in order to consolidate investments closer to its administrative base . B-LOC 1996-08-28 Gold miner B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG said on Wednesday it posted a B-MISC 4.3 million profit after tax in the final quarter of the year to June 30 , 1996 . Earlier , B-ORG reported a drop in net profit after abnormals to B-MISC 20.81 million for the year from B-MISC 42.4 million the previous year . B-ORG said earnings from the B-LOC and B-LOC mines were lower than the previous year due to lower head grades at the mines , forcing gold production lower . Production costs also rose eight percent during the year to B-MISC 406 per ounce . B-ORG - B-LOC gunman evades police in bush hunt . B-ORG 1996-08-28 B-MISC police on Wednesday continued to hunt a gunman in dense bushland after he killed his wife and wounded three other people , warning the man is extremely dangerous and may take a hostage to escape . The shooting occured around 6.30 a.m. ( 2030 B-MISC ) on Tuesday at B-LOC , south of B-PER , about 150 km ( 93 miles ) north of B-LOC on the B-LOC state coast . Police have declared an " emergent situation " in the area , giving them powers to raid houses , search cars , close schools , quarantine the area and evacuate people . " It is one step short of an emergency situation , " a police spokesman said via telephone from a command post in the bush . " We have not had any sightings , but we suspect he is armed , possibly with a .22 rifle and / or a self-loading shotgun . He is considered extremely dangerous , " he said . " It 's a possibility , not a probability , he may take a hostage , but we have measures in place if that is the case . " B-PER I-PER broke into his wife 's home on Tuesday morning , shooting her dead and wounding his 16-year-old son , his son 's girlfriend and a neighbour , police said . All three wounded are in a satisfactory condition in hospital . B-PER initially fled from the shooting in a car , but then abandoned the car and entered dense bushland . B-PER is a skilled bushman who knows the area very well , police said . About 60 police , helicopters and fixed-wing aircraft have maintained an overnight cordon around 15 sq km ( six sq miles ) of bush near B-LOC . The area is littered with caves and police believed B-PER has a hideout which has enabled him to evade capture . B-LOC 's six states and two territories are involved in heated debate over the introduction of tough new firearm laws , including the banning rapid fire weapons , after a shooting massacre in the island state of B-LOC . On April 28 , a lone gunman went on a shooting rampage at the site of the historic B-LOC I-LOC penal settlement , killing 35 people . B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG opens new motorcyle plant . B-LOC 1996-08-28 B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , a B-ORG joint venture , opened a new plant to produce gasoline engines in the B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC of B-LOC , the B-ORG news agency reported on Wednesday . The plant , requiring an investment of three billion baht , has a floor space of 50,000 square metres and is designed to produce 600,000 gasoline engines a year , to be sold in B-LOC , B-LOC I-LOC , the B-LOC I-LOC and B-LOC , it said . Capacity is expected to reach one million engines by the year 2000 , it said . B-ORG I-ORG is jointly owned by the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG and B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . It started operations in January 1985 and has registered capital of 1.56 billion baht , it said but gave no further details . The joint venture has two motorcycle plants making B-MISC motorcycles and aims to be B-LOC 's biggest producer by the year 2000 , with output of two million units . B-ORG I-ORG 's B-PER I-PER confirms break with B-PER I-PER . ARANYAPRATHET , B-LOC 1996-08-28 Dissident B-ORG I-ORG leader B-PER I-PER confirmed on Wednesday that he had broken with B-PER I-PER and other hardliners of the guerrilla group and had formed a rival movement . B-PER I-PER said in a written statement , the first since his split with B-PER I-PER earlier this month , that the new movement to be called the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) would seek an end to civil war and work towards reconciliation with the B-MISC government . " I would like to inform you about my decision to break away from B-PER I-PER , B-PER I-PER , B-LOC I-LOC 's dictatorial group , " he said in a copy of the statement obtained by B-ORG . " We believe that our country will be reduced to nothing if the B-ORG people continue to fight against each other indefinitely .... For this reason we decided to break away from that dictatorial group and found a movement named ' B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ' , " he said . B-PER I-PER was sentenced to death in absentia for his role in the mass genocide in B-LOC during the B-ORG I-ORG rule of terror between 1975-1979 when over a million people were executed or died of starvation , disease or overwork in mass labour camps . The B-MISC , former brother-in-law of B-PER I-PER was foreign minister in the B-ORG I-ORG government that ruled B-LOC and was seen as the group 's second in command . Two dead in B-LOC helicopter crash . B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-28 Two people were killed and six were injured after a helicopter crashed in bad weather in northern B-LOC , a government minister said on Wednesday . The 15 survivors who had been on board the B-MISC B-MISC helicopter were taken to hospital from the remote jungle crash site about 150 km ( 90 miles ) north of B-LOC I-LOC , Information Minister B-PER I-PER said . The cause of the crash of the helicopter , which went down on Sunday while on a routine resupply flight between B-LOC I-LOC and B-LOC I-LOC , was not known . B-PER I-PER said the aircraft went down during a rain storm . B-ORG 's B-PER says believes B-ORG rate policy unchanged . B-LOC 1996-08-28 B-LOC 's Finance Minister B-PER I-PER told a news conference on Wednesday that he believes that the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG 's ( B-ORG ) interest rate policy which is geared towards ensuring economic growth has not changed after the release of the central bank 's " tankan " survey . The B-ORG released the August tankan , its quarterly short-term corporate survey , in the morning and it showed business outlook had worsened . However , B-PER said it did not necessarily show a substantial worsening of the economy . " The question is what the B-ORG is going to do with its interest rate policy . The B-ORG governor has made it clear that the B-ORG 's policy is aimed at ensuring basis for economic recovery . I believe this policy has not changed , " he said . Asked if a supplementary budget for 1996/97 was needed to support the economy , B-PER said the tankan results would not lead to any immediate decision on the need for an extra budget . " I do n't think we should immediately draw a conclusion that the economic recovery has come to a halt or that signs of a economic contraction have emerged , " B-PER said . " The economy is not recovering smoothly or at a fast pace . " B-PER said he would make a decision on the need for a supplementary budget after an announcement in mid-September of B-LOC 's gross domestic product for the April-June quarter . " I would like to see how the economy moved in the first half of 1996 , " he said . B-LOC says militant B-LOC must face war past . B-LOC 1996-08-28 B-LOC on Wednesday called on B-LOC to acknowledge its wartime past and put a stop to a tide of resurgent militarism to prevent similar atrocities in future . " Some B-MISC are still unrepentant about the atrocities committed by the B-MISC militarists during the war , " said a commentary in the official B-ORG I-ORG . " If they are still undecided whether the war B-LOC launched was aggressive in nature , it will be difficult to tell whether they will do the same again , " the newspaper said . B-LOC raised indignant protests after several B-MISC cabinet ministers visited a shrine dedicated to their country 's war dead on August 15 , the 51st anniversary of B-LOC 's B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC surrender . " Numerous B-MISC politicians have tried to whitewash their country 's war atrocities in recent years , " the commentary said . B-LOC estimates 35 million B-MISC were killed or wounded by invading B-MISC troops from 1931 to 1945 . " The B-MISC have never genuinely apologised for their wartime crimes , " the commentary said . B-MISC Prime Minister B-PER I-PER marked the August 15 anniversary by expressing " remorse " for foreign victims of B-LOC 's B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC atrocities . B-LOC coalition party leader plans to resign . B-LOC 1996-08-28 The leader of a junior partner in B-LOC 's three-party ruling coalition plans to resign to quell a political rebellion , party officials said on Wednesday . The officials said B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG President B-PER I-PER , finance minister until the beginning of this year , promised his resignation in a meeting with the politician who set off the rebellion in the smallest coalition member . They said the date of B-PER 's resignation would be determined by party officials . The B-ORG row has caused jitters in its coalition partners , Prime Minister B-PER I-PER 's B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) , the biggest grouping , and the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . But analysts said the row was not expected to immediately destabilise the government as even if B-ORG splits apart it has so few seats a loss of support would not lead to a general election . The dispute pits B-PER , who founded B-ORG in 1993 as a reform-oriented B-ORG splinter group , against party official B-PER I-PER , who says he will leave B-ORG to form a reformist political group next month . B-PER , the 49-year-old grandson of a 1950s prime minister , on Tuesday quit as B-ORG secretary general and has publicly snubbed the 62-year-old B-PER , pointedly ruling his mentor out as a possible member of the new political force . Marathon talks between the two former allies on Tuesday night and Wednesday morning failed to resolve the dispute over the role of B-PER , seen by B-PER backers as tainted by his senior role in the B-MISC coalition . The presence of B-PER , whose role as finance minister in passing an unpopular plan to use taxpayer funds to wind up failed housing loan firms ruined his reputation as a reformer , has stalled B-PER 's efforts to attract to his new group defectors from the opposition camp , analysts said . Media reports say that at most 10 of 23 B-ORG members , joined by a handful of B-MISC I-MISC , will follow B-PER when he bolts -- far short of the 50 lawmakers needed to topple B-PER 's eight-month-old government . B-PER -- who returns from a 10-day B-MISC I-MISC tour on Saturday -- must call polls by mid-1997 , and has repeatedly said he would not call an early general election . But many analysts and politicians believe he may dissolve parliament soon after it reconvenes in early October . B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG interim net up 2.7 pct . B-LOC 1996-08-28 A fire bomb was thrown over the fence into the grounds of the B-LOC Consulate-General in B-LOC 's second largest city of B-LOC but no one was hurt , a mission official said on Wednesday . B-PER I-PER , B-LOC embassy spokesman in B-LOC , 700 km ( 430 miles ) west of B-LOC , confirmed the Tuesday morning attack . " Somebody threw a molotov cocktail over the fence and it went into the parking lot . It did n't hit anybody or anything , " B-PER said . He said there was no immediate explanation for the attack or any information on those responsible . B-LOC novelist murdered at home . B-LOC 1996-08-28 A B-LOC novelist was murdered at her home on Sunday , an official of the city 's B-ORG I-ORG said on Wednesday . The victim was B-PER I-PER , who wrote about B-LOC 's 1966-76 leftist B-MISC I-MISC and the lives of B-MISC intellectuals , the official said . The killing was under investigation , she said . She gave no further details . B-LOC in 1937 in the central province of B-LOC , B-PER came to B-LOC as a student and remained in the city as a prolific author and teacher of B-MISC . She was divorced and lived alone , leaving one daughter who received university education in B-LOC and lives in B-LOC , a friend said . B-PER 's most famous book , " B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC " ( B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC ) , was translated into B-MISC and B-MISC , he said . B-PER I-PER plunges on rights issue , earnings . B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-28 Shares of B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG plunged to an all-time low after the company announced a rights issue plan and also reported a sharp fall in earnings , brokers said . The stock fell B-MISC 0.23 , or 30.26 percent , to an all-time low of B-MISC 0.53 . " Investors unloaded their shares due to the poor earnings outlook following a sharp profit decline . B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-28 With 307 days to go before the B-MISC colony reverts to B-LOC , the B-LOC I-LOC media focused mainly on domestic issues concerning alleged pressure on a judge , cross straights relations and the democratic lobby 's relationship with B-LOC . The B-MISC B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG said B-LOC 's government could not hope to stem the island 's economic and trade exchanges with B-LOC . The paper said that using administrative power to limit economic activities across the B-LOC strait would not work . B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG said it hoped B-MISC officials would soon open dialogue with B-LOC I-LOC 's B-ORG I-ORG and the newly-established democracy lobby , B-ORG , in order to ease anxieties in the lead-up to the handover . The B-MISC language B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG said the judiciary needed to take swift and decisive action in investigating the allegations that a judge had been subjected to pressure in a B-LOC I-LOC immigration case involving allegations of fraud . The independence of the judiciary and the rule of law were of paramount importance to B-LOC I-LOC 's survival as a business centre . The B-MISC language daily B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG said the B-ORG I-ORG had been indecisive in its handling of the judge 's case . Such hesitancy on the part of the government had damaged public confidence in the rule of law , the paper said . -- B-LOC I-LOC newsroom ( 852 ) 2843 6441 B-ORG I-ORG frees rights activist . B-LOC 1996-08-28 A human rights activist said on Wednesday he had been released after more than two weeks in detention that followed his call for an inquiry into the death of a B-LOC man interrogated by B-MISC police . B-PER I-PER , director of the B-MISC B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , said he was freed on Tuesday without being charged . B-MISC Attorney-General B-PER I-PER was not immediately available to comment . B-PER had said B-PER was arrested on suspicion of making a false statement . The activist was detained by B-MISC intelligence service agents on August 12 after publishing a statement demanding an investigation into the death of a B-LOC man who had been questioned by B-MISC authorities . The B-ORG I-ORG said the dead man , B-PER I-PER , had committed suicide . Human rights groups had protested about B-PER 's arrest in letters to B-MISC President B-PER I-PER and to B-PER . B-ORG - Government will finish pension reform before the year 2000 B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG - B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG stagnates during struggle for presidency B-LOC asks B-LOC to extradite ex-president B-PER . B-LOC 1996-08-28 B-LOC has asked B-LOC to extradite its former president B-PER I-PER for alleged hijacking , an B-MISC embassy spokesman said on Wednesday . B-PER angered B-LOC last week by accusing top B-MISC leaders of ordering the assassination of B-MISC I-MISC leaders in a B-LOC restaurant in 1992 . He made the allegations at the trial of an B-MISC and four B-MISC accused of carrying out the attack . An B-MISC embassy spokesman said in response to an inquiry that B-LOC had formally requested B-PER 's extradition for hijacking the military aircraft which he commandeered to flee B-LOC in July 1981 . " We submitted the request three or four days ago , " he said . B-MISC authorities could not immediately be reached for comment . B-PER lives under round-the-clock security in B-LOC , fearing B-LOC could make an attempt on his life . He is due back in B-LOC on September 5 to continue his testimony , which has backed up B-MISC prosecutors ' allegations that B-LOC ordered the attack on the exiled leaders . Three dissidents and their translator were killed in the gangland-style machinegun attack . B-LOC has warned B-LOC that bilateral relations could suffer if it pays heed to the testimony of B-PER , an architect of B-LOC 's B-MISC revolution who has been a sworn enemy of B-LOC since he fell from favour after a year as president . B-ORG military chiefs to visit B-ORG . B-LOC 1996-08-28 Top military officials from B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG countries will tour B-LOC and B-LOC next month for their annual inspection of alliance country installations and forces . B-ORG said in a statement received on Wednesday that its military committee would visit the two countries between September 8 and 13 . The committee consists of the chiefs of defence staff of each alliance country except B-LOC , which has no armed forces . B-ORG 's top military men -- General B-PER I-PER , Supreme Allied Commander B-LOC , and General B-PER I-PER , Supreme Allied Commander B-LOC -- will also attend . The committee 's last tour was in September 1995 in B-LOC , B-LOC and the B-LOC . B-PER B-ORG says agreed sale of B-LOC unit . B-LOC 1996-08-28 B-MISC cleaning group B-ORG on Wednesday said it had signed a letter of intent to sell its troubled B-LOC unit B-ORG I-ORG to B-MISC firm B-ORG I-ORG . An B-ORG statement said that B-ORG , with year-end 1996 assets of B-MISC 10.9 million and equity of $ 10.5 million , would be listed on the B-LOC stock exchange , but did not say when . It said that under the sale agreement , full financial details of which were not revealed , B-ORG would acquire a 25 percent stake in B-ORG which would become an associated company within the B-ORG group trading under the B-ORG name and logo . B-ORG I-ORG senior management would continue to run the business under the new owners , it said . B-MISC analysts recently estimated B-ORG I-ORG 's sale value at up to $ 118 million . B-ORG said that the deal included B-ORG I-ORG operations in B-LOC and the sale of B-ORG I-ORG interests in B-LOC would be discussed . On August 15 , B-ORG published first half 1996 results showing a two billion crown loss caused by falsified accounts in B-ORG I-ORG and said that charges and provisions earlier estimated at $ 100 million would have to be increased to $ 146 million . It also wrote down all B-ORG I-ORG goodwill and Wednesday 's statement said that the B-ORG purchase would not necessitate further write down if the sale were completed according to the terms of the letter of intent . -- B-PER I-PER , B-LOC newsroom +45 33969650 B-LOC balks at B-ORG staff for oil-for-food deal . B-PER I-PER B-ORG I-ORG 1996-08-28 B-LOC has balked at the number of B-ORG staff needed to implement the oil-for-food deal , blaming the B-LOC I-LOC for insisting on stringent monitoring . In comments to reporters and a statement on Tuesday , B-MISC diplomats said the cost of the monitors and other staff , which B-LOC has to finance , surpasses funds allocated for electricity , water , sewers , education and agriculture . At issue was a May 20 agreement allowing B-LOC to sell $ 2 billion worth of oil to purchase badly needed food , medicine and other supplies to ease the impact of sanctions in force since its troops invaded B-LOC in August 1990 . The B-MISC statement said the B-LOC I-LOC was " interfering and pressing to augment the number of international staff and this is not legal and not justified . " B-LOC 's deputy ambassador , B-PER I-PER , noted that the May 20 accord said that the number of personnel would be determined by the B-ORG I-ORG and that the government of B-LOC would be consulted . B-PER in his comments did not threaten to call off the deal and the B-ORG officials said they expected it to go into force next month after Secretary-General B-PER I-PER reports that arrangements are in place . The B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) , which has to coordinate the distribution of food , medicine and other goods , increased the number of monitors earlier this month at the insistence of the B-LOC I-LOC . According to B-ORG officials and diplomats , B-LOC would have about $ 1.13 billion to spend for food , medicine and other goods after monies for a reparations fund for B-MISC I-MISC victims and costs for B-ORG weapons inspections were deducted . The cost of the B-ORG staff overseeing the distribution of food and other supplies was estimated to cost $ 31 million . In addition another $ 12 million was anticipated to cover other expenses , such as oil experts and administrative costs . For the distribution and supervision of humanitarian supplies the B-ORG I-ORG estimated it needed 1,190 people , including 267 international staff and 923 B-MISC support staff . Of this number 64 foreign and 598 local staff would be in the northern B-MISC provinces , no longer the direct control of the B-LOC government . Another 203 international staff and 325 B-MISC would run the programme in the central and southern parts of the country . There are also 14 monitors to watch oil flows , 32 customs experts and four B-MISC I-MISC oil experts or overseers to approve contracts . B-PER I-PER , the B-ORG undersecretary-general , told the B-ORG I-ORG last week that the " financial requirements to support the ( humanitarian ) programme represent a very modest percentile of the total ... roughly 3 percent . B-ORG I-ORG cool on changing beef cull plan . B-LOC 1996-08-29 The B-ORG I-ORG said on Thursday it would study scientific reports saying B-LOC 's mad cow epidemic would die out by 2001 but offered little prospect the findings would change an agreed slaughter campaign . " Obviously we are interested in this research . We will ask the ( B-ORG ) scientific and veterinary committee to examine it , " B-ORG spokesman B-PER I-PER told B-ORG . But he added that new research into the dynamics of the bovine spongiform encephalopathy ( B-MISC ) , a fatal brain-wasting disease suffered by cattle , was unlikely to alter a slaughter plan agreed by B-LOC and its 14 B-ORG partners . " We agreed that following detailed scientific analysis using a methodology which would take out the maximum number of B-MISC cases possible . I think it would be very difficult to sell to the B-ORG I-ORG a programme which would involve the elimination of fewer B-MISC cases , " B-PER said . " We will look at our approach ( to the plan ) but we wo n't get involved with the number of animals to be slaughtered , " he said . " We have always avoided the question of numbers of animals to be slaughtered , that 's not the issue . The issue is the protection of consumers ' health and the rapid eradication of B-MISC , " he added . The reaction is likely to disappoint B-MISC farmers , who seized on research by B-ORG scientists in the scientific journal B-ORG saying it would be hard to get rid of the disease any faster than 2001 without killing vast numbers of cattle . The researchers predicted there would be 340 new infections and 14,000 new cases of B-MISC before 2001 . B-MISC farmers ' leader called on Wednesday for an urgent meeting with ministers to discuss the report . " I hope the government will now make it clear they believe there is a better way of dealing with this issue , " B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG president Sir B-PER I-PER told B-ORG I-ORG . B-PER said there was no need for B-LOC to carry out a planned cull of some 147,000 cattle to which it had reluctantly agreed to placate its B-MISC partners . " The new evidence to me means some of that proposal should be re-examined because we could get away with considerably less animals being culled if in fact scientists throughout B-LOC accepted this evidence , " B-PER said . The report could well reopen a damaging row between B-LOC and the B-ORG , which slapped a worldwide ban on B-MISC beef after the government said there could be a link between B-MISC and the human form of the disease . The issue flared in in March when government scientists admitted that people could become infected with B-MISC I-MISC ( B-MISC ) from eating B-MISC beef . B-MISC farmers set up blockades in mad cow protest . B-LOC 1996-08-29 Thousands of farmers threw up roadblocks across B-LOC overnight , stopping and checking lorries suspected of importing meat from outside the B-ORG I-ORG , B-MISC radios reported on Thursday . Radio stations said around 15,000 farmers , angered by a fall in beef prices following the mad cow disease crisis , staged protests in many areas and blockaded several main roads and motorways . By 3 a.m. ( 0100 B-MISC ) more than 2,000 lorries had been stopped and searched . B-MISC beef sales plunged after B-LOC announced the discovery of a likely link between bovine spongiform encephalopathy ( B-MISC ) , or mad cow disease , and its fatal human equivalent B-MISC I-MISC ( B-MISC ) . CRICKET - B-PER RESTRICTS B-LOC TO 225-5 . B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-29 Tight bowling from B-ORG off-spinner B-PER I-PER helped B-LOC to restrict B-LOC to 225 for five in their 50 overs in the first one-day international at B-LOC I-LOC on Thursday . B-PER , who was one of the few B-MISC to make a good impression in his test debut at B-LOC I-LOC last week , showed great control as he first dried up the early flow of B-LOC runs and then collected the wickets of B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER in a spell of 10-1-36-2 . There was also a wicket each for B-PER I-PER , B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER although there was no joy for B-PER I-PER who , along with B-ORG batsman B-PER I-PER , was making his international debut . After B-PER had won the toss and chosen to bat first , B-MISC made an excellent start as B-PER and B-PER I-PER continued their good form with an opening partnership of 82 . B-PER , who struck a superb 176 at B-LOC I-LOC , was the more aggressive as he made 57 from 75 balls before skying a catch off B-PER to B-PER at long-on . B-PER and B-PER I-PER then added 59 for the second wicket before B-LOC struck back with three wickets for 19 in the space of five overs . First , B-PER , after making 48 , was bowled by B-PER as he stepped back to try and hit through the off-side . B-PER , who promoted himself to number four in the order , followed for six when B-PER drifted another well-flighted delivery behind his legs . Shortly after B-PER was also back in the pavilion for 48 after B-PER had repaid B-PER with another good catch at long-on . B-PER later bowled B-PER I-PER with an inswinging yorker but B-PER , 37 not out , and B-PER I-PER took B-LOC to 225 for five when the overs ran out . CRICKET - B-LOC V B-LOC ONE-DAY SCOREBOARD . B-ORG I-ORG - B-PER CONFIRMED FOR B-ORG COACHING ROLE . B-LOC 1996-08-30 B-LOC 's B-PER I-PER was officially confirmed on Thursday as assistant coach for the B-ORG I-ORG tour to B-LOC I-LOC next year . B-PER , who has put on hold his role as B-LOC team manager for a year , will act as assistant to B-PER I-PER . The pair last worked together when B-LOC won the B-MISC I-MISC grand slam in 1990 . The tour party will be announced towards the end of March . ATHLETICS - B-PER TO RUN IN B-LOC . B-LOC 1996-08-29 B-PER I-PER has confirmed he will run in a " B-ORG I-ORG " sprint relay at the B-LOC grand prix athletics meeting on Friday . A spokeswoman for B-PER said the former B-MISC 100 metres champion had agreed to captain a quality quartet which also includes B-LOC 's B-PER I-PER , the current B-MISC champion and world record holder , and Namibian B-PER I-PER . B-PER is retiring from international competition at the end of the season , but B-LOC promoter B-PER I-PER has persuaded him to join what is intended to be a special tribute to B-PER I-PER , who won four gold medals 60 years ago at the B-LOC B-MISC . SOCCER - B-PER NAMED TEMPORARY B-LOC COACH . B-LOC 1996-08-29 B-MISC goalkeeper B-PER I-PER has been appointed temporary head coach of the B-LOC national soccer team for two international matches , the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) said on Thursday . B-ORG vice-chairman B-PER I-PER said B-PER would take charge for a match against B-LOC in B-LOC on September 29 in the five-nation B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC tournament and an B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC first round qualifier against B-LOC in B-LOC on October 5 . B-PER takes over until a permanent replacement is appointed for B-LOC 's previous coach , B-LOC 's B-PER I-PER . B-PER now plays for B-MISC second division leaders B-ORG I-ORG after years in the top flight with B-ORG and B-ORG . B-PER , fellow goalkeeper B-PER I-PER , retired striker B-PER I-PER and B-MISC businessman B-PER I-PER I-PER pleaded not guilty in May to charges of giving or accepting bribes to fix B-MISC premier league matches . B-LOC 1996-08-29 B-PER I-PER hit a three-run homer and former B-MISC B-PER I-PER allowed one run over seven innings as the B-ORG I-ORG completed a sweep of B-ORG I-ORG with a 10-2 victory in a game marred by a bench-clearing brawl . Including the last three games of last October 's Divisional Playoff Series , the B-ORG have beaten the B-ORG 12 of the past 15 meetings overall and 14 of the last 16 in the B-LOC . Five players were ejected after B-ORG ' outfielder B-PER I-PER and B-ORG catcher B-PER I-PER got into a fight after B-PER had been brushed back . In B-LOC , B-PER I-PER threw a nine-hitter for his first shutout and B-PER I-PER had a two-run double in a three-run fifth inning as the B-ORG I-ORG blanked the B-ORG I-ORG 3-0 . B-PER ( 7-9 ) , who failed to record a shutout in his previous 86 starts in either the minors or majors , did not walk a batter and struck out three for B-ORG . In B-LOC , B-PER I-PER scattered five hits over seven scoreless innings and B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER had B-MISC hits in the second inning as the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG blanked the B-ORG I-ORG 2-0 . B-PER ( 10-4 ) struck out four and did not walk a batter for B-LOC , which won for only the fourth time in 15 games . B-PER I-PER had three hits for the B-ORG . In B-LOC I-LOC , B-PER I-PER 's single with two out in the 12th inning scored B-PER I-PER with the winning run and lifted the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG to a 4-3 victory over the B-ORG I-ORG . B-PER I-PER ( 1-1 ) allowed one hit and a walk in the 12th to post his first major-league win . In B-LOC , B-PER I-PER tossed a five-hitter for his fifth consecutive complete game and three players drove in two runs apiece as the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG defeated the B-ORG I-ORG 6-1 for their ninth win in 11 games . B-PER ( 17-7 ) surrendered just three doubles and a pair of singles in tossing his major-league leading ninth complete game . He walked three and struck out three in winning for the 10th time in his last 11 decisions . In B-LOC , B-PER I-PER recorded his fourth straight win and B-PER I-PER snapped a sixth-inning tie with a grand slam as the B-ORG I-ORG completed a season sweep of the B-ORG I-ORG with a 9-3 victory . B-PER ( 14-7 ) , who allowed three runs , eight hits and one walk with five strikeouts over seven innings , improved to 4-0 in his last six starts , including a pair of wins over B-ORG in the last 11 days . B-PER I-PER B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-28 B-PER I-PER decided that when in B-LOC I-LOC , do as the B-MISC I-MISC do -- and the B-MISC 's new-found aggressiveness seems to have put her in the right frame of mind for the B-MISC I-MISC . The fourth-seeded B-MISC , who is tackling the world class traffic of B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC as a warm-up by driving to the tennis centre for her matches , ran over B-LOC 's B-PER I-PER 6-1 6-3 on Wednesday to take her place in the third round . " I 've been trying my whole career to be aggressive , " said the 24-year-old B-PER after crushing B-PER in just over an hour . " What I 'm trying to do is be aggressive all the time , maybe go up to the net a few times like I did tonight . That would really help . " B-PER , the 1994 B-MISC champion , used to struggle at the B-MISC , but has come to terms with the noise , crowds and chaos . " There is a lot of things that can happen , " B-PER said about her early difficulties adjusting to tennis on the cement at B-LOC I-LOC . " Like traffic . We stay in B-LOC and it 's a long way to come . The crowds , they speak louder or they move . That does n't happen in other B-MISC I-MISC . That 's where the real champion wins . You have to concentrate for these two weeks . " It took B-PER four Opens to get as far as the quarters , and another four to match that . Last year , B-PER , who finished 1995 ranked second in the world , reached the semifinals before bowing out to B-PER I-PER . Now she feels she is in the swing of things . " I have my own car now and that helps , " said B-PER . " Sometimes the transportation they ( the tournament ) provide gets a little messed up . This time it did n't happen . I do the driving and I love it . It gets my adrenalin going , those taxi drivers . " We change lanes all the time in B-LOC . I 'm used to it and I like to drive fast . " BASEBALL - B-ORG SIGN B-PER . B-LOC 1996-08-28 The defending world champion B-ORG I-ORG , with the best record and best pitching in baseball , added another weapon Wednesday , acquiring B-PER I-PER , the winningest left-hander in the B-MISC I-MISC , from the B-ORG I-ORG . The B-ORG , who conceded earlier this week they would be forced to trim salary from next season 's payroll , received B-PER I-PER , a first baseman at Double-A B-ORG ; B-PER I-PER , a pitcher at Class-A B-ORG , and a player to be named . It was another stunning mid-season acquisition for the B-ORG , who already have an 11-game lead in the B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC . In the last 15 days , B-LOC has traded for third baseman B-PER I-PER , claimed outfielder B-PER I-PER on waivers and called up minor-league phenom B-PER I-PER , all in preparation for their fifth post-season . B-PER I-PER B-LOC 1996-08-29 B-MISC champions B-PER I-PER and B-PER I-PER and former champion B-PER I-PER will run in a " B-ORG I-ORG " sprint relay squad in honour of B-PER I-PER on Friday . B-PER , the 200 metres world record holder , and B-LOC 's 1992 B-MISC 100 champion B-PER confirmed on Thursday that they would join 100 record holder B-PER and B-LOC 's B-PER I-PER in one of the greatest 4x100 squads ever assembled . They will run against quartets from the B-LOC I-LOC , B-LOC and B-LOC in a special race at the B-LOC B-MISC I-MISC meeting to mark the 60th anniversary of B-PER 's four gold medals at the 1936 B-MISC in the B-MISC capital . B-PER will run the anchor leg after B-LOC 's B-PER , B-MISC B-PER and B-MISC silver medallist B-PER have run the first three stages of the relay . The participation of B-PER and B-PER had been known before Thursday . But B-PER did not announce his decision to run until the eve of the meeting when organisers also confirmed B-PER would take part . B-PER is due to retire from international competition at the end of the season although he may compete for B-LOC in next season 's B-MISC I-MISC . Although B-PER , who is not racing the individual 100 metres in B-LOC , took his time to agree to run , the veteran was clearly delighted to be part of the tribute to the black B-MISC . When five former B-MISC 100 champions from 1948 to 1980 , who have been invited to watch the race , turned up at a news conference on Thursday , B-PER was quick to put his autograph book in front of the them . " I do n't normally do this but can you please sign , " he said thrusting an ornate white book in front of B-MISC B-PER I-PER ( 1948 ) , B-PER I-PER ( 1952 ) , B-PER I-PER ( 1968 ) , B-LOC 's B-PER I-PER ( 1976 ) and B-LOC 's B-PER I-PER ( 1980 ) . " B-PER I-PER inspired everyone here and it is great to have a tribute to him . " B-PER 's widow B-PER is not well enough to attend but a message from her will be read out by the sprinter 's grand-daughter B-PER I-PER during the meeting B-LOC organisers hoped to have B-MISC 1984 and 1988 champion B-PER I-PER in the squad but he injured himself in last Friday 's B-LOC meeting . SOCCER - B-ORG AWARDED B-MISC I-MISC WIN . B-LOC 1996-08-29 B-MISC soccer 's sports judge on Thursday ruled that B-ORG , beaten 3-0 by B-ORG in the first round of the B-MISC I-MISC , should be awarded a 2-0 victory because their opponents fielded a banned player . The ruling meant that serie B club B-ORG now meet local B-MISC I-MISC arch-rivals B-ORG in the second round . B-ORG appealed after their defeat last Saturday on the grounds that B-ORG striker B-PER I-PER , who came on in the 71st minute with his team leading 2-0 , still had a one-match suspension to serve from last season . B-LOC WELCOMES B-MISC TREATY ACCORD . B-LOC 1996-08-29 B-LOC joined the B-LOC I-LOC on Thursday in welcoming B-LOC and B-LOC 's agreement on the text of a much-delayed friendship treaty , which it said would contribute to stability in the area . " The B-LOC I-LOC believes that such a treaty will contribute positively to the further development of good neighbourly relations between the two countries and enhance the stability of the region , " said the B-MISC Foreign office statement . The accord , agreed two weeks ago , is expected to end years of disputes over the status of B-LOC 's large ethnic B-MISC minority . It will also boost both countries ' ambitions to join B-ORG and the B-ORG I-ORG . B-LOC and B-LOC say the treaty should be signed in the first half of September . " The B-LOC I-LOC looks forward to the early signature of the treaty , " the statement said . B-LOC B-MISC IN B-LOC CLOSED ON B-MISC I-MISC , SEP 2 . B-LOC 1996-08-29 Former B-LOC rugby captain B-PER I-PER , whose marriage broke down after he was romantically linked to Princess B-PER , was divorced by his wife on Thursday , just 24 hours after B-PER and B-PER I-PER divorced . B-ORG I-ORG newspaper said B-PER was not named in the divorce petition heard by a court in B-LOC , southern B-LOC . But B-PER I-PER , a television presenter , is said to have blamed B-PER for the problems in her marriage and she has repeatedly mocked the princess on her breakfast television programme . B-LOC 1996-08-29 A total of 116 delegates to B-LOC 's B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) were formally installed on Thursday , launching another phase of the B-MISC I-MISC nation 's much-delayed democratic transition . The 116 , representing political parties in the capital B-LOC , will help organise a voter census , a constitutional referendum planned for January and efforts to brief potential voters on what balloting involves . A total of 9,446 delegates will be deployed throughout B-LOC 's 11 provinces for the elections , which must be held by July 1997 under the transitional constitution . Presidential , parliamentary and municipal elections are planned for May . " We can meet the required deadlines for organising the elections . All that is needed is for everyone to show goodwill , " B-ORG spokesman B-PER I-PER I-PER told reporters . Delegates to the commission from the other 10 provinces will be installed progressively from next week with the provinces of B-LOC and B-LOC I-LOC , B-LOC , B-LOC and B-LOC having priority , he said . The installation of delegates was initially scheduled for July . Officials said lack of funding had delayed the process . President B-PER I-PER I-PER , who seized power in a 1965 coup , introduced a multi-party system in 1990 but B-LOC 's transition has lagged well behind that of other states in the region . In the past , B-PER has been elected without opposition . B-LOC would not refuse B-ORG officials . B-LOC 1996-08-29 B-LOC would not object to a visit by B-ORG officials but insists its suspension from the organisation be resolved before any other questions are addressed , Foreign Minister B-PER I-PER said on Thursday . B-PER reiterated his position that the B-ORG had no mandate to send a fact-finding mission . " The request I have received is for their officials to come and talk to my officials . We cannot object to people wanting to visit B-LOC , " B-PER told B-ORG by telephone from the capital B-LOC . " The fundamental problem we have with the B-ORG is our unfair suspension . Any discussions we have at ministerial level will be a continuation of what we began in B-LOC on that . Before that is accomplished we cannot address anything else . " B-LOC was suspended from the B-ORG in November after the execution of B-PER I-PER and eight other minority rights activists in defiance of international pleas for clemency . A meeting of B-ORG ministers in B-LOC on Wednesday said it planned to send a team of senior officials to B-LOC as soon as possible to persuade B-LOC to accept a fact-finding mission . The timing of that mission has yet to be determined . The latest diplomatic row between B-LOC 's military government and the club of B-LOC and its former colonies erupted over the terms of a visit by B-ORG ministers to discuss B-LOC 's suspension . B-LOC said they would be restricted to a two-day meeting with government officials , but the B-ORG said it wanted to hold meetings with people outside the government and called off the visit . B-PER , B-PER discuss election crisis . B-PER I-PER B-LOC 1996-08-29 B-LOC envoy B-PER I-PER met B-MISC President B-PER I-PER on Thursday in an effort to defuse a growing crisis surrounding B-LOC 's post-war elections . The B-MISC diplomat arrived in B-LOC two days after international organisers postponed municipal elections in B-LOC due to irregularities in the registration of B-MISC refugee voters . " We discussed the decision to postpone the municipal elections and I made clear it was primarily the manipulation of voter registration by the B-LOC I-LOC ( B-MISC I-MISC republic ) which led to this development , " B-PER said after three hours of talks . But he said the B-LOC I-LOC still believed it was important to go ahead with national elections in B-LOC as scheduled on September 14 to bolster the peace process . B-PER gave no indication that he had won any specific commitment from B-PER , the patron of the B-MISC I-MISC , to rectify any abuses in the registration process . B-LOC 's B-MISC political parties have urged their refugees to boycott the elections until irregularities with voter registration are resolved . Human rights workers say B-MISC and B-MISC I-MISC authorities coerced refugees to register only in B-MISC territory in B-LOC to solidify the results of wartime expulsions and military conquest . B-MISC officials have denied any abuses occurred during a 10-day registration period and the B-MISC I-MISC , angry at the postponement of municipal elections , have threatened to hold local polls on their territory without the international community 's blessing . B-PER said only elections endorsed by the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) would be legitimate . " As we have said publicly before , if there is any effort to do so ( hold local elections ) these elections will not be valid , " he said . " The elections which are valid are those conducted by the international community under the management of the B-ORG . " After meeting B-PER , B-PER flew to the B-MISC capital B-LOC . He was due to head to the B-MISC town of B-LOC I-LOC on Friday to meet B-MISC I-MISC acting president B-PER I-PER and B-MISC I-MISC opposition leaders . He also planned to travel to B-LOC to oversee the formal dissolution of the separatist B-MISC mini-state in western B-LOC . B-ORG police , relief workers and B-ORG officers have reported a rise in political violence across B-LOC in the run-up to the September 14 elections . Voters will be choosing a three-member presidency and a parliament to rule over a loose union of B-LOC , comprised of a B-MISC republic and a B-MISC federation . B-ORG rises to 2,901.48 rbls at auction . B-LOC 1996-08-29 A stake of 10 million shares in B-MISC gas monopoly B-ORG I-ORG was sold at auction on Thursday at an average 2,901.48 roubles a share , up from 2,891.00 roubles a week ago , the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) said . Starting price at the auction was 2,746 roubles a share and the 40 lots sold for between 2,840 and 2,998 roubles a share , the B-ORG said in a statement . The stake represented 0.042 percent of B-ORG 's capital . The B-ORG said that since auctions began , 139.75 million shares , equivalent to 0.59 percent of B-ORG , have changed hands . B-ORG , B-LOC 's biggest company by market capitalisation , has massive reserves and potentially huge earnings . However , its 23.6 billion shares are highly illiquid and management permission is required to sell them . B-ORG has recently tightened these rules , making it harder for shareholders to sell to whoever they want , when they want . The company has organised regular auctions of its shares to create an orderly market in the paper . At the first auction on March 6 , shares sold for an average 406.6 roubles each , and prices have been rising steadily since then , but the rise in price this week and last was much less than in previous auctions . On the B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC , B-ORG shares rose 25 percent on Thursday to $ 0.375 from $ 0.300 , after falling by over a third earlier this week . -- B-PER I-PER , B-ORG I-ORG , +7095 941 8520 B-MISC policeman shot dead in B-LOC province . B-LOC 1996-08-29 A policeman has been shot dead in B-LOC 's troubled B-LOC province , B-MISC police said on Thursday . It was the fifth attack on police this month in the southern province , a hot spot of ethnic tension where the B-MISC majority have boycotted B-MISC institutions and set up their own , which are considered illegal by B-LOC . The slain policeman B-PER I-PER , 42 , was an B-MISC who had served in the B-MISC police and state security since 1987 , police told the B-MISC news agency B-ORG . He was shot on Wednesday afternoon as he stepped off a bus near his family home in the village of B-LOC I-LOC in the municipality of B-LOC . Just hours before Wednesday 's shooting , three hand grenades were thrown at a police station in B-LOC . They caused damage but no casualties , police said . The B-MISC authorities blame B-MISC dissidents for the recent spate of attacks . None of the attackers has been caught . B-LOC 's autonomy was revoked in 1987 and B-MISC police forces cracked down on B-MISC protests . B-MISC moderates want autonomy restored but hardliners want to join up with neighbouring B-LOC . The B-MISC , who make up 10 percent of the province 's 1.8 million people , claim B-LOC as the cradle of their culture . Viral meningitis epidemic kills 10 in B-LOC . B-LOC 1996-08-29 Viral meningitis has killed 10 people in B-LOC 's capital B-LOC this month in what doctors said on Thursday was the worst epidemic of its type in the country for a decade . Some 170 middle-aged and elderly people with the disease were being treated in hospital , doctors said . Doctor B-PER I-PER , head of B-LOC 's B-LOC I-LOC hospital for infectious diseases , said the epidemic had been caused by a virus yet to be identified . Illness from viral meningitis lasts around a week . It affects the gastro-intestinal tract , causing high fever , headache and vomiting . In 1986 B-LOC suffered an epidemic of the more dangerous bacterial meningitis which has killed some 15,000 people in central B-LOC this year . B-LOC 's B-ORG workers protest enters 9th day . B-LOC 1996-08-29 B-LOC 's non-traditional exports , which exclude oil and iron , rose 10.6 percent in July to reach $ 334 million compared to $ 302 million in June , according to the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) . " The rise was due to the end of exchange controls , " B-ORG said . Foreign exchange controls were removed April 22 as part of a wider B-MISC program . Nevertheless , exports over the first seven months of the year were 16.8 percent lower than during the same period last year , at $ 2.240 billion compared to $ 2.693 billion . Over the seven months , the private sector accounted for 76 percent of total exports , with " common metals " the strongest export sector accounting for $ 951 million , or 42.5 percent of total exports . " Chemical products " came next with a 13 percent share , then " transport materials " with nine percent , and finally foods , drinks and tobacco with 6.3 percent . B-LOC was the chief market for B-LOC 's non-traditional exports with 27.4 percent . [ CORRECTED 05:53 B-MISC ] B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-28 Pre-electoral bickering flared on Wednesday in the troubled western B-MISC state of B-LOC as some opposition politicians demanded the army pull out of the area ahead of an upcoming state poll . The mayor of B-LOC , a small town some 310 miles ( 500 km ) south of B-LOC I-LOC , sent a letter to B-LOC 's B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG complaining the army 's heavy presence in the town would interfere with the Oct. 6 election . B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER , of the opposition B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , said in Wednesday 's letter that army troops recently raided several local farms , stole cattle and raped women . The letter was signed by some 200 area residents and indigenous leaders . Some electoral watchdog groups also said the presence of the army , which has fanned out across the state in the past month in search of a new guerrilla group , was likely to intimidate voters and had stirred up tension in the state . A B-MISC group of electoral observers , B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , concluded the army presence exerted a heavy psychological pressure on local farmers and would prevent a fair vote . Up for grabs in the election are the state legislature and 75 town halls . ( Corrects to show elections are not for governor ) . Despite the criticism , acting state Gov . B-PER I-PER pledged the elections will be free and fair and said he did not expect any trouble from the elusive new guerrilla group , the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . " The electoral process has been proceeding in accordance with the new state electoral law , " B-PER said , adding that the poll would be " an exercise in true democracy . B-MISC poll shows military wants PM B-PER out . B-LOC 1996-08-29 B-LOC 's powerful military thinks the government is dishonest and Prime Minister B-PER I-PER 's resignation might solve the nation 's political and economic woes , an opinion poll showed on Thursday . Nearly half the 1,617 military personnel surveyed in the B-ORG I-ORG poll suggested that B-PER resign , while about 28 percent thought he should dissolve parliament and 24 percent thought a cabinet reshuffle could resolve the government 's problems . B-PER , who leads a six-party , 13-month-old coalition government , faces a no-confidence debate in parliament next month . The prime minister , who has already lost one coalition partner this month , is expected to have a tough battle in the debate because of infighting in his own party and warnings of more pullouts by other coalition partners . The poll , conducted earlier this month after B-PER 's coalition completed one year in office , showed the military would prefer General B-PER I-PER -- a former prime minister who was ousted in a military coup in February 1991 -- as prime minister . Defence Minister B-PER I-PER , head of coalition member the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , was the second choice for prime minister , the poll showed . B-PER came in last on the list of proposed leaders with less than one percent of the votes . Nearly two-thirds of the people surveyed thought the government was dishonest and insincere , and 65 percent blamed the government 's poor performance for the country 's economic slowdown . The opinion of the military in B-LOC , which has seen 17 coups or attempted coups since the country switched to parliamentary democracy from absolute monarchy in 1932 , always carries weight in the political scene , despite officials ' vows to distance the military from politics . B-ORG cleric jailed in B-LOC hospitalised briefly . B-LOC 1996-08-29 B-MISC prison officials took jailed B-MISC militant B-ORG founder Sheikh B-PER I-PER to hospital briefly on Thursday for medical tests , officials said . " This evening Sheikh B-PER completed medical checks and returned to B-LOC prisons authority medical centre , " said a spokesman for B-LOC 's internal security ministry . A prison official said B-PER had a mild case of pneumonia . The 60-year-old B-MISC cleric , jailed by B-LOC since 1989 , is serving a life sentence for ordering attacks by B-ORG guerrillas against B-MISC targets . The ailing B-PER is the spiritual leader of the fundamentalist B-ORG group which has killed scores of B-MISC in suicide attacks aimed at wrecking B-MISC peace deals . B-MISC President B-PER I-PER has demanded that B-LOC release B-PER -- who is confined to a wheelchair -- on humanitarian grounds . Accompanied by his wife and grandson , B-PER arrived in B-LOC on August 25 . B-PER is expected to fly home on Friday , officials said . Scandal hits B-PER campaign at vital moment . B-PER I-PER B-LOC 1996-08-29 President B-PER I-PER 's triumphal appearance at the B-MISC convention , a vital moment in his bid for a second term , was marred on Thursday by the resignation of a top adviser in a reported sex scandal . B-PER was at work on the nomination acceptance speech that will launch his 10-week re-election campaign when political strategist B-PER I-PER abruptly announced his resignation on Thursday . The tabloid B-ORG I-ORG reported the married B-PER had a lengthy affair with a $ 200-an-hour prostitute who he allowed to eavesdrop on telephone conversations with B-PER , and with whom he shared B-LOC I-LOC speeches before they were made . " B-PER I-PER is my friend , and he is a superb political strategist , " B-PER said in a written statement . " I am and always will be grateful for the great contributions he has made to my campaigns and for the invaluable work he has done for me over the last two years . " B-PER declined to address the allegations directly in his resignation statement but said he was quitting to avoid becoming a campaign issue . The surprise development captivated the thousands of reporters at the convention and clearly worried some B-MISC , who had planned a triumphal celebration of B-PER 's lead over B-PER in the opinion polls . Senator B-PER I-PER , a B-LOC B-MISC , called it a " big bump " in the way of the B-PER campaign . " It comes at the worst possible time on one of the biggest days for the president , " B-PER said . B-PER was to deliver his acceptance speech at the final session of the B-MISC I-MISC opening at 8 p.m. EDT ( midnight B-MISC ) . The 50-year-old president has been dogged for years by allegations of financial wrongdoing , sexual misconduct and questionable judgment in selecting his advisers . B-MISC hope to seize on the " character " issue to bolster B-PER 's challenger B-PER I-PER in the final weeks of the campaign . Speaking in B-LOC I-LOC , B-LOC , B-PER did not directly refer to the sexual scandal but said the departure of B-PER , who had advised B-PER to chart a more centrist political course , would make B-PER drift back to the left . " B-PER has been trying to make President B-PER a B-MISC , now maybe he 'll revert to the liberal B-MISC that he really is , " B-PER told reporters . B-PER will hit the road on Friday for a bus tour across several states in his fight to become the first B-MISC incumbent re-elected to a second term since the days of B-PER I-PER I-PER . Aides said B-PER planned to spend most of Thursday in his hotel room several miles ( km ) from the convention hall working on his speech . It was apparently neglected on his long " whistle-stop " train trip to the convention , during which he revelled in contact with friendly crowds across the country 's heartland . He was also hoarse and was giving his voice a rest . But first lady B-PER I-PER I-PER told B-ORG television , " He 's really fired up . " " He wants to outline to the B-MISC people what he thinks has been accomplished in the last four years , and what he would like to see done in the next four years , " she said . " He 's very excited about this convention ... He 's excited about the campaign . But more than that , he 's very resolute about what he wants to do . " " I do n't take anything for granted . I always expect elections to get close . I expect to have a great deal of up and down days between now and then , " she said of the November 5 election date . B-PER is leading B-PER by as much as 15 points according to some polls . The campaign pits B-PER , a man of quick and withering wit and long-time public service , but stilted speaking style , against the glib and confident B-PER , who has perfected a style that makes direct eye contact with his audience . B-LOC weekly muni bond indices - B-ORG I-ORG . B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-29 The following B-LOC tax-exempt municipal bond indices were compiled by B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG for the week ending August 30 . Previous 8/30 Week Change ------------------------- Year A-rated Gen'l Obligation 4.45 % 4.40 % +0.05 10 Year A-rated Gen'l Obligation 4.90 % 4.90 % ----- 15 Year A-rated Gen'l Obligation 5.40 % 5.35 % +0.05 20 Year A-rated Gen'l Obligation 5.55 % 5.50 % +0.05 30 Year A-rated Housing Rev 6.05 % 6.00 % +0.05 -- B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , 212-859-1650 Researchers report progress in muscular dystrophy . B-LOC 1996-08-29 B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG researchers on Thursday said a new gene-therapy technique for treating muscular dystrophy disease had shown progress in laboratory animals . Word of the findings , to be published in the Oct. 1 issue of the journal " B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , " came in advance of the annual B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC weekend telethon to raise money for muscular dystrophy research . Several hurdles must be overcome before the method is used in human trials . Nevertheless , " a treatment based on the new strategy .... may have the potential to benefit many patients , " the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG Medical Centre said in a release . Muscular dystrophy is a fatal illness in which the body 's muscle tissue degenerates and is replaced by fat . Death strikes in early adulthood . Individuals with the disease have a non-working version of a gene responsible for producing a crucial muscle protein called dystrophin . In the study at the University 's B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , researchers altered a common-cold virus to carry a version of the working dystrophin gene . The virus , which also was altered to minimise its susceptibility to the immune system , was then injected into the muscle cells of mice bred to lack dystrophin genes . In the experiment , between 30 to 40 percent of the muscle fibers in one group of mice produced dystrophin for two weeks before diminishing . Similar results had been obtained previously in test-tube cell cultures , but not in live animals , the university said . The university said methods are still needed to make enough of the altered virus to treat humans , to further decrease the immune-system response to the virus , and to deliver the virus to human muscle tissue . B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-29 The hide and offal value from a typical slaughter steer for Thursday was estimated at $ 9.76 per cwt live , up $ 0.03 when compared with Wednesday 's value . - B-ORG Help-wanted ad index fell in July . B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-29 The help-wanted advertising index fell in July , the B-ORG I-ORG said Thursday , reflecting the uneven nature of the nation 's labour markets . The monthly index fell to 83.0 in July against a reading of 85.0 in June , the private business research group said . In July , the volume of help-wanted advertising fell in five of the nine B-LOC regions . " The labour market has been expanding throughout 1996 , but in a very uneven pattern , " B-ORG I-ORG economist B-PER I-PER said . " Recent want-ad figures indicate that conservative hiring plans are keeping job growth below the rate of overall economic activity . " With 2.5 percent gross domestic product growth expected for 1996 , new job growth should slowly lower the unemployment rate over the rest of the year . " With the unemployment rate staying close to about 5.5 percent over the last two years , there is a good chance the rate will slowly drop to about 5.0 percent by the end of the year , " B-PER said . The July index matched the reading for July , 1995 . The greatest declines in the volume of help-wanted advertising were in the B-LOC I-LOC , B-LOC and B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC regions . The greatest increase was in the B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC region . Police seek suspects in B-LOC I-LOC jewel heist . B-LOC I-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-29 B-LOC I-LOC police said Thursday they were seeking two men and two women in connection with a $ 690,000 theft of jewelry and cash from a guest of the Showboat Hotel and Casino . Capt . B-PER I-PER said police were seeking a man shown on a hotel videotape carrying a suitcase resembling the victim 's . " We want to talk to him , " B-PER said of the man . A second man and two women also were being sought . The thefts occurred Sunday when the victim , B-LOC I-LOC jewelry wholesaler B-PER I-PER , left three suitcases in a closet at B-ORG I-ORG in the hotel while he checked out . While he was gone , two women in their mid-twenties and an older man entered the jewelry store and tried to distract store owner B-PER I-PER . When B-PER returned two of the suitcases were missing . They contained $ 650,000 in jewelry and $ 40,000 in cash , B-PER said . He said the man on the videotape did not match the description given by the jewelry store owner . B-PER I-PER hints at more supporting evidence . B-PER I-PER B-LOC 1996-08-29 B-PER I-PER said on Thursday he was financially broken by his defence against murder charges but he was hopeful new evidence to support him would be available for a civil trial next month . The former football star was found not guilty by a criminal trial jury last October of the murders of his former wife , B-PER I-PER I-PER , and her friend , B-PER I-PER , in June 1994 . He now faces a civil suit brought by families of the victims who hold him responsible for the deaths . He told reporters a court order not to talk about his case kept him from detailing how he has fulfilled his pledge to find the killers . But he added without elaborating , " hopefully we will see some things come out in this next trial . " The judge in the civil trial has imposed a sweeping gag order that prohibits lawyers , witnesses and parties to the case from discussing it with the media or elsewhere in public . " I would love to speak about everything , " said B-PER , who vowed after his acquittal to find the killers and offered a substantial reward . His lawyers have said his defence in the civil trial that starts Sept . 17 will be that he did not kill the victims . B-PER said at the hotel news conference his plans include eventually writing another book . He added that he has had job offers but more have come from abroad than at home . " I 'm broke . I am not crying the blues . I can get along just fine , " he said . " Whatever you want to send me , I need . " He again accused the news media of erroneous reporting on his case but did not signal any plans for lawsuits as he did on Wednesday in an address at a jam-packed B-LOC church . Contrary to news reports , B-PER said , he has received support from both blacks and whites . He again dismissed charges that he had distanced himself from the black community during his successful football and commercial career , only to seek their support after he faced murder charges . A crowd of 2,000 paid $ 10 a head to hear the former star running back for the B-ORG I-ORG professional football club and a B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC member on Wednesday night . The crowd in the church was wildly supportive , showering B-PER with gifts and praise . But outside , dozens of protesters from the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG called for the church to support victims of violence instead . B-PER adviser B-PER announces resignation . The statement from B-PER said that he had submitted his resignation on Wednesday night . " While I served I sought to avoid the limelight because I did not want to become the message . Now , I resign so I will not become the issue , " he said . The announcement followed a report in the weekly supermarket tabloid B-ORG I-ORG , reprinted in Thursday 's editions of the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , that the married adviser had hired a 37-year-old prostitute on a weekly basis while visiting B-LOC to advise B-PER on his re-election campaign . B-LOC surgeon investigated for discarding foot . B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-29 Health officials said on Thursday they were investigating the discovery of an amputated foot on a beach near B-LOC to determine whether a local surgeon had improperly disposed of infectious waste . The foot , which washed up on B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC beach this month , was amputated three years ago from a child whose legs were deformed . The foot had to be removed so the infant could be fitted with a prosthesis . An orthopedic surgeon was given permission by the child 's parents and the hospital to keep the foot for research and educational purposes . Health officials said the surgeon told authorities he stored the foot in his freezer at home , but the freezer recently broke down and the contents spoiled . The surgeon , who apologised for the incident , said he decided to put the foot in a crab trap to remove the flesh . The foot later washed up on the beach . When four would-be robbers , armed and masked , showed up to rob a B-ORG I-ORG restaurant in the B-LOC I-LOC suburb of B-LOC I-LOC on Tuesday , they had no idea the shrub near the drive-through window was toting a shotgun . B-PER said he made the hot , heavy suit , which he first used in the B-ORG , by attaching strips of burlap to a camouflage outfit . B-PER and black face paint completed his disguise . He was staking out the restaurant after a series of robberies at local fast-food places . B-LOC I-LOC police said five people were arrested as a result of the 90-minute stakeout , including the four robbers and a restaurant employee who was allegedly prepared to let them in a back door .
