B-LOC TUNNEL , B-LOC 1996-08-29 The B-LOC tunnel linking B-LOC with northern B-LOC was formally reopened to traffic on Thursday under an agreement between the government and an opposition militia , witnesses said . They said dozens of trucks began moving through the tunnel from both directions after the road reopened . The B-LOC tunnel , the main supply route for B-MISC troops when they were occupying B-LOC in the 1980s , had been closed since 1994 when northern militia leader General B-PER I-PER I-PER rebelled against the B-LOC government . Witnesses said wrecked tanks and vehicles littered both sides of the heavily-mined road . Mines had been removed from the road itself , but experts of the B-LOC I-LOC mine clearance agency said it would take a week to clear the roadsides . B-MISC Deputy Prime Minister B-PER I-PER officiated at the reopening ceremony , which was delayed by several hours while the two sides argued about a mutual release of prisoners . B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-29 B-LOC 's B-ORG I-ORG on Thursday sentenced two men to death after finding them guilty of killing 23 bus passengers , including children . It said the two , after robbing the passengers , burnt them alive by sprinkling the bus with petrol and setting it on fire in the southern state of B-LOC I-LOC in 1993 . B-LOC 1996-08-29 A rampaging elephant dragged a sleeping 72-year-old woman from her bed and trampled her to death in the third such killing in two months , B-LOC police said on Thursday . The elephant crashed into B-PER I-PER I-PER house in B-LOC village earlier this week while she was asleep , they said . In the past two months elephants have killed three people in remote areas of east and central B-LOC . B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-29 B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG said it expected two 220 kilovolt ( KV ) power lines in southern B-LOC to resume service later today after being shut late Wednesday because of a wildfire raging north of B-LOC I-LOC . " They are expected to be placed in service later today , " said company spokesman B-PER I-PER , adding repair crews have been removing smoke and other fire-related residues , which had settled on the two lines . The shutdown of the 220 KV lines reduced by 500 megawatts ( MW ) the amount of power which the area received from B-ORG I-ORG 's 1,200 MW B-LOC hydroelectric facility , he said . B-PER noted two 500 KV and another 220 KV line running from the B-LOC plant to B-LOC I-LOC remained in operation , and continued to carry some of the production from B-LOC to the region . On Monday , the two 500 KV transmission cables were taken out of service , also for cleaning , for about a day . Containment of the fire has been difficult because of the hot , arid , windy weather in the region , B-PER said . " The fires keep moving back because of the winds , " he said , forcing the utility to shut those transmission lines for a second time this week . Local authorities charged a teenager for starting the blaze . In four days , the fire destroyed 20,000 acres of forest land . -- B-PER I-PER , B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG +1 212 859 1622 B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG monthly $ 0.056 / shr . B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-29 Monthly Latest Prior Amount $ 0.056 $ 0.056 Pay Sept 27 Record Sept 13 NOTE : Full name of company is B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . B-ORG I-ORG jumps on exit plan . B-PER I-PER B-LOC 1996-08-29 B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG jumped 23 percent Thursday on the expectation the company would emerge as a smaller but more profitable operation after its planned exit from the computer modem business . The B-LOC I-LOC , B-LOC , company was up 2-1/8 at 11-3/8 after its announcement Wednesday that it planned to pull out of the highly competitive modem-chip business and focus instead on the fast-growing market for computer networking equipment . " Certainly the company will be a much smaller company now , but it will be a more profitable business , " said analyst B-PER I-PER of B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . But analysts noted that B-ORG still has much painful work ahead of it , including cutting as many as 150 jobs from its workforce , which currently has 500 people , and building up the business of its B-ORG unit , which makes routing devices and chipsets for high-speed computer networks . The company has announced plans to take a charge against earnings of $ 50 million to $ 80 million to write down the value of assets and inventories and cover severance payments . B-PER I-PER of B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG said the company likely would have difficulty selling its modem-chip business . " Once you announce your intention to exit a business , it becomes a complete buyer 's market , " he said . And he said that while the company is focusing on the fastest-growing part of its business , the market for networking chips has begun to attract the attention of much-larger players such as B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . " As the market develops the question is , are they able to make that transition to be a much larger company ? " B-PER said . Other analysts were more bullish , even though the company is expected to shrink to slightly more than half its current size in sales . " It 's a positive strategic move , " said B-PER I-PER of B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . " The modem business is a low-margin , commodity business , " he said . The company 's B-ORG unit generated $ 33 million of the company 's $ 117 million in sales in the first half of the year , compared with $ 45 million in sales of modem chips , B-PER said . But the B-ORG unit is far more profitable , he said . B-ORG 's stock has fallen from a high of nearly $ 25 this year as the computer chip sector has been battered by falling prices and concern about slowing demand . -- B-LOC bureau 206-386-4848 B-ORG shares sink after profit warning . B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-29 Shares in home healthcare services company B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG fell more than 50 percent on Thursday after the company said it expected a net loss for the fiscal fourth quarter . B-LOC 1996-08-29 B-MISC security forces have broken up five espionage rings in northwestern B-LOC and arrested 41 people on charges of spying for unnamed countries , a daily newspaper said on Thursday . B-ORG I-ORG quoted the B-LOC I-LOC province security chief as saying those held confessed to gathering confidential information , photographing strategic sites , doing propaganda against state officials and " spreading B-MISC " . B-LOC I-LOC oil outlook - B-LOC holds the key . B-LOC 1996-08-29 B-LOC will continue to hold the key to the middle distillates product market in the B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC in the short term , traders in the region said on Thursday . They said premiums on high quality jet kerosene have widened to around $ 1 , and are likely to remain strong in the near term . " On the jet kerosene side we must be cautious about quality . Some are commanding a very good premium of 95 cents to one dollar . It 's been 99 cents to B-LOC . This will stay at this sort of price premium for a while , " one said . " But for normal jet the weakened demand is quite noticeable , the premium is around 45-50 cents . The differential is not normally as wide as this , " he added . Another put the premium for jet kerosene at between 65 and 75 cents . One trader said despite the fact that some kerosene was in storage at B-LOC ports , demand looked to exceed supply in the near term . Jet kerosene was assessed at $ 27.40 - $ 27.70 a barrel fob B-LOC on Thursday , up from $ 27.22 last week . Dealers expected premiums to stick around current levels for the next two or three weeks , before they get a boost in the second half of September from demand for October cargoes . Gas oil , assessed at $ 24.00 - $ 24.20 a barrel fob B-LOC , was little changed on Thursday from last week 's $ 24.10 - $ 24.24 . " On gas oil , in the near term demand and supply are balanced to a bit short , there are some enquiries into east B-LOC and short covering in B-LOC , " said one trader . " The B-MISC have awarded three cargoes , but the question is whether they will come out for more , " he added . B-LOC has acquired 120,000 tonnes of diesel in three cargoes , bound for the west coast , in its October tender . Traders said the award could be B-LOC 's lowest in recent years . " After B-ORG 's very small purchase of 120,000 tonnes , I 'm still suspicious that they will buy more in the second half of October , " another said . But traders see the market remaining tight in the short-term , with some surplus arising closer to October . " I see an overhang of gas oil further out , " one said . " Gas oil will remain tight in the short term up to mid-September with the premium of around $ 1 for 0.5 percent ( sulphur material ) . In the second half of September and October we see the premium coming off to 70-75 cents . " Traders said there was not much demand for one percent sulphur material gas oil , with the premium at 40 to 45 cents . B-LOC police catch ancient manuscript thieves . FEATURE - Rich new detail on B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC unearthed . B-PER I-PER B-LOC 1996-08-29 A freed black man writes to his still-enslaved wife , a mother pleads with B-PER I-PER on behalf of her son and a maimed soldier poses for an official photograph in newly reopened records that bring the B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC back to life . Working in the basement of the B-ORG I-ORG , members of the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG are organising the military records of volunteers who fought for the B-LOC so that they can be preserved on microfilm . The faded documents have been stowed away in the B-ORG since it opened in 1935 and have rarely seen the light of day . Each soldier 's file is a gold mine of information : enlistment papers , muster rolls , medical records , discharge certificates , letters and photographs . Since the project began almost two years ago , corps volunteers have focused on B-MISC I-MISC troops , preparing records in time for the unveiling in B-LOC this year of a special memorial to black soldiers who fought in the war . More than 185,000 black soldiers fought and 37,000 died . In one letter , a black soldier heading B-LOC wrote his wife , " though great is the present national difficulties yet I look forward to a brighter day when I shall have the oportunity of seeing you in the full enjoyment of freedom . " I would like to no ( sic ) if you are still in slavery if you are , it will not be long before we shall have crushed the system that now oppreses you for in the course of three months you shall have your liberty . Great is the outpouring of the coloured people that is now rallying with the heart of lions against the very curse that has separated you and me . " In another letter dated January 1865 , a well-to-do B-LOC matron wrote to B-PER to plead for her son , who faced a dishonourable discharge from the B-ORG . " B-PER is a prisoner for a thoughtless act of folly , while those who have done nothing for the cause are free , " she wrote . B-PER 's notation on the letter read : " If his colonel will say in writing on this sheet he is willing to receive this man back to the regiment , I will pardon and send him . " The soldier was subsequently pardoned . While the letters speak to the anguish of separation , a photograph of a black amputee speaks to the terrible physical cost of the war . In a picture required for his military discharge , Pvt . B-PER I-PER , with haunted eyes , posed bare-chested to reveal his missing arm and leg , blown off during a battle at B-LOC , B-LOC , in July 1864 . The work on black troops has provided new insight into the rhythms of plantation talk and culture , said B-PER I-PER , professor of history at B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG and editor of Gen . B-PER I-PER 's papers . " These ( writings ) are not only poetic but a linguistic treasure trove . This is the first generation of B-MISC I-MISC that really can express itself without fear and punishment , " B-PER said . " I think there 's probably a whole lot of material that would expand our understanding of the sociology of the war , " said B-PER I-PER , director of B-ORG I-ORG at B-ORG I-ORG in B-LOC . The war between the B-LOC and B-LOC raged for nearly four years , claimed the lives of half a million B-MISC and forever seared the nation 's consciousness . B-MISC records have already been preserved . They were put on microfilm about 30 years ago through a grant from the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . The B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG is mostly retirees joined by students during the school year . Director B-PER I-PER , who has shepherded the project from the beginning , predicts it will take up to a decade to complete . The work was inspired by a B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG plan to put computer databases at B-MISC I-MISC battlefields across the country so that B-MISC might research their ancestors . The records also provide insight into medical thinking of the day . One soldier was discharged because of " mental incapacity and inebetude ( sic ) of the brain , alleged by the Patient to be connected with a fall on the head but believed to arise from long continued and excessive masturbation . " B-PER arrives in B-LOC on day of re-nomination . B-LOC 1996-08-28 President B-PER I-PER arrived in B-LOC on Wednesday as the B-MISC convention prepared to re-nominate him for a second four-year term . B-PER flew in by helicopter from B-LOC I-LOC , B-LOC , after ending a four-day , 559-mile trip aboard a campaign train from B-LOC . New bomb attacks on B-LOC despite crackdown vow . B-PER I-PER B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-29 Separatist guerrillas planted two bombs overnight at government offices on the B-MISC B-MISC island of B-LOC despite fresh warnings of a crackdown by B-LOC , police said on Thursday . In the latest in a wave of attacks , a two kg ( four lb ) bomb seriously damaged two floors of B-ORG I-ORG offices located just 50 metres ( yards ) from a police station in the centre of the island capital B-ORG . No one was hurt . A second device , packed with five kg ( 10 lbs ) of explosive , was defused before it could go off , police said . The new attacks followed by a day a warning of a new " get-tough " policy by B-LOC toward the separatists , who seek greater autonomy . Interior Minister B-PER I-PER , under fire for staging secret talks with one of the largest of several rival underground nationalist groups , told the daily B-ORG I-ORG in a statement he had given " firm orders " to police to round up those responsible for the bombings and bring them to justice . Judges on the island had accused B-LOC of taking a lax stance on guerrilla violence while conducting secret but widely-reported talks with separatists which have now failed . The latest bombing , close on the heels of the new orders , brought charges that police were powerless . " No searches , no arrests , no police reinforcements visible on the island , despite the ministry 's promises , " the daily B-ORG lamented . " On the island , as at the B-LOC I-LOC ( the B-ORG I-ORG 's B-LOC address ) , people are well aware who is who and who is doing what . It is time to end this nightly farce , " said the pro-government daily B-ORG I-ORG in an editorial . No one immediately claimed responsibility for Thursday 's incidents , which brought to 23 the number of guerrilla attacks on the resort island since mid-August , when separatist guerrillas ended a shaky seven-month truce . B-LOC has been racked by low-level separatist-inspired violence , principally directed against government targets , for two decades . The daily B-ORG I-ORG reported on Wednesday some separatist movements were considering taking their attacks to the B-MISC mainland on the principle that " 300 grammes of explosives on the continent have more impact than 300 kilos in B-LOC " . The newspaper said separatists may take advantage of social unrest widely expected on the mainland in coming weeks over government austerity plans to stoke a popular backlash against the government . B-LOC 's B-ORG to open B-LOC forest products bourse . B-LOC 1996-08-29 B-MISC options and derivatives exchange B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG said on Thursday it would open an electronic bourse for forest industry products in B-LOC in the first half of 1997 . " Together with subsidiaries B-ORG , the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG and B-ORG I-ORG , B-ORG I-ORG will open an international electronic bourse for forest products in the first half of 1997 , " B-ORG I-ORG said in a statement . The first commodity to be traded on the B-ORG bourse will be pulp , but B-ORG said trade would be extended to include products such as timber , recycled paper and other paper qualities . " Through the establishment of B-ORG , B-LOC will have a commodities bourse for forest products which complements existing bourses for oil , metals and ' softs ' ( coffee , sugar and cocoa ) , " B-ORG said . B-ORG was the result of a three-year project run in cooperation between B-ORG and representatives of the forest industry , the company said . Huge swings in the price of pulp over the past few years have made pulp producers ' profitability unpredictable , and made investing in new production capacity a risky business . " Without the ability to hedge prices , changes in the world market price for pulp has had an immediate impact on players ' profitability , " B-ORG said . It said global production of pulp amounted to around 200 million tonnes per year , of which around 20 percent or 40 million tonnes was sold on the spot market . At current prices , the value of this production was around $ 25 billion . B-ORG will be both a marketplace and a clearing house , B-ORG said , adding that the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG had been informed of B-ORG 's plans . B-ORG 's clearing operation will be covered by the parent company guarantee issued by B-ORG I-ORG to its wholly-owned bourses and clearing organisations . -- B-LOC newsroom , +46-8-700 1006 B-LOC oil stock levels fall . Fuel oil inventories dipped slightly with some straight-run arrivals , but fair bunkering demand removing more material . B-LOC 1996-08-29 About 200 B-MISC anti-nuclear activists protested on Thursday against nuclear waste transportation by re-enacting scenes from a demonstration they staged in May that turned into a violent clash with police . Activists dressed as police brandished batons and firing a theatre-prop water cannon at " demonstrators " . Police who had turned out in force all around the government quarter fearing violence looked on in amusement . Last May dozens of demonstrators and police were injured in violent clashes around the B-LOC nuclear waste depot as hundreds of protesters tried to block a delivery of waste by train and truck . B-LOC police arrest five over double Mafia killing . B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-29 B-MISC Police said on Thursday they had arrested five people in connection with the slaying of the daughter and 14-year-old nephew of a Mafia boss earlier this week . B-PER I-PER , 22 , and B-PER I-PER were gunned down in a cemetery in this eastern B-MISC city on Tuesday in a crime which shocked even hardened anti-Mafia investigators . The arrests followed a tip-off from a married couple who unexpectedly showed up at investigators ' offices on Wednesday . " They wanted to get a weight off their consciences , " a police spokesman said . He added the couple had also shed light on the murder last year of the wife of Mafia boss B-PER I-PER . B-PER was shot as she knelt praying by the tomb of her young husband , who was himself killed last year in a Mafia ambush . B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-29 Thieves stole almost 2,000 B-MISC pounds ( $ 3,000 ) from the officers ' canteen of a B-LOC jail on Thursday while warders slept in a room upstairs . Police said the thieves intercepted a woman arriving to work at the canteen , forced her to open the safe where takings were kept and made off with the cash . While the robbery was going on , several officers were asleep in a room over the canteen , which is in the grounds of the prison on B-LOC 's southwest coast . B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-29 B-MISC police said on Thursday they had arrested a 61-year-old man after he fired blank shots at prostitutes he blamed for spreading B-MISC . " Although fake guns are legal , the use he made of them means he could be tried , " a police official said . Bodies found at site of B-MISC jet crash - officials . B-LOC 1996-08-29 Bodies have been sighted but no survivors have yet been found at the site of Thursday 's crash of a B-MISC airliner on B-LOC 's remote B-MISC island of B-LOC , B-MISC officials said . " We have found dead people , " said B-PER I-PER , the island 's deputy governor , told B-MISC television . The B-MISC news agency B-ORG quoted another official on the island as saying no survivors had been found . The B-ORG I-ORG B-MISC I-MISC flight from B-LOC , carrying 129 passengers and a crew of 12 , crashed in bad weather 10 km ( six miles ) east of B-LOC , the island 's only airstrip , officials said . First rescuers arrived shortly after 1 p.m. ( 1100 B-MISC ) and reported soon afterwards that most of the three-engine jet 's wreckage was scattered around the top of the small B-LOC mountain while the rest had slid down the mountainside . Air traffic officials said they had lost contact with the flight , scheduled to arrive at around 10.15 a.m. ( 0815 B-MISC ) , shortly before it was due to land . B-LOC is a B-MISC coal-mining settlement . The only other community is in the B-MISC village of B-LOC . B-LOC and B-LOC share the island 's resources under a treaty dating back to the 1920s . Galeforce winds and heavy rains batter B-LOC . B-LOC 1996-08-29 Torrential rains and galeforce winds battered B-LOC on Thursday causing widespread damage as some areas had more rainfall in 24 hours than they normally get in a month , the meteorological office said . Cellars were flooded , trees uprooted and roofs damaged , but there were no reports of any injuries , an interior affairs ministry spokesman said . Some trains were delayed as fallen trees blocked lines . B-LOC received 5.6 cm ( 2.24 inches ) of water in the past 24 hours -- compared to an average 7.4 cm ( 2.96 inches ) per month -- but in several communes in the south of the country up to 8 cm ( 3.2 inches ) fell , the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) said . The B-ORG spokesman said that near the eastern city of B-LOC , a group of boy scouts camping in a low-lying meadow had to be evacuated as water flooded their tents . The rain also severely hindered B-MISC investigators ' excavations in the southern village of B-LOC , where they are looking for bodies in one of the houses of the main character in a paedophile sex-and-murder scandal . But the coastal towns got off lightly as the flooding that had been expected due to a combination of spring tides and high winds failed to materialise . B-ORG shares up 65 pesetas on H1 results . B-LOC 1996-08-29 Shares in B-MISC oil and chemicals group B-ORG were up 65 pesetas to 4,150 after the company announced net first half profits fell 1.1 percent to 61.45 billion pesetas on the previous year . This was close to the market 's forecast of net profits of 61.94 billion . Shares in B-ORG shot up 100 pesetas to 4,175 shortly after the figures , having traded down 10 pesetas before the figures were released . " It 's madness , " said an analyst at a B-LOC brokerage , adding that the market had overreacted to the news . " People were waiting for the results to come out before buying . The rise has been very quick and very crazy . " He predicted a correction , perhaps as early as this session . -- B-ORG I-ORG +34 1 585 2161 B-LOC forces kill guerrillas - papers . Security forces also killed an unspecified number of members of a rebel gang on Wednesday in the B-LOC suburb of B-LOC , B-ORG I-ORG newspaper reported . B-LOC 1996-08-29 B-MISC police said on Thursday they had arrested two men suspected of sexually abusing a captive 13-year-old girl , but did not believe the case was linked to others in B-LOC . The men , both B-MISC aged about 40 , were arrested last Saturday in the western town of B-LOC in a raid on a luxury boat owned by one of them . The girl was being held on the boat and had sought help from a passer-by , police chief inspector B-PER I-PER said . " This is an individual case and I do n't have any evidence linking the suspects to any other cases , " B-PER said . The girl was taken to hospital . The men could face charges carrying up to six to 10 years in prison , he said . Witnesses had reported seeing many young women and some girls who looked clearly underage at parties around the boat in recent weeks , the daily newspaper B-ORG said . B-LOC 1996-08-29 The chairman of B-MISC components and engineering group B-ORG I-ORG said on Thursday the firm remained confident about the general prospects for its operating margins despite pressure from unsettled markets . In an interview following its first-half results , which included a less optimistic forecast for the second half of this year than it had made in the past , Sir B-PER I-PER said B-ORG had taken defensive action to protect it from patchy markets . Looking at market prospects , he said : " I think our best judgment at this stage is that it will probably bumble along in the rather mixed way it 's been in the first half . " " It 's very difficult to predict the market ( trend ) this year . It could be better , or it could be worse , " B-PER added , echoing the demand uncertainty across automotive industries . " You can see anxieties in B-LOC and B-LOC , in particular , beginning to grow and develop . B-LOC , however , is looking a little better , " he said . Compared with the end of last year , when B-ORG predicted a sluggish first half and a rebound later in 1996 , B-PER said : " I think the difference ( now ) is the first half has not actually been as bad as some felt it was going to be , but equally we 're certainly not predicting a recovery in the second half . " Against this background , B-PER said the group was glad it had rationalised and destocked even though this had pressed margins , which had slipped to 9.5 percent from 11.3 percent a year ago . " I think the figure of 9.5 percent on the first half , when you consider the fact that we 've been destocking , the fairly mixed customer demand , and the fact that we sold the ( southern B-MISC ) mines actually is not bad . " It does show how easily we should be able to bounce back over 10 percent again , " he added , saying : " We continue to feel very relaxed about our general view that we would average 10 percent profit margins over the cycle . " " We 've always taken the view that we are the sort of company that 's quite capable of working in difficult circumstances -- we 're rather used to it . And we feel very confident that we 're doing all the right things , " B-PER said . " When the ( profit ) figures will bounce back up again is just a function of markets recovering just a fraction , " he added . Commenting on the continued struggle to get control of B-MISC piston maker B-ORG , which has been hampered by regulatory obstacles , B-PER said B-ORG 's confidence " continues to improve " that it may eventually be able to proceed . -- B-PER I-PER , B-ORG I-ORG , +44 171 542 8716 Earthquake jolts B-MISC I-MISC B-LOC I-LOC . B-LOC 1996-08-29 An earthquake measuring 5.5 on the B-PER scale shook B-MISC I-MISC upper B-LOC I-LOC on Thursday but there were no reports of injuries , B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG said . It said the quake , centred near the small town of B-LOC , was strongly felt in the cities of B-LOC and B-LOC . Some minor damage had been reported in the spa town of B-LOC . B-LOC I-LOC is prone to frequent earthquakes but they rarely cause major damage . The country has only 3.5 million people in an area about the size of B-LOC or B-LOC . B-LOC I-LOC 's B-PER sees growth , smooth transition . B-PER I-PER B-LOC 1996-08-29 B-LOC I-LOC Financial Secretary B-PER I-PER said on Thursday he expected the territory 's economy to keep growing at around five percent but with some fluctuations from year to year . B-PER , who made the remarks during a visit to B-LOC I-LOC , also spoke strongly in favour of keeping the B-LOC I-LOC dollar pegged to its B-LOC counterpart , and said negotiations with B-LOC on next year 's budget were going smoothly . B-LOC I-LOC 's economy grew by only 3.1 percent in the first quarter , down from 5.9 percent a year earlier , and some private sector economists have revised downwards their predictions for the 1996 year . Second quarter growth estimates will be released when the B-LOC I-LOC government issues its half-yearly economic report on Friday . " Our trend growth rate of five percent in real terms is pretty solid , " B-PER told a news conference after meeting B-LOC I-LOC Finance Minister B-PER I-PER . " There will be fluctuations in individual years , but it wo n't be a big margin , " he said . He said inflation was under control and the B-LOC I-LOC dollar was " rock solid " . Its link to the B-LOC dollar had proved an engine of growth for the past 12 years . " There 's absolutely no economic or financial or political reason for us to change . A lot of investment in B-LOC I-LOC , some of which ( is ) by B-LOC , is predicated on the link continuing . " B-LOC will hand over B-LOC I-LOC to B-MISC sovereignty at midnight on June 30 , 1997 . B-PER said three sets of meetings with B-MISC authorities on B-LOC I-LOC 's 1997-98 budget , which will span the transition period , had gone smoothly . " None of our basic precepts have been challenged . " B-LOC I-LOC will retain its own currency after the handover , run its own financial and monetary policy and have control over its own foreign exchange reserves . It will have no duty to contribute any taxes to B-LOC , B-PER said . He described the condition of the property market as " very good indeed " . " You know , we went through a little climb and a little trough over the last few years . Because of speculation in the market we introduced certain measures , but they are not draconian measures , and we brought it down to earth . " B-PER said the market would continue to appreciate because property and land were scarce . The government would put land on the market to stop rentals " going through the roof " , but this would mean reclamation , with possible environmental problems . " There will be on the whole a slightly upward climb , consistent with our economic growth rate , " he said in reference to the property market . B-PER , the third senior figure in the government after the governor and chief secretary , said his stated aim was to serve as financial secretary for two years under B-MISC rule and three years under B-LOC . B-LOC dollar ends higher , narrow trade seen . B-LOC 1996-08-29 The B-LOC dollar closed slightly firmer on Thursday amid tight B-LOC dollar liquidity in the banking system , and dealers said the rate was likely to move narrowly in the near term . The B-LOC dollar fell in early trade on month-end B-LOC dollar demand , but the downtrend was later reversed as B-LOC dollar liquidity tightened . " Banks do not want to hold big B-LOC dollar positions at this moment , " said one dealer , adding that the rate was likely to hover around current levels . B-LOC civil servants contest ban on B-LOC panel . B-LOC I-LOC 1996-08-29 Senior B-LOC I-LOC civil servants were given the go-ahead on Thursday to challenge a government ban on them standing for the B-MISC panel to choose the territory 's first post-handover leader and lawmakers . The B-ORG I-ORG ruled that a judicial hearing contesting the ban would be heard on September 11 , three days before the nomination period for the B-ORG I-ORG closes . The government maintains the ban , announced earlier this month , is necessary to avoid a possible conflict of interest because civil servants are involved in determining government policy . Civil servants argue the ban stymies their political rights . The 400-strong B-ORG I-ORG will select B-LOC I-LOC 's future chief executive to replace the B-MISC governor and a provisional legislature to take over from the elected chamber which B-LOC plans to dissolve . B-LOC I-LOC , a B-MISC colony for more than 150 years , will be handed back to B-LOC at midnight on June 30 next year . B-LOC intends to dismantle the territory 's first fully-elected legislature because it opposes B-LOC 's recent electoral reforms and install an interim appointed chamber , a decision that has generated considerable controversy . The judicial review sought by directorate-grade bureaucrats will apply to only about 1,000 of the approximately 33,000 civil servants affected . Police unions are not contesting the ban , which affects all 27,000 officers , and nor are the very top tier of B-LOC I-LOC 's mandarin class , the policy secretaries . More than 16,000 application forms for places on the B-ORG I-ORG have been handed out since the nomination period opened . It closes on September 14 . B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG expected to shut B-ORG I-ORG . B-LOC 1996-08-29 B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) is expected to shutdown its 60,000 barrel-per-day ( bpd ) crude distillation unit ( B-ORG ) in September , an industry source said on Thursday . " They think something is stuck , " the source said . " But nothing has been decided as they are still waiting for an X-ray machine to determine the problem . " The source said the problem was discovered during the past month during which time B-ORG I-ORG 's production has varied from maximum capacity of 60,000 bpd to as low as 40,000 bpd , depending on the crude being run . " We are having a lot of problems , " said a source . An earlier problem with B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG B-ORG arose on July 24 when an industry source said the B-ORG would be closed down briefly in August for repairs to a heat exchanger . But by mid-August , a company spokesman said repairs had been carried out without any shutdown . The 285,000 bpd B-ORG refinery is co-owned by the B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , B-ORG I-ORG and B-ORG , the joint-venture of B-LOC majors B-ORG I-ORG and B-ORG I-ORG . -- B-ORG I-ORG ( +65-8703086 ) B-ORG H1 net rises to 332.66 mln baht . B-LOC 1996-08-29 B-MISC viscose fibre maker B-ORG I-ORG said on Thursday it expected to post negative group results in the second half of the year after posting losses in the first six months . " A preview of the second half of 1996 does not reveal any signs of a significant improvement in market conditions , " B-ORG said in a statement released ahead of its earnings conference . For the first six months of the year , B-ORG said it posted a group pre-tax loss of 84.5 million schillings from a profit of 160 million in the year-ago period . The group attributed the first-half losses to weak demand and falling prices of viscose fibres , as well as sluggish economies in the B-LOC . -- B-PER I-PER , B-LOC newsroom , +431 53112 274 B-LOC faults B-LOC over B-MISC gathering . B-LOC 1996-08-28 B-LOC , fighting a vicious war against B-MISC fundamentalist guerrillas , attacked B-LOC on Wednesday for allowing B-MISC groups to meet in B-LOC . The B-MISC gathering , due to be held in B-LOC on September 8 , has triggered concern and anger in several other B-MISC countries like B-LOC which is also fighting armed B-MISC fundamentalists . B-MISC I-MISC groups have also voiced protest because they said B-MISC I-MISC B-ORG as well as the banned B-MISC B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG ( B-ORG ) are among those radical B-MISC attending the conference . A foreign ministry spokesman said in a statement read on B-MISC television that B-LOC " has received with concern the information over a meeting of terrorist groups working against the interests of the B-MISC and B-MISC world . " " B-LOC expresses its sharp rejection of a meeting putting together masterminds and ideologists and financers of terrorism , " the spokesman said , adding the B-MISC government has asked the B-MISC embassy in B-LOC for clarifications . The B-MISC ambassador in B-LOC has also asked for clarification from the B-ORG I-ORG over the meeting of B-MISC groups . B-LOC said " they are clearly working to undermine the stability " of B-MISC countries . B-MISC Foreign Secretary B-PER I-PER said on Tuesday from B-LOC his government would only take action against the planned B-MISC gathering in B-LOC if B-MISC law was broken . " People who wish to hold conferences of course do n't need to seek permission from the government in B-LOC , " he said . An estimated 50,000 people , including more than 110 foreigners , have been killed in B-LOC 's violence pitting B-MISC rebels against government forces since early 1992 when authorities in B-LOC cancelled a general election in which B-ORG had taken a commanding lead . B-LOC I-LOC ponders B-PER 's role if B-PER wins . B-PER I-PER B-LOC I-LOC The outcome of the November elections emerged as a hot topic on B-LOC I-LOC this week as financial pundits debated whether B-PER I-PER might forgo a second term as B-ORG secretary if President B-PER is re-elected . Concern centred on the currency markets since B-PER 's tour de force has been his unflagging support of the dollar . Speculation that B-PER might not stay in his post grew after he sidestepped questions about any future B-ORG post during television interviews at the B-MISC convention in B-LOC this week . Should B-PER leave , B-LOC I-LOC would worry that he might take his strong-dollar policy with him . B-PER 's predecessor at the B-ORG , B-PER I-PER , was viewed with suspicion by some in the financial markets who thought he had tried to push down the dollar to gain an edge in trade negotiations with B-LOC . " Obviously , under the B-PER administration , we 've seen two distinctively different dollar policies , " said B-PER I-PER , an international economist at B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG " Under B-PER , the B-LOC has certainly looked for a strong dollar . " That strategy , backed up by timely instances of joint central bank intervention , helped the dollar battle back from B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC lows of 1.3438 B-MISC marks on March 8 , 1995 , and 79.75 B-MISC yen on April 19 , 1995 . Currently , the dollar stands at about 1.48 marks and 109 yen . B-PER was widely hailed as the architect of the dollar 's comeback , using skills and expertise gained in 26 years on B-LOC I-LOC , part of which were spent as co-chairman of B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG B-ORG . " B-PER has done a fine job in that position , " said B-PER I-PER , a portfolio manager at B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG , which manages just under $ 1 billion in global stocks and bonds . " Anyone who would come in there to replace him would have awfully big shoes to fill . " Fear that a new B-ORG secretary might favour a return to B-MISC policy could spell trouble for financial markets . Some overseas investors might shy away from buying B-LOC stocks and bonds or even sell them when the dollar is weakening . As for B-ORG I-ORG securities , B-PER explained that B-PER I-PER 's reappointment as chairman of the B-ORG I-ORG and the outlook for the federal budget were more important than whether B-PER continues at the B-ORG . " Although , if we did get someone that was seen as looking for a dollar depreciation , it would probably hurt capital flows to the B-LOC I-LOC , " said B-PER , adding that could hurt B-LOC stocks and , to a lesser degree , bonds . Still , markets may have little to fear from any B-PER successor because the firm dollar policy has yielded positive results . If that is true , then any new B-ORG chief would need to be as effective as B-PER in convincing markets that the B-LOC I-LOC does indeed want a strong currency . " If he left , the first question people would ask the next guy is , ' What 's your view on the dollar ? ' " said B-PER I-PER , portfolio manager of B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG . " And all I can say as a piece of advice is that they 'd better say exactly the same thing ( as B-PER ) , if not stronger , " B-PER said . " Otherwise , you get selling out of B-LOC and B-LOC again . B-PER I-PER B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-30 B-PER I-PER of B-LOC confirmed her status as the world 's number one woman sprinter when she retained her title at the world cycling championships on Friday . B-PER beat B-LOC 's B-PER I-PER 2-0 in the best-of-three matches final to add the world title to the B-MISC gold medal she won in July . B-LOC also took third place in the sprint , B-PER I-PER defeating ex-world champion B-PER I-PER of B-LOC 2-0 . B-PER , 25 , will be aiming to complete a track double when she defends her 500 metres time trial title on Saturday . The other final of the night , the women 's 24-kms points race , also ended in success for the reigning champion . B-LOC 's B-PER I-PER fought off a spirited challenge from B-MISC B-PER I-PER to take the title for a second year . B-LOC , the only nation to have two riders in the field , made full use of their numerical superiority . B-PER I-PER helped B-PER to build an unbeatable points lead before snatching the bronze medal . B-PER , a former medallist in the points event , led the race at half distance . " I went so close this time , but having two riders certainly gave the B-MISC an advantage , " she said . The first six riders lapped the field , which left former world champion B-PER I-PER of the B-LOC down in seventh place despite having the second highest points score . B-MISC champion B-PER I-PER of B-LOC also missed the winning attack and finished a disappointing 10th . CYCLING - WORLD TRACK CHAMPIONSHIP RESULTS . B-LOC , B-LOC 1996-08-30 B-MISC central defender B-PER I-PER has completed a 300,000 pounds sterling ( $ 467,000 ) move to B-ORG from B-MISC club B-ORG , the B-MISC premier division club said on Friday . B-PER has signed a two-year contract and will make his debut against B-PER in the B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC on Tuesday . But he will be ineligible for the rest of B-ORG 's B-MISC I-MISC campaign as he has already played for B-ORG in this season 's B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC . B-ORG manager B-PER I-PER said : " It 's unfortunate for us that B-PER cannot play in B-LOC but he will help us achieve things in domestic competition . " I have been watching him for several weeks now and have no doubts he brings real quality to the side . He has a great deal of experience and I 'm sure he will quickly establish himself in both the team and the affection of our fans . " The 32-year-old defender played seven seasons with B-ORG and was with B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG for five seasons . He said former B-ORG team mate B-PER I-PER , who now plays for B-MISC premier league B-ORG , was influential in his move to B-LOC . " I 'm a very good friend of B-PER and spoke to him recently about coming to B-ORG and he was very positive about it , " B-PER said . " He said I would really enjoy life there and that I would settle in in terms of football as well . That , and the fact he is only a few hours drive away , influenced my decision to come to B-ORG .
